title: Advanced Aeronautical Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Work with the latest industry-standard software in a world-leading research department.
structure_json: {"Pre-study": {"groups": {"Pre-study": {"items": [{"title": "Revision Stress Analysis", "description": "Refresh your knowledge on the basics of stress analysis and learn about common stress analysis techniques."}, {"title": "Introduction to Programming", "description": "Learn about the scientific programming tools and languages required to perform numerical computation."}, {"title": "Introductory Mathematics", "description": "Revise essential mathematics."}, {"title": "Control Theory", "description": "Gain an insight into state-space methods for the analysis and design of control systems."}, {"title": "Introduction to Compressible Flow", "description": "Understand the basic effects of compressibility on fluid flow and evaluate the behaviour of compressible flows."}, {"title": "Aircraft Performance and Flight Mechanics", "description": "Refresh your knowledge of flight mechanics and how aircraft performance can be predicted on key characteristics."}, {"title": "Introduction to Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Refresher course on the basics of fluid mechanics."}]}}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerospace Structures", "description": "Learn how to analyse and design aerospace structures such as the wing and fuselage."}, {"title": "Applied Aerodynamics", "description": "Gain an understanding of the basic principles for the analysis and design of aerofoils and wings and learn about quantitative design."}, {"title": "Emerging Technology for Green Aviation", "description": "Explore the key technological advances and principles needed to achieve greener aviation. Become familiar with the main design challenges associated with achieving this goal."}, {"title": "Major Individual Research Project", "description": "Complete an extensive four-month individual research project, made up of a piece of individual research which must include some element of originality and can be wholly experimental, wholly theoretical, or a mixture of the two. You'll select projects from a list of topics proposed by university staff and by industry, and your work will be assessed by progress in conducting the work, a dissertation of about 10,000 words, and an oral presentation. "}, {"title": "Systems Engineering for Unmanned Aerial Vehicles", "description": "Improve your understanding of engineering systems and how to apply their tools to the design of UAVs."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Manufacturing", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of the relationship between design, manufacturing processing and materials properties and become familiar with the different types of manufacturing processes."}, {"title": "Advanced Propulsion", "description": "Conduct aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis of propulsion systems for high-speed flight."}, {"title": "Aeroelasticity", "description": "Learn the theory and practice of aeroelasticity in fixed-wing aircraft and become familiar with the most common models used for aeroelastic analysis."}, {"title": "Aerothermodynamics of Launchers and ReEntry Vehicles", "description": "Explore the unique flow physics experienced by vehicles travelling at hypersonic speeds in an atmosphere and develop your understanding of aerodynamic analysis and experimentation."}, {"title": "Analytical Characterisation of Composite Materials", "description": "Uncover the advanced analytical techniques used to characterise the properties of polymers, fibres and fibre-matrix interfaces."}, {"title": "Artificial Intelligence for Aerospace Engineers", "description": "Become familiar with the most popular machine learning and AI algorithms used in the aerospace industry, and build on your existing knowledge of AI models."}, {"title": "Composite Innovation – Nanocomposites and Structural Power", "description": "Cultivate your knowledge of the latest composite innovations including nanophase reinforced composites and multifunctional composites."}, {"title": "Computational Mechanics", "description": "Understand advanced concepts required for the application of the finite element method to the analysis of aerostructures."}, {"title": "Control Theory for Flow Management", "description": "Discover the rapidly expanding area of flow management and flow control while exploring novel ways in which fluid flow may be controlled."}, {"title": "Finite Elements", "description": "Expand your understanding of the finite element method and learn about its practical use in solving structural problems."}, {"title": "Flow Instability & Transition", "description": "Learn how modern mathematical techniques are used to predict conditions when laminar-turbulent transition takes place."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Unpick the key principles of innovation management, from knowledge co-creation to developing sustainable business models."}, {"title": "Lightweight Structures", "description": "Explore the mechanics of composite materials and foams and learn best practice for analysing lightweight structures."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Apply orbital mechanics and rigid body mechanics to a wide range of problems in non-atmospheric flight."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Develop your understanding of methodologies for spacecraft structure design, from launchers to satellite platforms to habitable inflatable modules."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Learn industry standard methodology for spacecraft systems analysis and design."}, {"title": "Structural Integrity and Health Monitoring", "description": "Gain an in-depth knowledge of the fundamentals of safe design and learn to apply damage detection techniques to different types of structures."}, {"title": "Turbulence and Turbulence Modelling", "description": "Develop your foundational knowledge and physical understanding to critically assess turbulent modules relevant to research and industry."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home title: Advanced Chemical Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Undertake advanced study in chemical engineering and enhance your knowledge of basic sciences, mathematics and computing.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Process Design", "description": "Explore advanced topics in process design, with an emphasis on process modelling and optimisation theory and associated software packages."}, {"title": "Advanced Environmental Engineering", "description": "Analyse how chemical discharges affect the planet and how the increased greenhouse effect, ozone depletion, smog formation and acid rain arise from human influences on natural cycles."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules (Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Bioprocess Engineering", "description": "Review the relevant fundamentals of biochemistry, microbiology, and molecular biology, and explore the principles behind fermentation processes."}, {"title": "Advanced Optimisation for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Learn about state-of-the-art optimisation-based techniques for process synthesis, process design and molecular design, with a particular focus on mathematical programming."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Operations", "description": "Learn how to formulate, solve and interpret meaningful optimisation problems through the use of optimality conditions and common solution techniques."}, {"title": "Applied Spectroscopy", "description": "Understand a range of analytical techniques needed to address challenges being faced by industry and explore leading spectroscopic methods."}, {"title": "Biochemical Engineering", "description": "Explore the many techniques used in biotechnology that differ from chemical engineering, followed by a review of conventional downstream separation approaches including Cell Lysis, Extraction, Chromatography and more."}, {"title": "Colloid and Interface Science", "description": "Delve into the fundamentals of colloid and interface science and analyse the nature of the various interparticle forces."}, {"title": "Dynamic Behaviour of Process Systems", "description": "Learn how to systematically develop physics-based models of chemical processes and solve them using state-of-the-art computational tools."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop a fundamental understanding of nonlinear dynamical systems to better appreciate complex phenomena in nature and a variety of chemical and biological engineering technological processes."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop your understanding of advanced statistical learning and machine learning to solve a range of real-life chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "Modelling of Biological Systems", "description": "Learn the basic tools for modelling intracellular processes as well as modelling at cellular and higher levels."}, {"title": "Molecular Modelling of Fluids", "description": "Understand the application of molecular theory and simulation in modelling fluids and fluid mixtures."}, {"title": "Practical Process Engineering in the Oil and Gas Industry", "description": "Understand the general workflows of facilities engineering teams and learn how to perform simple process and pipeline hydraulics hand calculations."}, {"title": "Product Characterisation", "description": "Develop your knowledge and experience in current experimental techniques and learn to analyse and apply these techniques to selected products."}, {"title": "Transport Processes in Biological Systems", "description": "Assess basic principles and concepts of fluid flow, heat and mass transfer relevant to physiological and biological systems, as well as more advanced mathematical models."}, {"title": "Industrial Automation and Autonomous Systems", "description": "Develop the ability to design and build automation solutions and autonomous systems for a wide range of industrial applications."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning and Process Systems Engineering", "description": "Acquire working knowledge to equip you for advanced coursework in machine learning, optimisation, dynamical systems, and numerical computations."}]}, "Optional modules (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Learn to apply mathematical and computational techniques to derive and solve equations of motion of fluids, which may be Newtonian or non-Newtonian, compressible or incompressible."}, {"title": "Carbon Capture and Clean Fossil Fuels", "description": "Understand the environmental impacts of fossil fuels and learn how to minimise the costs of CO 2 avoidance through the use of a range of technologies."}, {"title": "Membrane Science and Membrane Separation Processes", "description": "Develop your ability to formulate and solve engineering problems involving the design of membranes and membrane modules for gas separation, reverse osmosis, nanofiltration and more."}, {"title": "Nuclear Chemical Engineering", "description": "Investigate the main chemical engineering processes associated with nuclear energy and work through problems related to mass and energy balance."}, {"title": "Particle Engineering", "description": "Explore your knowledge of particle technology and develop your skills in the key principles, concepts and technology to be confident to research and analyse a broader range of powder processing."}, {"title": "Process Heat Transfer", "description": "Carry out process heat transfer calculations to understand the basics and procedures to critically assess commercial codes in industry."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Technologies", "description": "Explore the tools required for the application of new energy and renewable energy systems to the problems faced by climate change and global energy security while transitioning to a zero emissions economy."}, {"title": "Biochemical Sensors", "description": "Gain biodevice fabrication techniques and learn how to apply these in industry through topics such as microfluids, synthetic systems, and probes for innovative product design."}]}, "Business School (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Accounting Online", "description": "Develop accounting-related skills and examine their relevance to broader issues of financial decision-making and management control in organisations."}, {"title": "Business Economics", "description": "Analyse several economic tools and explore a range of microeconomic and macroeconomic topics, problems and policies."}, {"title": "Business Strategy", "description": "Examine the relevance of financial and management accounting techniques in financial decision making and management control of organisations."}, {"title": "Corporate Finance Online", "description": "An introduction to financial markets and the role they place in the macroeconomy, and how business risk is transferred and priced in equity and dept securities."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship Online", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered. This course is self-guided."}, {"title": "Finance and Financial Management", "description": "Enhance your accounting-related skills and gain a basic insight into the way that business performance is measured."}, {"title": "Managing Innovation", "description": "Become equipped with the skills needed to organise and shape the innovation process in firms and learn how to evaluate managerial strategies."}, {"title": "Managerial Economics Online", "description": "Explore the value to businesses of understanding economics, concepts, tolls and analytical frameworks as well as the role of monetary and fiscal policy on business cycles."}, {"title": "Project Management", "description": "Develop an understanding of Project Management and apply it's tools to analyse, interpret an provide solutions to strategic, organisational and operative challenges."}, {"title": "Leading Teams and Organisations", "description": "Develop and practise skills that will be used to identify, diagnose and evaluate key organisational issues and learn to work productively as a team."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee -": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Advanced Computing MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Study a range of advanced computing concepts and technologies alongside experts in the field.
structure_json: {"Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Computer Security", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the themes and challenges of host-level native, web, and mobile security and privacy."}, {"title": "Complexity", "description": "Discover how to describe the complexity classes associated with computational problems, and how to fit a particular problem into a class of related problems."}, {"title": "Computational Finance", "description": "Understand the basic concepts of quantitative finance and financial engineering and build awareness of the major decision, hedging, and pricing problems in finance."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning", "description": "Learn how to design and implement modern statistical machine learning methodologies, as well as inference mechanisms."}, {"title": "Privacy Engineering", "description": "Become familiar with the concepts and techniques underlying privacy-enhancing technologies across a variety of areas."}, {"title": "Program Analysis", "description": "Learn how to design program analyses for classical and probabilistic programs and how to solve the resulting equations and constraints."}, {"title": "Scalable Systems and Data", "description": "Advance your knowledge of the concepts that enable the design and implementation of scalable distributed systems."}, {"title": "Scalable Software Verification", "description": "Use separation logic to reason compositionally about sequential and concurrent heap-manipulating programs."}, {"title": "Reinforcement Learning", "description": "Learn how to describe the core principles of autonomous systems learning and calculate mathematical solutions to problems using reinforcement learning theory."}, {"title": "Prolog", "description": "Become familiar with Prolog and develop the knowledge and skills required to write small Prolog applications with an artificial intelligence dimension."}, {"title": "Introduction to Machine Learning", "description": "Gain insights into the different types of problems that exist in machine learning and the basic algorithms used to address them."}, {"title": "Scheduling and Resource Allocation", "description": "Assess the best decision algorithms for solving real-life problems arising in computer science, computational management and economics."}, {"title": "Independent Study Option", "description": "Study an advanced computer science topic of your choice and plan, write and present a scientific report."}, {"title": "Quantum Computing", "description": "Discover the basic notions of quantum computing and be introduced to Quantum Bits, Quantum Entanglement and Quantum Algorithms."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Graphics", "description": "Assess modern techniques in realistic computer graphics and image synthesis, particularly image-based techniques for photorealism."}, {"title": "Computational Optimisation", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of optimal decision making models, algorithms and applications to engineering, finance, and machine learning."}, {"title": "Cryptography Engineering", "description": "Discover how cryptographic techniques can be used to design and implement secure communicating systems for a variety of different needs and applications."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts and advanced methodologies of deep learning and relate them to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Imaging", "description": "Develop your knowledge of machine learning further by relating back to real-world problems in computer vision and medical image analysis."}, {"title": "Natural Language Processing", "description": "Acquire the techniques and tools needed to devise and develop natural language processing (NLP) components and applications."}, {"title": "Principles of Distributed Ledgers", "description": "Analyse the foundational principles behind decentralised ledgers and apply them to current research in cryptocurrencies."}, {"title": "Probabilistic Inference", "description": "Examine how probability can be used to make decisions by a computer and advance your understanding of inference networks and linear and non-linear methods in statistical pattern recognition."}, {"title": "Software Reliability", "description": "Assess techniques and tools for improving the reliability of software systems and discuss their respective strengths and weaknesses."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Industry", "description": "Examine the tools and techniques that software engineers use on a daily basis to successfully build and maintain large software systems."}, {"title": "Formal Methods for Safe AI", "description": "Develop intellectual and practical skills in the use of modal logics for knowledge representation and automated reasoning in artificial intelligence."}, {"title": "Robot Learning", "description": "Engage with the emerging field of robot learning and discover how robots can acquire skills and control their bodies using machine learning techniques."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Architecture", "description": "Develop a thorough understanding of high-performance and energy-efficient computer architecture as a basis for informed software performance engineering."}, {"title": "Computer Vision", "description": "Explore how images are formed, how they are represented on computers and how they can be processed by computers to extract semantic information."}, {"title": "Graphics", "description": "Understand basic concepts of computer graphics and familiarise yourself with the mathematical principles used for computer generated imagery, shading and light approximations."}, {"title": "Custom Computing", "description": "Examine the approaches that enable the rapid and systematic design of custom computers and learn how to analyse the performance of a custom computer."}, {"title": "Distributed Algorithms", "description": "Unpick the key concepts, problems and results in distributed algorithms and gain practical experience of programming them."}, {"title": "Network and Web Security", "description": "Study network and web security broadly from the network to the application layer and understand the main threats, attack techniques and defences relevant to cybersecurity and network security."}, {"title": "System Performance Engineering", "description": "Analyse how performance engineering ensures computer systems are responsive, scalable, and efficient and explore the fundamental principles and techniques used to achieve these goals."}, {"title": "Logic-Based Learning", "description": "Gain an in-depth understanding of the state-of-the-art of logic-based learning, starting from its key foundation concepts and principles before moving to more recent advances."}, {"title": "Computational Neurodynamics", "description": "Understand the rationale behind the theoretical end of computational neuroscience and basic principles of the tools needed to simulate the brain's intelligent behaviour in this interdisciplinary module."}, {"title": "Deep Graph-Based Learning", "description": "Gain a flavour of different aspects of the broad and ever-expanding field of graph theory and learning, including conventional graph data analysis methods and the nascent field of graph neural networks."}, {"title": "Human-Robot Interaction", "description": "Explore the intersection of robotics and human-computer interaction, covering user-centric and user study design, data analysis, and relevant theoretical foundations, in this exciting new field."}, {"title": "Methods and Tools in the Theory of Computing", "description": "Learn elementary tools, methods and results relating to fundamental questions in the theory and practice computing."}, {"title": "Statistical Information Theory", "description": "Delve into the deep connections between information theory, statistics and machine learning, in this module linking computing, statistics and geometry. Includes mathematical and computational exercises, and provides crucial theoretical background for a career in data science or machine learning."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Machine Learning Systems", "description": "In this course, you will learn how to build reliable systems that use machine learning, from data ingestion to user experience. You will gain hands-on experience running a simplified ML system in a simulated real world setting."}, {"title": "Networked Systems", "description": "Learn how modern networked systems are built and gain hands-on experience with their design and implementation. You will explore new architectures, hardware and software infrastructure, and core principles such as layering and the end-to-end argument."}, {"title": "Non-Euclidean Methods in Machine Learning", "description": "Learn to build machine learning models that work with non-Euclidean data. You will study embeddings, optimization techniques from Riemannian geometry, and graph theory, and apply neural networks designed for data on curved spaces and manifolds."}, {"title": "Introduction to Concrete Complexity", "description": "Explore why some problems are hard to solve but easy to check, including the famous P vs NP question. You will learn simple tools from circuit and proof complexity to tackle these challenges."}, {"title": "Machine Learning Systems and Hardware", "description": "Investigate how modern hardware and systems make machine learning work in practice. From GPUs and TPUs to efficient ML techniques and large-scale deployment, you will get hands-on experience running models across cloud and edge environments."}]}}}, "Individual Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Advanced Materials Science and Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Specialise in materials for energy transition and develop your passion for exploring and creating innovative materials.

title: Advanced Materials for Sustainable Infrastructure MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Learn about the behaviour and characteristics of civil engineering materials in depth.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Concrete Materials", "description": "Explore the field of concrete technology and understand the key processes influencing the behaviour and performance of concrete in service."}, {"title": "Materials Selection", "description": "Discover the role of materials selection in the design process and learn how to select appropriate materials for different civil engineering applications."}, {"title": "Mechanics of Materials", "description": "Gain an insight into the fundamental principles of the mechanics of materials and analyse the behaviour of structural components under load."}, {"title": "Geomaterials", "description": "Learn how to describe rocks and soils and interpret test data. You'll also examine how the engineering properties of geomaterials influence the behaviour of pavements and structures."}, {"title": "Sustainable Development", "description": "Apply the principles of sustainability to a range of issues relating to the built environment and discover how to carry out a life cycle assessment of infrastructure elements."}, {"title": "Characterisation of Materials", "description": "Understand the capabilities and limitations of mechanical testing and examine appropriate methods for tackling problems."}, {"title": "Cementitious Materials", "description": "Discover why cementitious materials are used throughout the built environment and learn about the chemistry behind them."}, {"title": "Polymers and Polymer Composites", "description": "Appreciate the development and applications of polymers and polymer composites in civil engineering."}, {"title": "Metals", "description": "Enhance your knowledge of the use of metals and alloys in civil engineering and deepen your understanding of steel metallurgy."}, {"title": "Numerical Modelling of Materials", "description": "Explore the principles, applications and limitations of numerical models as applied to infrastructure materials."}, {"title": "Masonry, Timber and Glass", "description": "Understand the types of masonry, timber and glass available for the construction of buildings and evaluate where the use of these materials is likely to be appropriate or problematic."}, {"title": "Assessment, Monitoring and Repair of Structures", "description": "Learn how to plan a durability survey to assess the condition of a concrete structure and understand different testing and monitoring techniques."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": title: Advanced Mechanical Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London

title: Analogue and Digital Integrated Circuit Design MSc | Study | Imperial College London

title: Artificial Intelligence Applications and Innovation MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Imperial Business School Department of Computing Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Department of Mathematics
course_overview: Learn AI fundamentals, explore real-world AI applications, and acquire expertise needed to become a leader in AI technologies and business
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Group Project on AI Ventures and Ethics", "description": "Engage in a project-oriented, team-driven module where you explore AI applications in finance, health, and more. Learn from industry leaders, culminating in a business proposal and technical demonstration."}, {"title": "Responsible AI: Ethics at Work", "description": "Explore the ethical, social, and regulatory challenges of AI design through case-based learning, and develop the skills to navigate stakeholder dynamics and assess risks and responsibilities in global AI contexts."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules – Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Python and Machine Learning", "description": "This module covers machine learning theory, algorithms, and applications, emphasising Python programming proficiency for practical problem-solving. Gain skills to contribute to ongoing advances and research in the dynamic Deep Learning field."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Learn core innovation management concepts and apply them to real business cases in tech-oriented companies across sectors."}]}, "Optional modules – Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Quantum AI (Independent Study)", "description": "Under the module leader's guidance, this module encourages independent study in Quantum AI, exploring advanced topics such as variational quantum algorithms, quantum data learning, and advanced quantum error correction."}, {"title": "Internet of Things and Applications", "description": "Study Internet of Things platform development, data acquisition from sensors, analysis, actuations, and data mining insights."}, {"title": "Fundamentals and Innovative Applications of Robotics", "description": "Explore robotics theory and practice, emphasising innovative applications and hands-on experience with Robot Operating System (ROS) for solving real-world problems."}, {"title": "Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence in Medical Imaging", "description": "Explore the crucial aspect of AI trustworthiness in medical imaging. title: Applied Mathematics MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Equipping students with a range of transferable skills in mathematical modelling, analysis and computation for employment in industry and future research.

to visualise and explore data in R, and understand the fundamental concepts and challenges of learning from data."}, {"title": "Optimisation", "description": "Gain a thorough grounding in optimisation topic in the theory of dynamical systems, looking at exciting recent research."}, {"title": "Advanced PDEs 2", "description": "Analyse boundary value problems for elliptic and parabolic PDEs using the variational approach."}, {"title": "Advanced PDEs 1", "description": "Develop an understanding of partial differential equations (PDE) appearing in physics and geometry, and classical techniques to study them analytically."}, {"title": "Applied Complex Analysis", "description": "Further your knowledge of mathematical techniques including the Wiener-Hopf method, Plemelj formulae, Hilbert problem, and Orthogonal polynomials."}, {"title": "Asymptotic Methods", "description": "Broaden your knowledge on asymptotic methods and learn more about the techniques introduced that find wide applications in engineering and natural sciences."}, {"title": "Bifurcation Theory", "description": "Advance your understanding of bifurcation theory, the study of how the behaviour of dynamical systems changes when parameters are varied."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems", "description": "Examine the foundations of discrete-time dynamical systems and discover why they are so important to areas such as finance, physics, biology and social sciences."}, {"title": "Dynamics of Learning and Iterated Games", "description": "Explore modelling learning through the dynamics of games and analyse learning models used by technology companies."}, {"title": "Fluid Dynamics 1", "description": "Be presented with a derivation of the Navier-Stokes and learn techniques to simplify and solve the equation with the purpose of describing the motion of fluids at different conditions."}, {"title": "Fluid Dynamics 2", "description": "Seek out simplifications in the Navier-Stokes formulation and learn how to solve Prandtl's boundary-layer equations."}, {"title": "Function Analysis", "description": "This module brings together ideas of continuity and linear algebra. It concerns vector spaces with a distance and involves linear maps. The vector spaces are often spaces of functions. It is an important requirement for further study of many areas of Mathematical Analysis including PDEs, Stochastic Analysis, Dynamical Systems and Quantum Mechanics."}, {"title": "Hydrodynamic Stability", "description": "Examine basic concepts and techniques of modern hydrodynamic stability theory and learn how to predict hydrodynamic instabilities in a variety of fluid flows."}, {"title": "Introduction to Geophysical Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Advance your knowledge of fluid-dynamics relating to geophysics through a mix of theory and applications."}, {"title": "Probability Theory 2", "description": "Discover why Markov processes are widely used to model random evolutions and how the theory connects with many other subjects in mathematics."}, {"title": "Mathematical Biology", "description": "Learn how to describe the application of mathematical models to biological phenomena and give consideration to problems typical of particular organisms and environments."}, {"title": "Mathematical Finance: An Introduction to Option Pricing", "description": "Engage with the mathematical modelling of derivatives securities, which focuses on the pricing and hedging of derivatives using a probabilistic representation of market uncertainty."}, {"title": "Quantum Mechanics 1", "description": "Untangle the theory of quantum mechanics and discover why it provides the basis for many areas of contemporary physics."}, {"title": "Quantum Mechanics 2", "description": "Build on topics covered in Quantum Mechanics 1 and further your understanding of key areas of contemporary physics."}, {"title": "Random Dynamical Systems and Ergodic Theory (Seminar Course)", "description": "Assess the theory and applications of random dynamical systems and ergodic theory before exploring more advanced developments in this field."}, {"title": "Special Relativity and Electromagnetism", "description": "Discover how advances in modern theoretical physics are being made and become familiar with the classical theory of fields."}, {"title": "Statistical Mechanics", "description": "Investigate principles and applications of statistical mechanics, with a special emphasis on phase transitions."}, {"title": "Tensor Calculus and General Relativity", "description": "Advance your understanding of Tensor calculus and explore concepts including Riemannian geometry, Einstein's field equations and the Newtonian approximation."}, {"title": "Theory of Partial Differential Equations", "description": "Analyse the theory of partial differential equations and its related concepts, and build familiarity with conservation laws."}, {"title": "Vortex Dynamics", "description": "Focus on the dynamics of vorticity in an ideal fluid in two and three dimensions and explore various techniques in dynamical systems theory."}, {"title": "Introduction to Game Theory", "description": "You will study the wide variety of mathematics and its many applications within the area of game theory. The module aims to promote an active learning style, involving many classroom games as well as games to be played as homework."}, {"title": "Dynamics, Symmetry, and Integrability", "description": "This module on Dynamics, Symmetry and Integrability is a friendly and fast-paced introduction to the geometric approach to proving integrability of classical Hamiltonian systems, at the level suitable for advanced undergraduates and first-year graduate students in mathematics."}, {"title": "Mathematical Biology 2", "description": "This module will provide an introduction to the interdisciplinary field of mathematical systems biology. Drawing on analogies between biological and engineered systems, you will learn about mathematical approaches to model functional aspects of biological systems"}, {"title": "Stochastic Differential Equations in Financial Modelling", "description": "To address valuation, hedging, and risk management of financial options, you will study stochastic differential equations using a Riemann-Stieltjes approach to stochastic integration."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Martingale Scholarships": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Martingale Scholarships": {"items": []}}}}

title: Applied Multiomics in Biomedicine MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Metabolism, Digestion and Reproduction
course_overview: Learn how big data and experimental research can be harnessed to revolutionise biological sciences and biomedicine.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to Multi-omics Research", "description": "You will become familiar with key concepts in omics and the approaches to obtain, handle, understand and find targets from big data in biology."}, {"title": "Non-coding RNAs, Gene Editing and In Vitro Modelling", "description": "You will examine the role of non-coding RNAs (miRNAs, CRISPR, etc.) and the application of gene editing and other widely used laboratory research techniques."}, {"title": "In Vivo Modelling and Use of Human Material and Data", "description": "You will learn about the use of animal models and human samples to investigate mechanisms of disease."}, {"title": "Core and Professional Skills", "description": "You will receive training in basic laboratory skills during the performance of a mini research project."}, {"title": "Literature Review/Grant Proposal", "description": "You will perform a literature review on a topic of your choice leading to a scientific poster and a written review paper, or PhD grant proposal."}]}}}, "Experimental/Computational Disease Modelling Research Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (Human Molecular Genetics + Applied Multiomics)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee (Human Molecular Genetics + Applied Multiomics)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Applied Paediatrics | Study | Imperial College London

title: Artificial Intelligence MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Receive intensive training in programming and the fundamentals of artificial intelligence.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to Machine Learning", "description": "Gain insights into the different types of problems that exist in machine learning and the basic algorithms used to address them."}, {"title": "Python Programming", "description": "Understand the fundamentals of Python and learn how to write procedural, object-oriented and functional programs in Python."}, {"title": "Introduction to Symbolic Artificial Intelligence", "description": "Learn how to apply knowledge of domain properties and agent architectures in the representation of problems in symbolic AI."}, {"title": "Ethics, Fairness, and Explanation in AI", "description": "Explore the issues and implications around ethics and philosphical problems, fairness and bias, and justifiable explanations in AI decision-making."}, {"title": "Software Engineering Group Project", "description": "Obtain practical experience in developing AI applications and using software engineering techniques in the design and implementation of large programs."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Group 1": {"items": [{"title": "Computer Vision", "description": "Explore how images are formed, how they are represented on computers and how they can be processed by computers to extract semantic information."}, {"title": "Reinforcement Learning", "description": "Learn how to describe the core principles of autonomous systems learning and calculate mathematical solutions to problems using reinforcement learning theory."}, {"title": "Computational Optimisation", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of optimal decision making models, algorithms and applications to engineering, finance, and machine learning."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning", "description": "Learn how to design and implement modern statistical machine learning methodologies, as well as inference mechanisms."}, {"title": "Formal Methods for Safe AI", "description": "Develop intellectual and practical skills in the use of modal logics for knowledge representation and automated reasoning in artificial intelligence."}, {"title": "Logic-Based Learning", "description": "Gain an in-depth understanding of logic-based learning, starting from its key foundation concepts and principles before moving to more recent advances."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts and advanced methodologies of deep learning and relate them to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Probabilistic Inference", "description": "Examine how probability can be used to make decisions by a computer and advance your understanding of inference networks and linear and non-linear methods in statistical pattern recognition."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Imaging", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts and advanced methodologies of machine learning for imaging and relate them to real-world problems in computer vision and medical image analysis."}, {"title": "Natural Language Processing", "description": "Acquire the techniques and tools needed to devise and develop natural language processing (NLP) components and applications."}, {"title": "Robot Learning", "description": "Engage with the emerging field of robot learning and discover how robots can acquire skills and control their bodies using machine learning techniques."}, {"title": "Robotics", "description": "Assess the exciting field of mobile robotics, at a time when cutting-edge robots are beginning to leave the research laboratory to tackle real-world tasks."}, {"title": "AI Ventures", "description": "Explore applications of artificial intelligence technologies that will improve or transform existing financial, health and other systems."}, {"title": "Computational Neurodynamics", "description": "Understand the rationale behind the theoretical end of computational neuroscience and basic principles of the tools needed to simulate the brain's intelligent behaviour in this interdisciplinary module."}, {"title": "Deep Graph-Based Learning", "description": "Gain a flavour of different aspects of the broad and ever-expanding field of graph theory and learning, including conventional graph data analysis methods and the nascent field of graph neural networks."}, {"title": "Human-Robot Interaction", "description": "Explore the intersection of robotics and human-computer interaction, covering user-centric and user study design, data analysis, and relevant theoretical foundations, in this exciting new field."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Machine Learning Systems", "description": "Implement and operate a simplified machine learning-based system in this module covering engineering concepts underpinning trustworthy systems. title: Bioengineering MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop analytical and problem solving skills for a career in bioengineering.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Data Analysis for Research", "description": "Learn data analysis methodologies and understand how to integrate these concepts into your research projects."}, {"title": "Frontiers in Bioengineering Research", "description": "Become familiar with the breadth and variety of research in bioengineering, and develop your presentation, writing and critical analysis skills."}, {"title": "Topics in Biomedical Engineering", "description": "Explore a broad range of topics related to biomedical engineering and relevant to your specific research project."}, {"title": "Planning for Bioengineering Research", "description": "Begin the background research and planning for your research project."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biomaterials for Biomedicine and Sustainability", "description": "Discover, describe, and differentiate diverse ranges of biomaterials and their synthesis and functional characterisation."}, {"title": "Advanced Imaging Technologies for Systems Biology", "description": "Examine advanced imaging technologies and critically evaluate and design imaging experiments to analyse dynamic processes in complex biological systems."}, {"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis", "description": "Explore the core aspects of biological and clinical measurement such as data handling, sampling and measurement."}, {"title": "Bioengineering Approaches to Cancer", "description": "Understand the fundamental biological and biophysical processes involved in cancer and the application of bioengineering to better understand and manage the disease."}, {"title": "Biomaterials for Bioengineers", "description": "Become solve technical problems using inspiration from nature."}, {"title": "Brain Machine Interfaces", "description": "Discover technology used in clinical settings for interfacing of the human brain to electronic circuitry."}, {"title": "Cellular and Molecular Mechanotransduction", "description": "Study biomechanics on a cellular scale and investigate methods of sensing and cell manipulation."}, {"title": "Computational Neuroscience", "description": "Appreciate the role of computational and theoretical approaches to understanding the nervous system."}, {"title": "Engineering in Cancer Therapy", "description": "Understand the basic physics of ionising radiation as safely implemented in radiotherapy, and review the range of applications used in the treatment of patients."}, {"title": "Human Neuromechanical Control and Learning", "description": "Assess the control of human movement from the perspective of both adaptation of the neural control system and adaptation of properties of the mechanical plant."}, {"title": "Image Processing", "description": "Examine digital image processing relevant to image analysis and appreciate aspects of computation involved in interpreting images."}, {"title": "Industrial Applications of Cellular Engineering", "description": "Assess the different industrial applications of cellular engineering and synthetic biology and learn about engineering cell behaviours in a variety of fields."}, {"title": "Ionising Tissue and Flow imaging", "description": "Appreciate the basic physics of nuclear medicine and discover the range of applications used in the diagnosis and treatment of patients."}, {"title": "Mathematical Methods for Bioengineers", "description": "Analyse a range of appropriate mathematical models to model title: Cancer Technology MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop a unique understanding of cancer from a bioengineering perspective.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Bioengineering Approaches to Cancer", "description": "Understand the fundamental biological and biophysical processes involved in cancer and the application of bioengineering to better understand and manage the disease."}, {"title": "Data Analysis for Research", "description": "Learn data analysis methodologies and understand how to integrate these concepts into your research projects."}, {"title": "Frontiers in Cancer Technology Research", "description": "Become familiar with the breadth and variety of research in cancer technology, and develop your presentation, writing and critical analysis skills."}, {"title": "Topics in Cancer Engineering", "description": "Receive additional training in engineering and physical science skills for application towards cancer research and management."}, {"title": "Planning for Research", "description": "Begin the background research and planning for your research project."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biomaterials for Biomedicine and Sustainability", "description": "Discover, describe, and differentiate diverse ranges of biomaterials and their synthesis and functional characterisation."}, {"title": "Advanced Chemical Sensors", "description": "Analyse the different methods of (bio)chemical sensors and understand basic chemical sensing principles and their application."}, {"title": "Advanced Imaging Technologies for Systems Biology", "description": "Examine advanced imaging technologies and critically evaluate and design imaging experiments to analyse dynamic processes in complex biological systems."}, {"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis", "description": "Explore the core aspects of biological and clinical measurement such as data handling, sampling and measurement."}, {"title": "Biomechanics", "description": "Explore the principles of mechanics, such as solid mechanics and fluid mechanics, and their application to living systems."}, {"title": "Biomimetics", "description": "Cover the scope of biomimetics and investigate the principles that help engineers solve technical problems using inspiration from nature."}, {"title": "Cellular and Molecular Mechanotransduction", "description": "Study biomechanics on a cellular scale and investigate methods of sensing and cell manipulation."}, {"title": "Computational Neuroscience", "description": "Appreciate the role of computational and theoretical approaches to understanding the nervous system."}, {"title": "Engineering in Cancer Therapy", "description": "Understand the basic physics of ionising radiation as safely implemented in radiotherapy, and review the range of applications used in the treatment of patients."}, {"title": "Image Processing", "description": "Examine digital image processing relevant to image analysis and appreciate aspects of computation involved in interpreting images."}, {"title": "Industrial Applications of Cellular Engineering", "description": "Assess the different industrial applications of cellular engineering and synthetic biology and learn about engineering cell behaviours in a variety of fields."}, {"title": "Ionising Tissue and Flow imaging", "description": "Appreciate the basic physics of nuclear medicine and discover the range of applications used in the diagnosis and treatment of patients."}, {"title": "Medical Device Certification", "description": "Deepen your understanding of the key skills needed by professional engineers in the development of medical systems and devices, specifically in the preparation of regulatory approval."}, {"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship", "description": "Explore various aspects of medical device entrepreneurship, looking at case studies from start-ups, industry and investment firms to gain a sense of the process and challenges in developing your own business idea."}, {"title": "Molecular Cellular and Tissue Biomechanics", "description": "Analyse engineering principles and approaches towards the study of biomechanical behaviour from a cellular to tissue scale."}, {"title": "Nanotechnologies for Cancer Diagnosis & Cancer Therapy", "description": "Explore the latest nanotechnological advances in the field of cancer diagnostics and cancer therapies."}, {"title": "Non-ionising Functional and Tissue Imaging", "description": "Become familiar with the latest advanced features of medical imaging (CT, X-ray, MR and US) and their use in modern hospital practice."}, {"title": "Physiological Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Study advanced concepts in fluid mechanics and the theory and implementation of numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Principles of Biomedical Imaging", "description": "Examine how images of the body can be obtained using different forms of penetrating radiation and how different forms of imaging work."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, title: Advanced Chemical Engineering with Biotechnology MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Build an interdisciplinary background in chemical engineering and biological sciences for a career in biotech.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Process Design", "description": "Explore advanced topics in process design, with an emphasis on process modelling and optimisation theory and associated software packages."}, {"title": "Advanced Bioprocess Engineering", "description": "Review the relevant fundamentals of biochemistry, microbiology, and molecular biology, and explore the principles behind fermentation processes."}, {"title": "Biochemical Engineering", "description": "Gain insights into the techniques used in biotechnology, which in many cases differ markedly from chemical engineering."}, {"title": "Modelling of Biological Systems", "description": "Interlink the biological principles of cellular physiology with the mathematical tools required for their analysis and modelling."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules (Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Environmental Engineering", "description": "Analyse how chemical discharges affect the planet and how the increased greenhouse effect, ozone depletion, smog formation and acid rain arise from human influences on natural cycles."}, {"title": "Advanced Optimisation for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Learn about state-of-the-art optimisation-based techniques for process synthesis, process design and molecular design, with a particular focus on mathematical programming."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Operations", "description": "Learn how to formulate, solve and interpret meaningful optimisation problems through the use of optimality conditions and common solution techniques."}, {"title": "Applied Spectroscopy", "description": "Understand a range of analytical techniques needed to address challenges being faced by industry and explore leading spectroscopic methods."}, {"title": "Colloid and Interface Science", "description": "Delve into the fundamentals of colloid and interface science and analyse the nature of the various interparticle forces."}, {"title": "Dynamic Behaviour of Process Systems", "description": "Learn how to develop models of the transient behaviour of process equipment using state-of-the-art modelling tools."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop a fundamental understanding of nonlinear dynamical systems to better appreciate complex phenomena in nature and a variety of chemical and biological engineering technological processes."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop your understanding of advanced statistical learning and machine learning to solve a range of real-life chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "Molecular Modelling of Fluids", "description": "Understand the application of molecular theory and simulation in modelling fluids and fluid mixtures."}, {"title": "Practical Process Engineering in the Oil and Gas Industry", "description": "Understand the general workflows of facilities engineering teams and learn how to perform simple process and pipeline hydraulics hand calculations."}, {"title": "Product Characterisation", "description": "Develop your knowledge and experience in current experimental techniques and learn to analyse and apply these techniques to selected products."}, {"title": "Transport Processes in Biological Systems", "description": "Assess basic principles and concepts of fluid flow, heat and mass transfer relevant to physiological and biological systems, as well as more advanced mathematical models."}, {"title": "Industrial Automation and Autonomous Systems", "description": "Develop the ability to design and build automation solutions and autonomous systems for a wide range of industrial applications."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning and Process Systems Engineering", "description": "Acquire working knowledge to equip you for advanced coursework in machine learning, optimisation, dynamical systems, and numerical computations."}]}, "Optional modules (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Learn to apply mathematical and computational techniques to derive and solve equations of motion of fluids, which may be Newtonian or non-Newtonian, compressible or incompressible."}, {"title": "Carbon Capture and Clean Fossil Fuels", "description": "Understand the environmental impacts of fossil fuels and learn how to minimise the costs of CO 2 avoidance through the use of a range of technologies."}, {"title": "Membrane Science and Membrane Separation Processes", "description": "Develop your ability to formulate and solve engineering problems involving the design of membranes and membrane modules for gas separation, reverse osmosis, nanofiltration and more."}, {"title": "Nuclear Chemical Engineering", "description": "Investigate the main chemical engineering processes associated with nuclear energy and work through problems related to mass and energy balance."}, {"title": "Particle Engineering", "description": "Explore your knowledge of particle technology and develop your skills in the key principles, concepts and technology to be confident to research and analyse a broader range of powder processing."}, {"title": "Process Heat Transfer", "description": "Carry out process heat transfer calculations to understand the basics and procedures to critically assess commercial codes in industry."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Technologies", "description": "Explore the tools required for the application of new energy and renewable energy systems to the problems faced by climate change and global energy security while transitioning to a zero emissions economy."}, {"title": "Biochemical Sensors", "description": "Gain biodevice fabrication techniques and learn how to apply these in industry through topics such as microfluids, synthetic systems, and probes for innovative product design."}]}, "Business School (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Accounting Online", "description": "Develop accounting-related skills and examine their relevance to broader issues of financial decision-making and management control in organisations."}, {"title": "Business Economics", "description": "Analyse several economic tools and explore a range of microeconomic and macroeconomic topics, problems and policies."}, {"title": "Business Strategy", "description": "Examine the relevance of financial and management accounting techniques in financial decision making and management control of organisations."}, {"title": "Corporate Finance Online", "description": "An introduction to financial markets and the role they place in the macroeconomy, and how business risk is transferred and priced in equity and dept securities."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship Online", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered. This course is self-guided."}, {"title": "Finance and Financial Management", "description": "Enhance your accounting-related skills and gain a basic insight into the way that business performance is measured."}, {"title": "Managing Innovation", "description": "Become equipped with the skills needed to organise and shape the innovation process in firms and learn how to evaluate managerial strategies."}, {"title": "Managerial Economics Online", "description": "Explore the value to businesses of understanding economics, concepts, tolls and analytical frameworks as well as the role of monetary and fiscal policy on business cycles."}, {"title": "Project Management", "description": "Develop an understanding of Project Management and apply it's tools to analyse, interpret an provide solutions to strategic, organisational and operative challenges."}, {"title": "Leading Teams and Organisations", "description": "Develop and practise skills that will be used to identify, diagnose and evaluate key organisational issues and learn to work productively as a team."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee -": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Cleantech Innovation MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Dyson School of Design Engineering Grantham Institute
course_overview: Become a climate innovator and cleantech entrepreneur through this interdisciplinary MSc.
structure_json: {"Core Modules": {"groups": {"Core Modules": {"items": [{"title": "Cleantech Innovation Project Part 1: Ideation, Design Methods & Prototyping", "description": "Develop ideas as a team to address climate change challenges through lectures, workshops, and hands-on prototyping."}, {"title": "Cleantech Innovation Project Part 2: Business Model & Customer Discovery & Pitch", "description": "Develop your customer discovery skills to tailor solutions to customer needs, learn about Cleantech financing and pitching, and engage with industry experts to foster an innovative mindset and develop practical approaches to sustainability challenges as a team."}, {"title": "Cleantech Innovation Project Part 3: Advanced Prototyping & Asset Creation", "description": "As a team, engage in advanced prototyping and asset creation to work on your Cleantech Innovation, to design and test both hardware and software solutions in team settings."}, {"title": "Climate Change for Cleantech Innovators", "description": "Delve into the science of climate change, explore potential solutions and their implementation factors, including policy and economics, and choose a Cleantech theme to formulate your innovation proposal."}, {"title": "Design Engineering Practice", "description": "Build your ability to tackle complex, real-world challenges by learning key design engineering approaches, tools, and mindsets. You'll explore a systematic process for developing innovative solutions, gaining practical experience in synthesising insights from diverse sources and identifying clear opportunities. Through this project based learning model, you'll also develop divergent thinking skills to generate a wide range of creative concepts and solutions. "}, {"title": "Greenhouse Residency Project", "description": "Through Undaunted, you will collaborate with a start-up from the Greenhouse for 8-9 weeks to apply your skills in a real world cleantech venture context."}, {"title": "LCA and Social Impact for Cleantech Innovations", "description": "Deepen your understanding of your innovation project through learning about Life Cycle Assessment and social impacts, focusing on the measurement and considerations necessary for the development and deployment of potential innovations."}, {"title": "MSc Thesis in Cleantech Innovation", "description": "Synthesize your accumulated knowledge from the MSc program and contextualise your cleantech innovation project through compelling communication of your findings."}]}}}, "Optional Modules": {"groups": {"Optional Modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Industrial Design", "description": "Develop advanced industrial design skills through a focus on emerging tools, themes, and methods. You will refine CAD techniques for generative design and virtual prototyping, and produce high-quality visualisations suitable for professional portfolios and international competitions."}, {"title": "Audio Experience Design", "description": "Explore the foundations of audio technology and perception, including acoustics, psychoacoustics, digital signal processing, and techniques for recording and reproducing sound. You will also engage with topics such as 3D audio, data sonification, and loudspeaker design."}, {"title": "Data to Product", "description": "Learn to design data-driven products through modern data science approaches."}, {"title": "Design Analytics for the Sharing Economy", "description": "Investigate the sharing economy as a shift from ownership to access, enabled by digital platforms and driven by active participants. Explore how prosumers reshape consumption, and examine both the potential and the challenges of designing fair, efficient, and resilient collaborative systems."}, {"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing", "description": "Equips aspiring engineers and designers with the expertise to leverage Industry 4.0 through additive manufacturing and 3D printing, to address future industry challenges."}, {"title": "Design of Visual Systems", "description": "Learn about the critical role of visual data in modern engineering systems, covering the human visual system and technologies for acquiring and analysing visual information, complemented by practical exercises to apply this knowledge to real-life problems."}, {"title": "Designing Interventions for Behaviour Change", "description": "Develop your competence in scoping, analysing and developing creative interventions for behaviour change. Possible interventions include wearables to improve health, products for more sustainable consumption and policy to improve tech-enabled business models. You will be exposed to several creative behavioural frameworks that can be applied to the development of (digital and physical) product, service, event, policy and organisational interventions. Next, you will work as a team to analyse and develop an intervention of your own. Learning is enhanced through interactive workshops and discussions complemented by individual and group learning activities to translate your understanding into real-world contexts."}, {"title": "Economics and Finance for Systems Design", "description": "Develop core skills in microeconomics, finance, and decision-making to assess the economic performance of engineering systems. You will apply both deterministic and uncertainty-based methods to real-world case studies, building the tools to evaluate financial viability and design for flexibility in complex environments."}, {"title": "Inferential Statistics and Causal Reasoning", "description": "Learn how to make sense of data in the social and behavioural sciences by exploring how patterns, differences, and relationships can be discovered and explained. You will practise cleaning and preparing data, choosing the right approach for different questions, and clearly reporting your findings using tools like SPSS, R, and Matlab."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Design Engineers", "description": "Gain a practical introduction to machine learning through a design engineering lens, exploring core concepts, key algorithms, and hands-on methods in regression and classification. You will develop a working understanding of how intelligent systems learn from data, and engage with both foundational approaches and emerging techniques."}, {"title": "Nano Design Engineering", "description": "Explore nanotechnology fundamentals through lectures and workshops, to create nanotech-driven design concepts in a culminating virtual project."}, {"title": "Responsible Design Engineering and Design Innovation", "description": "Navigate the ethical dimensions of technology product development and the broader impacts on society through a lens of philosophy and psychology to foster the creation of better, more responsible products."}, {"title": "Sensing and Internet of Things", "description": "Explore the development of Internet of Things platforms through practical engagement with software and hardware tools, gathering data from mobile and social sensors, analysing patterns, triggering intelligent responses, and applying insights from data mining to create responsive and connected systems."}, {"title": "Sustainable Design and Strategy", "description": "Explore how to design for positive impact by creating more sustainable and resilient products, services, and systems. You will learn practical tools for reducing environmental impact, promoting sustainable practices, and developing strong value propositions that drive change and communicate ideas effectively."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Storage Design", "description": "Gain a comprehensive overview of sustainable energy storage devices and systems for design engineers. You will explore a range of advanced energy storage technologies, including cutting-edge batteries, novel energy storage concepts, and integrated energy systems for a variety of practical applications."}, {"title": "Sustainable Resource Management", "description": "Gain insight into sustainable resource management to conserve materials and energy, preserve natural resources and protect public health and the ecosystem."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Medical Robotics and Image-Guided Intervention MRes – Clinical Robotics and AI | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Surgery and Cancer Hamlyn Centre for Medical Robotics
course_overview: Discover how medical robotics and data science are being applied in the clinic and carry out cutting-edge translational research
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Group Project", "description": "Work in small groups to develop a device or system that is relevant to Medical Robotics and/or Image Guided Intervention. title: Communications and Signal Processing MSc | Study | Imperial College London

course_overview: Develop an in-depth knowledge of modern information engineering problems and their solutions.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Digital Signal Processing and Digital Filters", "description": "Analyse the design of digital filters and in cutting-edge topics for current and future (5G and beyond) multi-antenna wireless communication systems."}, {"title": "Probability and Stochastic Processes", "description": "Gain the analytical skills title: Composites: The Science, Technology and Engineering Application of Advanced Composites MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Explore how high performance composite materials are increasingly important in the production of aircraft.

analysis techniques."}, {"title": "Introduction to Finite Elements Analysis", "description": "Become familiar with the fundamentals of finite elements analysis."}, {"title": "Introductory Mathematics", "description": "Revise essential mathematics over a series of lectures."}, {"title": "Introduction to Programming", "description": "Learn about the scientific programming tools and languages required to perform numerical computation."}, {"title": "Introduction to Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Appreciate the basic elements of fluid flow on this self-taught module."}]}}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Fundamentals of Composite Materials", "description": "Learn the fundamental concepts in composite materials, including an introduction to title: Computing MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Deepen your understanding and knowledge of computer science to prepare for a career in the computing industry.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Principles and Practice of Programming", "description": "Grasp the principles of programming and apply your skills to design and implement solutions to computational programming problems. You will be given the opportunity to practice writing programs and apply methods and techniques learned through laboratory sessions, coursework, and frequent and regular feedback."}, {"title": "Computer Systems", "description": "Acquire the core knowledge of the organisation and operations of a typical computer system."}, {"title": "Software Systems Engineering", "description": "Understand the fundamental technologies for designing and building modern software systems, including networking and distributed systems, databases, web services, cloud computing and continuous delivery methods, illustrated via practical exercises and projects."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Logic and Mathematics for Computing", "description": "Gain a foundational understanding of key topics in logic and mathematics required to pursue more specialised modules, such as Logic-based Learning, Introduction to Machine Leaning, Computer Vision, and Graphics. This module is specifically designed for students on a with limited or no logic/mathematics content in their undergraduate degree. "}]}, "Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Computer Architecture", "description": "Develop a thorough understanding of high-performance and energy-efficient computer architecture as a basis for informed software performance engineering."}, {"title": "Computational Finance", "description": "Understand the basic concepts of quantitative finance and financial engineering and build awareness of the major decision, hedging, and pricing problems in finance."}, {"title": "Scheduling and Resource Allocation", "description": "Assess the best decision algorithms for solving real-life problems arising in computer science, computational management and economics."}, {"title": "Principles of Distributed Ledgers", "description": "Analyse the foundational principles behind decentralised ledgers and apply them to current research in cryptocurrencies."}]}, "Group C": {"items": [{"title": "Databases", "description": "Explore how modern database systems are structured and learn about recent developments in database technology."}, {"title": "Computer Vision", "description": "Explore how images are formed, how they are represented on computers and how they can be processed by computers to extract semantic information."}, {"title": "Graphics", "description": "Understand basic concepts of computer graphics and familiarise yourself with the mathematical principles used for computer generated imagery, shading and light approximations."}, {"title": "Introduction to Machine Learning", "description": "Gain insights into the different types of problems that exist in machine learning and the basic algorithms used to address them."}, {"title": "Logic-Based Learning", "description": "Gain an in-depth understanding of the state-of-the-art of logic-based learning, starting from its key foundation concepts and principles before moving to more recent advances."}, {"title": "Network and Web Security", "description": "Study network and web security broadly from the network to the application layer and understand the main threats, attack techniques and defences relevant to cybersecurity and network security."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Graphics", "description": "Assess modern techniques in realistic computer graphics and image synthesis, particularly image-based techniques for photorealism."}, {"title": "Cryptography Engineering", "description": "Discover how cryptographic techniques can be used to design and implement secure communicating systems for a variety of different needs and applications."}, {"title": "Probabilistic Inference", "description": {"title": "Computer Networks and Distributed Systems", "description": "Review the problems and issues that must be dealt with in constructing robust and flexible distributed applications as well as the underlying network protocols needed to support them."}, {"title": "Software Engineering Design", "description": "Learn the techniques required to reliably design and evolve larger software systems
