title: Computing (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning) MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Deepen your knowledge and understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning to prepare for a career in the computing industry.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "MSc Computing (Specialist) Individual Project", "description": "Demonstrate independence and originality on an individual project, specialising in AI and ML, and put into practice some of the techniques you have learned throughout the course."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning", "description": "Learn how to design and implement modern statistical machine learning methodologies, as well as inference mechanisms."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Group 1": {"items": [{"title": "Logic-Based Learning", "description": "Gain an in-depth understanding of the state-of-the-art of logic-based learning, starting from its key foundation concepts and principles before moving to more recent advances."}, {"title": "Computational Optimisation", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of optimal decision making models, algorithms and applications to engineering, finance, and machine learning."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts and advanced methodologies of deep learning and relate them to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Imaging", "description": "Develop your knowledge of machine learning further by relating back to real-world problems in computer vision and medical image analysis."}, {"title": "Natural Language Processing", "description": "Acquire the techniques and tools needed to devise and develop natural language processing (NLP) components and applications."}, {"title": "Probabilistic Inference", "description": "Examine how probability can be used to make decisions by a computer and advance your understanding of inference networks and linear and non-linear methods in statistical pattern recognition."}, {"title": "Reinforcement Learning", "description": "Learn how to describe the core principles of autonomous systems learning and calculate mathematical solutions to problems using reinforcement learning theory."}, {"title": "Formal Methods for Safe AI", "description": "Develop intellectual and practical skills in the use of modal logics for knowledge representation and automated reasoning in artificial intelligence."}, {"title": "Prolog", "description": "Become familiar with Prolog and develop the knowledge and skills required to write small Prolog applications with an artificial intelligence dimension."}, {"title": "Introduction to Machine Learning", "description": "Gain insights into the different types of problems that exist in machine learning and the basic algorithms used to address them."}, {"title": "Computer Vision", "description": "Explore how images are formed, how they are represented on computers and how they can be processed by computers to extract semantic information."}, {"title": "Robot Learning", "description": "Engage with the emerging field of robot learning and discover how robots can acquire skills and control their bodies using machine learning techniques."}, {"title": "Computational Neurodynamics", "description": "Understand the rationale behind the theoretical end of computational neuroscience and basic principles of the tools needed to simulate the brain's intelligent behaviour in this interdisciplinary module."}, {"title": "Deep Graph-Based Learning", "description": "Gain a flavour of different aspects of the broad and ever-expanding field of graph theory and learning, including conventional graph data analysis methods and the nascent field of graph neural networks."}, {"title": "Human-Robot Interaction", "description": "Explore the intersection of robotics and human-computer interaction, covering user-centric and user study design, data analysis, and relevant theoretical foundations, in this exciting new field."}, {"title": "Methods and Tools in the Theory of Computing", "description": "Learn elementary tools, methods and results relating to fundamental questions in the theory and practice computing."}, {"title": "Statistical Information Theory", "description": "Delve into the deep connections between information theory, statistics and machine learning, in this module linking computing, statistics and geometry. Looks at all aspects of systems, including data ingestion, user experience, regulation and wider society."}, {"title": "Non-Euclidean Methods in Machine Learning", "description": "Learn to build machine learning models that work with non-Euclidean data. You will study embeddings, optimization techniques from Riemannian geometry, and graph theory, and apply neural networks designed for data on curved spaces and manifolds."}, {"title": "Machine Learning Systems and Hardware", "description": "Investigate how modern hardware and systems make machine learning work in practice. From GPUs and TPUs to efficient ML techniques and large-scale deployment, you will get hands-on experience running models across cloud and edge environments."}]}, "Group 2": {"items": [{"title": "Robotics", "description": "Assess the exciting field of mobile robotics, at a time when cutting-edge robots are beginning to leave the research laboratory to tackle real-world tasks."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Architecture", "description": "Develop a thorough understanding of high-performance and energy-efficient computer architecture as a basis for informed software performance engineering."}, {"title": "Graphics", "description": "Understand basic concepts of computer graphics; and familiarise yourself with the mathematical principles used for computer generated imagery, techniques in realistic computer graphics and image synthesis, particularly image-based techniques for photorealism."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Security", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the themes and challenges of host-level native, web, and mobile security and privacy."}, {"title": "Complexity", "description": "Discover how to describe the complexity classes associated with title: Computing (Security and Reliability) MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Enhance your knowledge of IT security and reliability to prepare for a career in the computing industry.

title: Concrete Structures MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Learn to design, analyse and assess concrete structures such as bridges and buildings.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Structural Analysis", "description": "Gain fundamental insights into structural analysis, including the mechanics of materials and physical behaviour of structural elements."}, {"title": "Reinforced Concrete 1", "description": "Examine the design and behaviour of reinforced concrete structures at the design ultimate limit state."}, {"title": "Prestressed Concrete", "description": "Assess the structural behaviour and design criteria of prestressed concrete structures and review the current technology available for these structures."}, {"title": "Concrete Materials", "description": "Explore the field of concrete technology and understand the key processes influencing the behaviour and performance of concrete in service."}, {"title": "Reinforced Concrete 2", "description": "Gain a detailed understanding of the design of reinforced concrete slabs and structures like deep beams, squat shear walls and pile caps."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Finite Element Analysis", "description": "Understand the finite element method for structural analysis and investigate the accuracy and convergence characteristics of various finite elements."}, {"title": "Structural Dynamics", "description": "Become familiar with the most basic concepts and principles of dynamics as applied to structural engineering problems."}, {"title": "Structural Stability", "description": "Analyse the behaviour of structural components and systems that suffer from failure due to geometric nonlinearity."}, {"title": "Design of Timber and Masonry Structures", "description": "Familiarise yourself with the design of structures in timber and masonry and apply your knowledge to the design of simple conventional structures."}, {"title": "Cementitious Materials", "description": "Discover why cementitious materials are used throughout the built environment and learn about the chemistry behind them."}, {"title": "Nonlinear Structural Analysis", "description": "Discover the systematic procedures for geometric and material nonlinear structural analysis and advance your knowledge of nonlinear analysis software."}, {"title": "Seismic Design of Concrete Structures", "description": "Enhance your understanding of the concepts and principles required for the seismic design of reinforced concrete and masonry structures."}, {"title": "Design of Bridges", "description": "Examine the design and construction of bridges, as well as the main construction procedures for short, medium and long span bridges."}, {"title": "Structural Reliability Theory", "description": "Explore the main concepts and principles of structural safety and gain an appreciation for the power of probabilistic methods in structural engineering."}, {"title": "Theory of Shells", "description": "Understand the fundamental concepts and principles of the analysis and design of thin-walled shelled structures."}, {"title": "Structural Fire Engineering", "description": "Evaluate the concepts and principles of structural fire safety engineering and use sophisticated numerical tools to undertake performance-based fire safety engineering computations."}]}}}, "Design Project – Dissertation": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT + 2YPT + 3YPT)": {"items": []}, title: Conservation Science and Practice MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Learn to lead conservation programmes to tackle global biodiversity challenges based on conservation science practice
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to the Past, Present and Future of Biodiversity Conservation", "description": "Gain an understanding of the critical concepts of conservation science, how they developed and how they are used in international conservation efforts."}, {"title": "Navigating the Complexities of Social-Ecological Systems", "description": "Consider social and ecological processes, system dynamics and feedback loops at local, regional and global scales. Explore how these influence the effectiveness of potential solutions to environmental problems."}, {"title": "Effective Decision Making for Solving Conservation Problems", "description": "Effective conservation programs involve a myriad of decisions, the outcomes of which collectively influence the success of these initiatives. Learn how to use the techniques and evidence to effectively analyse outcomes and make excellent conservation decisions."}, {"title": "Ecological and Social Research Methods", "description": "Build a solid understanding of principles, concepts and techniques for ecological and social research. Learn to characterise biodiversity, study social-ecological systems, and explore how these techniques are used in a range of case studies around the world."}, {"title": "Implementing Conservation Practice Through Projects and Partnerships", "description": "Develop the practical skills to lead, fund, manage and deliver projects to become an effective conservation practitioner. Learn to translate challenges to opportunities, lead teams, collaborate effectively and organise conservation projects."}, {"title": "Inference and Estimation", "description": "Learn techniques to make data analysis and literature reviews reproducible and study a core set of statistical methods used in social and ecological research."}, {"title": "Conservation Actions and Interventions", "description": "Critically examine whether conservation actions lead to positive outcomes for both nature and humanity. Explore the importance of monitoring and evaluation to underpinning more effective, evidence-informed conservation."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Control and Optimisation MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
course_overview: Study aspects of control theory and optimisation and their application to the design of automated systems.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Control and optimisation laboratory", "description": "Understand best practice in experimental work in this laboratory-based module."}, {"title": "Individual research project", "description": "Carry out a piece of individual research with originality and scientific rigour, in the culmination of your postgraduate studies. The project will require you to adopt analytical, computation and/or experimental methods. You will be supervised by staff who are experts in the topic area of the project. This project will be assessed by written report and a poster presentation."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Control Engineering", "description": "Broaden your knowledge of advanced modern control methodologies and explore topics including Kalman filtering and tracking, fault detection and isolation, and linear matrix inequalities."}, {"title": "Design of Linear Multivariable Control Systems", "description": "Explore the principles for designing linear multivariable control systems to meet a range of practical applications."}, {"title": "Digital Control Systems", "description": "Gain a thorough overview of the analysis, control and simulation of discrete-time systems and discover theoretical techniques for studying them."}, {"title": "Optimisation", "description": "Learn how to design computer algorithms for finding minima and maxima and discover how to interpret and modify algorithms found in standard computer packages."}, {"title": "Predictive Control", "description": "Gain an appreciation of the fundamental principles in predictive control, the most widely used advanced control technique in industry."}, {"title": "Stability and Control of Non-linear Systems", "description": "Understand the concepts and theoretical techniques needed to study the stability and stabilisation of nonlinear control systems."}, {"title": "Systems Identification and Learning", "description": "Analyse different methods for constructing stochastic models of dynamic systems from measurements of input and output signals."}]}, "Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Applied Advanced Optimisation", "description": "Become equipped with the tools required to formulate and solve applied optimisation problems and build on your existing knowledge of descent methods and constrained optimisation."}, {"title": "Discrete-Event Systems", "description": "Discover the basic techniques involved in the modelling, analysis and control of discrete event systems and recognise the systems suitable for modelling in a discrete-event setup."}, {"title": "Distributed optimisation and learning", "description": "See how learning algorithms can be derived from risk minimisation and exploit these to derive distributed counterparts of the algorithms, both in federated and decentralised settings."}, {"title": "Modelling and Control of Multi-body Mechanical Systems", "description": "Explore theoretical approaches for the modelling and control of multibody mechanical systems, and distinguish between the two main branches of classical mechanics."}, {"title": "Optimal Control", "description": "Uncover the theory of optimal control and learn how control laws maximise defined performance measures of linear and nonlinear dynamical systems."}, {"title": "Probability and Stochastic Processes", "description": "Gain the analytical skills required to study random phenomena in engineering systems and learn how to set up probabilistic models for engineering problems."}, {"title": "Topics in Control Systems", "description": "Deepen your understanding of advanced modern control methodologies."}]}, "Group C": {"items": [{"title": "Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition", "description": "Discover the applications, basic formulations and concepts that underpin pattern recognition."}, {"title": "Game theory for multi-agent decision making", "description": "Discover a framework for formulating and solving decision-making processes and understand the relevance of game theory to information science."}, {"title": "Power System Dynamics, Stability and Control", "description": "Learn the strategy and protective actions that help ensure round-the-clock electricity supply."}, {"title": "Real-time Digital Signal Processing", "description": "Demonstrate your problem-solving skills as you explore the common issues encountered by a DSP engineer. Perform real-time DSP as part of your coursework."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Biomedical Research (Data Science) MRes | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Metabolism, Digestion and Reproduction
course_overview: Interdisciplinary training in 'big data' analysis, building skills towards a career in biomedical research.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Grant Writing Exercise", "description": "Compose a grant proposal, appropriate for submission to an academic funding body. This will correspond to your research project(s)."}, {"title": "Research Project 1 and Research Project 2", "description": "You'll carry out two mini research projects, exploring some of the most technologically advanced approaches currently being applied to biomedical research. title: Design with Behaviour Science MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Learn how to apply behavioural insights to the design of human-centred products and strategies.
structure_json: {"Core Modules": {"groups": {"Core Modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to Design with Behaviour Science", "description": "This module will introduce the combined principles of behaviour science and design-led insights. Learn to apply these skills in an applied project, and will be encouraged to think critically about what problem is being solved, how, and for whom."}, {"title": "Design Psychology", "description": "Understanding humans requires basic knowledge in psychology, and specifically those impacting behaviours in a given context. This module provides you with basic tools to consider human behaviour in the development of design solutions."}, {"title": "Design Engineering Practice", "description": "Deepen design engineering approaches, methods, and tools to develop innovative solutions for complex challenges. Master user and business needs evaluation, problem discovery, and generati on of solution concepts for portfolios, competitions, and potential commercialization."}, {"title": "Foundational Transdisciplinary Research Methods", "description": "Learn and apply a wide range of research methods involving human subjects. Gain foundational knowledge of various data collection and analysis techniques and use them to tackle complex problems."}, {"title": "Advanced Transdisciplinary Research Methods", "description": "Research and apply state-of-the-art transdisciplinary mixed methods to address complex problems in fields such as health and sustainability. Learn advanced quantitative techniques, Natural Language Processing, and AI chatbot development to analyse stakeholder behaviours and human-human and human-AI interactions."}, {"title": "Inferential Statistics and Causal Reasoning", "description": "This module focuses on application of commonly used inferential statistics approaches for social and behavioural sciences. You will learn how to choose a suitable analysis for a given problem, as well as conduct appropriate reporting practices to confidently and correctly analyse results from experimental and observational test data."}, {"title": "Sustainable Design and Strategy", "description": "In this module you will explore how to design for positive impact, and more preferable futures. You will gain an understanding of the tools and techniques available to implement sustainable design, reduce environmental impacts, and monitor the impacts of your interventions."}]}}}, "Optional Modules": {"groups": {"Optional Modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design Analytics for the Sharing Economy", "description": "Collaborative consumption businesses are based on sharing resources and services, as opposed to traditional ownership-based models. Gain a holistic view of sharing economy systems, and the resulting innovative business models, emerging  technologies, and new services being realised."}, {"title": "From Data to Product", "description": "This module  provides you with the right skillset to go from ideas that involve data to outcome that bring added value to the user of that data."}, {"title": "Responsible Engineering and Design Innovation", "description": "This module aims to introduce you to critical ways of thinking about technology products and their impact on individuals, their health and society as whole. Learn concepts from philosophy of engineering and psychology, design techniques for understanding stakeholders' values, and how to use ethical and responsible innovation frameworks."}, {"title": "Transformational Play", "description": "This module enables students to understand, critique, and create games and playful experiences for entertainment and social issues like health, education, sustainability, or social change. It introduces key concepts, aspects, and methods of game design and play experiences through rapid making and critiquing of analogue games."}, {"title": "Design of Visual Systems", "description": "This module aims to provide overall knowledge and understand of the human visual system, and the technology available for design engineers to acquire, analyse, interpret, and exploit visual information gathered with modern electronic components."}, {"title": "Advanced Industrial Design", "description": "Learn to develop industrial design skills and knowledge to a high professional level alongside gaining understanding of significant emerging themes and methodologies within the field."}, {"title": "Audio Experience Design", "description": "This module provides an introduction to audio technology and perception, which includes acoustics, psychoacoustics, digital signal processing, audio recording techniques, audio reproduction techniques, 3D sound synthesis and reproduction and other selected topics such as data sonification and loudspeakers design."}, {"title": "Designing Interventions for Behaviour Change", "description": "Develop your competence in scoping, analysing and developing creative interventions for behaviour change. You will be exposed to several creative behavioural frameworks that can be applied to the development of (digital and physical) product, service, event, policy, and organisational interventions."}, {"title": "Economics and Finance for Systems Design", "description": "This module focuses on core principles in micro-economics, accounting, finance, uncertainty modelling, and decision-making needed to assess the economic performance of engineering systems and products. You will assess the financial viability of a product or system of your choice, find the best performing designs, and build-in flexibility to deal pro-actively with risk and uncertainty."}, {"title": "Games and Mechanisms", "description": "Many design engineering problems involve interaction among agents within a system. Such interactions can be seen as games. Consequently, the module aims at giving you relevant basics to analyse interaction within systems as games. You will also be introduced to mechanism design, in order to steer agents in a game towards a certain outcome."}]}}}, "Research Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Design Engineering Research MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop transdisciplinary research skills in Design Engineering and apply these to societal problems.
structure_json: {"Core Modules": {"groups": {"Core Modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design Engineering Practice", "description": "Uncover design engineering approaches, methods, and tools to develop innovative solutions for complex challenges. Master user and business needs evaluation, problem discovery, and generati on of solution concepts for portfolios, competitions, and potential commercialization."}, {"title": "Foundational Transdisciplinary Research Methods", "description": "Learn and apply a wide range of research methods involving human subjects. Gain foundational knowledge of various data collection and analysis techniques and use them to tackle complex problems."}, {"title": "Advanced Transdisciplinary Research Methods", "description": "Discover and app ly state-of-the- art transdisciplinary mixed methods to address complex problems in fields such as health and sustainability. Learn advanced quantitative techniques, Natural Language Processing, and AI chatbot development to analyse stakeholder behaviours and human-human and human-AI interactions."}, {"title": "Modelling and Simulation", "description": "Learn how numeric simulations can be applied to problems in Design Engineering (and some problems selected from physical, biological, and social sciences). This module ranges from numeric underpinning to chaos and game theory with a range of applications that will give an early career researcher a window into the variety of tools available to them."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional Modules - Autumn Term (FHEQ Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Design Psychology", "description": "This module provides you with basic tools to consider human behaviour and experience to affect impactful design solutions to global challenges."}, {"title": "Design Analytics for the Sharing Economy", "description": "Collaborative consumption, or the sharing economy as it is also known, refers to businesses that are based on sharing resources and services, as opposed to traditional ownership-based models."}, {"title": "From Data to Product", "description": "The module focuses on various aspects of data science to design products from data. It first defines and introduces data products, as well as alternative ways to design with data."}, {"title": "Nano Design Engineering", "description": "This module will deliver a comprehensive introduction to Nanotechnology for Design Engineers. This course commences with an introduction to how the fundamental physical, electrical and optical properties of materials change on the nanoscale compared to their bulk counterparts."}, {"title": "Responsible Engineering and Design Innovation", "description": "This module aims to introduce you to critical ways of thinking about technology products and their impact on individuals, their health and society as a whole . The module explores design techniques for understanding stakeholders' values, and ethical and responsible innovation frameworks ."}, {"title": "Robotics Research Projects", "description": "Robotics Research Project will provide an overview of the latest research in the field of applied robotics, as well as a hands-on approach to bring critical skills together. This is done in a project-oriented course where students will design mechanical, electrical, and software subsystems of an overall functioning robot."}, {"title": "Sensing and Internet of Things", "description": "The module aims to provide students with sufficient tools and techniques to develop software and hardware platforms for the Internet of Things, obtain data from mobile and social sensors, perform data analysis, perform actuations, and use key insights from data mining."}]}, "Optional Modules - Spring Term (FHEQ Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Transformational Play", "description": "This module enables students to understand, critique, and create games and playful experiences for entertainment and social issues like health, education, sustainability, or social change."}, {"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing", "description": "This module provides engineering students with the platform needed to solve future industry challenges, get the most out of 3D printing technology and optimise designs."}, {"title": "Design of Visual Systems", "description": "This module aims to provide overall knowledge and understanding of the human visual system, and the technology available for design engineers to acquire , analyse, interpret and exploit visual information gathered with modern electronic components."}, {"title": "Inferential Statistics and Causal Reasoning", "description": "This module provides a strong emphasis on the application of commonly used inferential statistics approaches for social and behavioural sciences. You will learn about different modes of data and common tests and analyses (including, but not limited to, t-test, ANOVA, correlation, regression, and generalised linear modelling), as well as data cleaning and preparation techniques."}, {"title": "Sustainable Design and Strategy", "description": "This module aims to provide an understanding of the tools and techniques available to implement sustainable design and provide knowledge of the methods a company can employ to reduce environmental impacts, promote sustainable practices and build resilient propositions."}]}, "Optional Modules - Spring Term (FHEQ Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Industrial Design", "description": "This module provides the opportunity to further develop industrial design skills and knowledge to a high professional level alongside gaining an understanding of significant emerging themes and methodologies within the field."}, {"title": "Audio Experience Design", "description": "This module is a n introduction to audio technology and perception , which includes acoustics, psychoacoustics, digital signal processing, audio recording techniques, audio reproduction techniques, 3D sound synthesis and reproduction and other selected topics ."}, {"title": "Designing Interventions for Behaviour Change", "description": "This module will develop your competence in scoping, analysing and developing creative interventions for behaviour change. Possible interventions include wearables to improve health, products for more sustainable consumption and policy to improve tech-enabled business models."}, {"title": "Economics and Finance for Systems Design", "description": "The module focuses on core principles in micro-economics, accounting, finance, uncertainty modelling, and decision-making needed to assess the economic performance of engineering systems and products."}, {"title": "Games Theory and Mechanism Design", "description": "This module aims at giving relevant basics to the students to analyse interaction within systems as games. It introduces the principles to describe agents and the type of games they are involved in."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Design Engineers", "description": "The objective of this module is to de-mystify the topic and expose students, in an accessible manner, to both the basics of machine learning and to some of its most important methods."}]}}}, "Research Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Clinical Research (Diabetes and Obesity) | Study | Imperial College London

title: Digital Health Leadership | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Surgery and Cancer NHS Digital Academy
course_overview: Receive world-class training towards a career as a digital health leader on the flagship programme of the NHS Digital Academy.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Essentials of Health Systems", "description": "Learn about health systems from a national and international perspective and study current developments in health informatics."}, {"title": "Strategy and Transformational Change", "description": "Receive an orientation in the project and programme environment, title: Epidemiology MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Apply statistical and mathematical methods to investigate risk, control and prevention of infectious and chronic diseases.
structure_json: {"Compulsory modules": {"groups": {"Compulsory modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to Statistical Thinking and Data Analysis", "description": "D evelop the knowledge and skills required to conduct and interpret statistical analyses of epidemiological and health data. Learn about types of data, study designs, and statistical tools suitable for applied research and practice ."}, {"title": "Principles and Methods of Epidemiology", "description": "Explore core concepts of epidemiology and acquire the skills necessary to describe, analyse, interpret and appraise epidemiological studies."}, {"title": "Research Methods", "description": "Discover key theoretical concepts and techniques from fields such as philosophy, social sciences, epidemiology and statistics, discussed in the context of practical and ethical considerations to be made at each step of designing, planning, conducting and publishing quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods research."}, {"title": "Introduction to Infectious Disease Modelling", "description": "Learn how to mathematically model infectious diseases, simulate the model using a computer, and analyse it. Develop a research question, design and program a model to address it, analyse the results from the model, and understand how models influence public health policy"}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Bayesian Modelling for Spatial and Spatio-temporal Data", "description": "Learn about the main theoretical concepts of the Bayesian approach to probability and inference and how they inform statistical modelling and interpretation. Ac quire practical skills to manipulate, effectively visualize and model spatially- and temporally-related data , and critically interpret and discuss the results fro m analyses."}, {"title": "Further Methods in Infectious Disease Modelling", "description": "Interpret key evidence generated by modern infectious disease modelling methods that appear in non-specialist journals. Design, execute and interpret results from streamlined versions of those same models. Select the best model to address a given public health question."}, {"title": "Outbreaks", "description": "Learn techniques required to calibrate mathematical models and make the best use of evolving infectious disease outbreak data, and their relevance for real-time evidence-based public health decision-making. Explore the ecological context of infectious disease emergence and transmission."}, {"title": "Advanced Regression", "description": "Become familiar with the principles of advanced regression for high-dimensional data and apply these techniques on real data problems."}, {"title": "Emerging and Neglected Tropical Diseases", "description": "Develop skills to appraise public health strategies, control programmes, and surveillance systems for both emerging and neglected tropical diseases."}, {"title": "Genetics of Infectious Disease Pathogens", "description": "Understand the theoretical concepts and the practical methodology used in the genetic epidemiology of infectious pathogens, using recent real-life infectious disease epidemiology case studies."}, {"title": "Environmental Epidemiology", "description": "Learn why and when an environmental epidemiology study is necessary and useful, and how to evaluate effects of short- and long-term exposures."}, {"title": "Nutritional Epidemiology", "description": "Learn the fundamentals of eating behaviour and nutrition surveillance, and apply nutritional epidemiological methods that are commonly used to guide the development of public health interventions and public health policy."}, {"title": "Molecular and Genetic Epidemiology", "description": "Uncover the main types of study designs used in molecular and genetic epidemiologic investigations and identify potential sources of bias and the methods used to limit them."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - title: Engineering Fluid Mechanics for the Offshore, Coastal and Built Environments MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Gain advanced knowledge of fluid mechanics to solve real-world marine and built-environment challenges in renewable energy, environmental pollution, and urban climate.
structure_json: {"Pre-study": {"groups": {"Pre-sessional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Maths Resource", "description": "Build the fundamental mathematical skills needed to succeed in your studies."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics Primer", "description": "Familiarise yourself with the fundamentals of Fluid Mechanics."}]}}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Air-Sea Interaction Dynamics", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the coupled atmosphere ocean system, wave spectra, and the role of the Earth's rotation in geophysical fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Buoyancy-driven Flows", "description": "Obtain a detailed understanding of fluid motion driven by density differences and its relevance to civil engineering calculation and design."}, {"title": "Coastal Processes", "description": "Learn how to determine the nearshore characteristics of waves, currents, tides and storm surges plus the measures needed to protect coastal structures."}, {"title": "Computational Analysis", "description": "Analyse the computational methods used for the simulation and analysis of engineering fluid mechanics and solve practical numerical modelling problems."}, {"title": "Design Projects", "description": "Apply your Fluid Mechanics knowledge to solve a real-world problem and support engineering design with our industrial partners."}, {"title": "Energy Systems", "description": "Discover how energy systems work, the roles for renewable marine, wind and solar resources in the net-zero transition, and how to apply engineering principles to system design."}, {"title": "Fluid Loading", "description": "Understand the essentials of fluid-structure interaction and explore various flow regimes. Develop the skills to calculate forces acting on offshore and coastal structures, supporting safe and cost-effective engineering design, with insight into the applicability of standard design solutions."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics Fundamentals", "description": "Build the foundational knowledge in fluid mechanics that supports the study of complex air and water flows."}, {"title": "Modelling Tools", "description": "Apply your knowledge of fluid mechanics with mathematical and practical modelling tools and deploy them to solve genuine physical phenomena."}, {"title": "Transport Processes", "description": "Learn to estimate turbulent mass transport for tracers, contaminants and sediments in atmosphere, rivers, lakes and oceans."}, {"title": "Urban Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Explore current thinking on modelling the built environment and discover the tools required for both internal and external fluid flows in the built environment."}, {"title": "Wave Mechanics", "description": "Derive and apply linear and non-linear theories explaining wave motion and propagation needed in fundamental engineering and oceanographic applications."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT only)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee (CEE 1YFT only)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Physics with Fusion and Plasma Physics MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Gain the skills you need to prepare for a research career in plasma physics with a focus on fusion energy.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Theoretical Plasma Physics", "description": "Study the basic topics of plasma physics in a more detailed and mathematical way.  Create advanced theoretical methods to improve the quantitative analysis of plasma physics needed for research."}, {"title": "Inertial Confinement Fusion", "description": "Explore the advanced plasma physics concepts specific to laser-driven fusion and the associated fields of shock physics and high-energy density physics. Uncover the connections to laboratory astrophysics and high-intensity laser plasmas."}, {"title": "Magnetic Confinement Fusion", "description": "Dive into the advanced plasma physics concepts specific to tokamaks, stellarators, and other magnetic confinement devices. This module includes particle confinement, magnetic equilibrium and stability, and plasma-surface interaction."}, {"title": "Mathematical Methods for Physicists", "description": "Discover key mathematical methods used by physicists including basic linear algebra and vector space theory."}, {"title": "Plasma Physics", "description": "Learn the essentials about the nature of plasma and start your journey on mastering the key models such as single-particle motion, magnetohydrodynamics and kinetic theory."}, {"title": "Research Methods for Plasma Physics", "description": "Gain practical experience with essential simulation tools in plasma physics research while improving your Python skills. Develop a clear understanding of key experimental diagnostics for plasma measurement and learn how to effectively analyse experimental data."}, {"title": "Statistical Methods for Experimental Physics", "description": "Develop a foundational understanding of the statistics behind large-scale data analysis in the physical sciences. Covers key concepts underpinning the application of machine learning to the experimental sciences."}, {"title": "Research Project", "description": "Complete a three-month, full-time project on plasma physics."}, {"title": "Self-Study Project", "description": "Carry out a self-study project in a topic of your choice relevant to fusion or plasma physics."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Hydrodynamics", "description": "Further your knowledge of supersonic compressible flows, shock physics, inertial confinement fusion and high energy density physics."}, {"title": "Quantum Field Theory", "description": "Explore why QFT (Quantum Field Theory) is essential to understand nature at smallest scales. You'll also learn how to use Feynman diagrams to describe physical processes using perturbation theory."}, {"title": "Lasers (Level 6)", "description": "Acquire a mathematically rigorous understanding of laser physics and learn the basic mechanisms of laser action."}, {"title": "Information Theory", "description": "Understand the key physical concepts underlying laser and nonlinear optics and their contemporary applications."}, {"title": "Statistical Mechanics (Level 6)", "description": "Study how the co-operative behaviour of many simple constituents can lead to the emergence of new physics that could not have been predicted directly from the microscopic laws of motion."}, {"title": "Nanotechnology in Consumer Electronics", "description": "Analyse the way physical properties can be manipulated at the nanoscale compared to bulk materials and how that underpins modern electronic devices."}, {"title": "Space Physics", "description": "You will explore the physics of plasmas in the solar system, from the Sun and solar wind to planets, comets, and moons. You will apply plasma-physics concepts to understand and predict space weather and other space phenomena."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Future Power Networks MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
course_overview: Deepen your understanding of operating practice, design standards and regulatory policies in the electricity supply industry.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Selected Topics in Power Systems", "description": "This module provides an overview of five important topics - flexible AC transmission, power electronics in distribution, state estimation, impact of low system inertia and multi-vector integrated energy system."}, {"title": "Smart grid and data science", "description": "Understand the challenges of developing digitalised power systems from a techno-economic-socio perspective."}, {"title": "Laboratory", "description": "Improve your lab skills and improve your understanding of the steady-state and dynamic behaviour of a microgrid."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design of Linear Multivariable Control Systems", "description": "Understand the principles for designing linear multivariable control systems to meet a range of practical applications."}, {"title": "Electric Vehicle Technologies", "description": "Gain an overview of the technologies involved in making an electric vehicle (EV), as well as those required to enable wider adoption of EVs."}, {"title": "HVDC Technology and Control", "description": "This module covers two broad HVDC technologies and their system-level impact. The focus is on HVDC converter operation and control, operation of HVDC links and HVDC grids and interaction between HVDC and host AC systems."}, {"title": "Models for techno-economically driven optimal power system expansion", "description": "Learn to build and use engineering-economic models that optimisation expansion plans for future power systems."}, {"title": "Optimisation", "description": "Learn how to design computer algorithms for finding minima and maxima and discover how to interpret and modify algorithms found in standard computer packages."}, {"title": "Power System Economics", "description": "This module covers the analysis of market participants' strategies, the impact of demand elasticity on the market outcomes and prices, operational reliability and ancillary services, network congestion and related locational marginal pricing including transmission access rights, coordination of trading between energy and balancing services, investment in generation and transmission assets."}, {"title": "Power System Dynamics, Stability and Control", "description": "This module covers modelling of synchronous, asynchronous generation technologies (wind turbine generators), their control for system voltage, and frequency support and interaction with the system."}, {"title": "Probability and Stochastic Processes", "description": "Gain the analytical skills required to study random phenomena in engineering systems and learn how to set up probabilistic models for engineering problems."}, {"title": "Stability and Control of Low Carbon Power Systems", "description": "This module covers stability and control challenges encountered in a low (or zero) carbon electric power system including mitigation measures to facilitate deep decarbonisation. The scope is power systems with 100% inverter-based resources using a combination of grid-following and grid-forming converters."}, {"title": "Stability and Control of Non-linear Systems", "description": "Understand the concepts and theoretical techniques needed to study the stability and stabilisation of nonlinear control systems."}, {"title": "Sustainable Electrical Systems", "description": "This module covers the enabling technologies and system-level considerations for transforming the electricity system into a more sustainable form. Apart from operation of the low carbon energy technologies (such as wind, solar, hydro, heat networks etc.) the planning and operational challenges posed by decarbonisation are described."}, {"title": "Topics in Control Systems", "description": "Broaden your knowledge of advanced modern control methodologies and explore topics including Kalman filtering and tracking, fault detection and isolation, and linear matrix inequalities."}]}}}, "Individual Research Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: General Structural Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Gain advanced training in the analysis, design, and assessment of civil engineering structures.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Reinforced Concrete 1", "description": "Examine the design and behaviour of reinforced concrete structures at the design ultimate limit state."}, {"title": "Steel Components", "description": "Understand the behaviour of steel structures and learn to design structural steel members and connections."}, {"title": "Structural Analysis", "description": "Gain fundamental insights into structural analysis, including the mechanics of materials and physical behaviour of structural elements."}, {"title": "Design of Steel Buildings", "description": "Analyse the conceptual design of a range of structural framing systems used in the construction sector and issues related to structural form and behaviour."}, {"title": "Reinforced Concrete 2", "description": "Gain a detailed understanding of the design of reinforced concrete slabs and structures like deep beams, squat shear walls and pile caps."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design of Timber and Masonry Structures", "description": "Familiarise yourself with the design of structures in timber and masonry and apply your knowledge to the design of simple conventional structures."}, {"title": "Cementitious Materials", "description": "Discover why cementitious materials are used throughout the built environment and learn about the chemistry behind them."}, {"title": "Composite Structures", "description": "Analyse, evaluate and exploit the mechanical behaviour of fibre reinforced polymer composites to facilitate their use in engineering structures."}, {"title": "Structural Steel Technology", "description": "Develop your understanding of structural steel physical metallurgy and learn to apply this knowledge to the manufacture of steels to understand factors leading to corrosion and brittle fracture of steel."}, {"title": "Materials Selection", "description": "Explore the great diversity and properties of materials and learn how to systematically select the appropriate materials for engineering applications."}, {"title": "Finite Element Analysis", "description": "Understand the finite element method for structural analysis and investigate the accuracy and convergence characteristics of various finite elements."}, {"title": "Prestressed Concrete", "description": "Assess the structural behaviour and design criteria of prestressed concrete structures and review the current technology available for these structures."}, {"title": "Structural Dynamics", "description": "Become familiar with the most basic concepts and principles of dynamics as applied to structural engineering problems."}, {"title": "Structural Stability", "description": "Analyse the behaviour of structural components and systems that suffer from failure due to geometric nonlinearity."}, {"title": "Concrete Structures", "description": "Investigate a range of topics within the field of concrete technology and understand the key processes influencing the behaviour and performance of concrete in service."}, {"title": "Design of Bridges", "description": "Examine the design and construction of bridges, as well as the main construction procedures for short, medium and long span bridges."}, {"title": "Nonlinear Structural Analysis", "description": "Discover the systematic procedures for geometric and material nonlinear structural analysis and advance your knowledge of nonlinear analysis software."}, {"title": "Plated Structures", "description": "Understand the behaviour and design of plated steel structures including the elastic buckling and post-buckling of plates under in-plane loading."}, {"title": "Structural Fire Engineering", "description": "Evaluate the concepts and principles of structural fire safety engineering and use sophisticated numerical tools to undertake performance-based fire safety engineering computations."}, {"title": "Structural Reliability of Shells", "description": "Understand the fundamental concepts and principles of the analysis and design of thin-walled shelled structures."}]}}}, "Design Project - Dissertation": {"groups": {}}, title: Genomic Medicine | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Acquire the knowledge and skills to be able to interpret and understand genomic data across a range of settings.
structure_json: {"Compulsory modules": {"groups": {"Compulsory modules": {"items": [{"title": "Fundamentals in Human Genetics and Genomics", "description": "Build the foundational knowledge in genomic science required for subsequent modules, exploring topics including genomic architecture and regulatory systems."}, {"title": "Omics Technologies and their Application to Genomic Medicine", "description": "Examine the omics techniques used to assess genomic and epigenomic variation in clinical problems and critically evaluate which techniques can be used and their limitations."}, {"title": "Genomics of Common and Rare Inherited Diseases", "description": "Understand the different ways that genetic variation can cause disease, and critically evaluate the relative merits of different methods of genetic analysis."}, {"title": "Molecular Pathology of Cancer and Application in Cancer Diagnosis, Screening and Treatment", "description": "Analyse the principles of cancer genomics and assess how genomic analysis impacts these factors and ethical issues. title: Geo-Energy with Machine Learning and Data Science MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Earth Science and Engineering
course_overview: Develop the essential data science and machine learning skills needed to embark on a career as a geoscientist or engineer.

types of classical machine learning algorithms."}, {"title": "Computational Mathematics", "description": "Explore the essential mathematics underpinning computational science, data science and machine learning."}, {"title": "Applying Computational/Data Science", "description": "Work collaboratively to solve problems using software and summarise your work using presentations."}, {"title": "Deep formation."}, {"title": "Fluids and Fluid Flow in Porous Media", "description": "Learn about fluids with single and multiphase flow properties in porous media and how to use analytical and numerical title: Geotechnical and Earthquake Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Gain specialised skills in seismic hazard assessment and earthquake-resistant design of geotechnical structures for regions prone to seismic activity.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Seepage and Consolidation", "description": "Develop your understanding of the flow of water in soil strata under both steady state conditions (seepage) and transient conditions (consolidation)."}, {"title": "Strength and Deformation", "description": "Build upon basic principles of soil mechanics to establish modern frameworks for describing the behaviour of clays and sands under a variety of loading conditions using Critical State Soil Mechanics theory."}, {"title": "Analysis and Constitutive Modelling", "description": "Uncover the theory behind the methods of analysis available for geotechnical design and understand the assumptions behind different methods."}, {"title": "Site Investigation and Engineering Geomorphology", "description": "Gain an in-depth understanding of site investigation techniques and learn how they can be used within the context of the geological and geomorphological setting to reduce uncertainty in the subsurface."}, {"title": "Laboratory Testing and Data Interpretation", "description": "Analyse the design of rigorous geotechnical laboratory testing programmes, and develop the critical skill and ability to recognise and assess experimental errors."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Hazards", "description": "Explore the fundamental elements of engineering seismology and seismic hazard assessment."}, {"title": "Design of Foundations and Retaining Structures", "description": "Learn how to design foundations and earth-retaining structures, solving typical geotechnical soil-structure interaction problems."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Infrastructure: Slopes and Embankments", "description": "Examine the geotechnical characteristics of slopes and embankments, and learn how to classify mechanisms that underpin landslides, considering both geomorphological and geotechnical criteria."}, {"title": "Advanced Soil Mechanics", "description": "Assess the fundamentals of soil response, considering advanced material behaviour and more complex external conditions."}, {"title": "Applied Numerical Analysis", "description": "Discuss, prepare and run a Finite Element (FE) analysis of a geotechnical problem and compare between numerical and analytical solutions."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Earthquake Engineering", "description": "Understand the fundamentals of soil dynamics and perform an equivalent-linear site response analysis."}, {"title": "Geotechnics Fieldwork", "description": "Develop your geotechnical skills in the natural environment on three separate field trips spaced through the academic year. Gain first-hand experience of real world rock/soils, geological setting, geohazards and construction projects."}, {"title": "Current Developments in Geotechnical Engineering", "description": "Learn from experts in industry on current developments in the field and explore present prominent projects from all over the world."}]}}}, "Research project – Geotechnics": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT + 2YPT)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee (CEE 1YFT + 2YPT)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Health Data Analytics and Machine Learning MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop skills in using cutting-edge quantitative methods to fully exploit complex data.

title: Health Policy | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Surgery and Cancer Institute of Global Health Innovation
course_overview: Shape the future of global health guided by international academics and practitioners.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Policy Theory, Economics & Public Health": {"items": [{"title": "Health Systems and Policy", "description": "Discover the building blocks of health systems, such as financing, human resources, information policy, service delivery, leadership and governance, and how their interrelatedness informs the design of effective policies."}, {"title": "Health Economics and Behavioural Science", "description": "Acquire a comprehensive overview of health economics principles and behavioural science concepts and theory. This will allow you to carry out economic evaluations of healthcare programmes and policies, and explore behavioural determinants to develop health behaviour change interventions."}, {"title": "Financing Healthcare", "description": "Use an interdisciplinary approach to study the principles and methods used to finance healthcare in a global context, with an emphasis on the policy challenges for population health."}, {"title": "Health and Society", "description": "Study public health and its principles and practice, with the opportunity to learn about and undertake critical appraisal of research evidence, to design successful emergency interventions for global health crises."}, {"title": "Innovation in Healthcare", "description": "Develop expertise in the principles of innovation in healthcare: how and why innovation comes about, the role of different sectors and actors, and the health policy implications of future innovations."}, {"title": "Health Service Delivery", "description": "Gain insight into the realities of putting health policy into practice in the setting of a tertiary hospital. Consider key issues of policy implementation, such as patient and workforce perspectives."}, {"title": "Leadership", "description": "Explore foundational principles of effective leadership across various contexts, including personality and individual differences, motivational strategies, multicultural competence, conflict and organisational culture, and change leadership."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Measuring and Improving Performance in Healthcare", "description": "Learn the foundational concepts of measuring health system performance, the different aspects or domains of performance, and the power of comparison and international benchmarking."}, {"title": "Communication and Health Policy", "description": "Develop practical communication tools and an in-depth understanding of the health communication landscape. title: Innovation Design Engineering MA/MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Dyson School of Design Engineering RCA School of Design
course_overview: Go beyond boundaries to create impact. A programme for fiercely curious changemakers.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Year 1": {"items": [{"title": "IDE Fundamentals", "description": "Build your confidence through project-based learning in the key differentiating IDE concepts."}, {"title": "Transdisciplinary Practices", "description": "Critically explore how skills, mindsets, knowledge and practices from different disciplines can be combined to form new holistic practices that enhance innovation."}, {"title": "Cyber Physical Systems", "description": "Learn how physical computing, connected systems, data science and machine learning can tackle complex problems. A foundational course building knowledge in areas such as mechanical design, control & feedback systems, electronics and coding."}, {"title": "RCA College Wide Unit", "description": "Embark on a ambitious interdisciplinary RCA College-wide unit that supports how you respond to the challenges of complex, uncertain and changing physical and digital worlds through engagement in global creative networks that draws on expertise within and beyond the institution and seeks to provoke critical reflection of students' creative practice."}, {"title": "RCA School of Design Grand Challenge", "description": "Learn how to develop creatively driven and innovative solutions to a new and emerging major global issue (a Grand Challenge) through working in interdisciplinary creative teams across the Royal College of Art School of Design."}, {"title": "Regenerative Materials, Structures and Aesthetics", "description": "Delve into materials and their materiality in terms of their behaviours, capabilities and environmental impact through critical analysis and experimentation."}, {"title": "Impact", "description": "Explore and evaluate how context (cultural, geographic, social and economic) can frame and highlight opportunities for innovation and impact through collaborative contextual study projects with external stakeholders."}, {"title": "Sustainable Systems", "description": "Build skills in systems level approaches to innovation and transitioning products, services and systems to circular and regenerative outcomes, including developing capabilities in utilising expert networks for transdisciplinary practice."}, {"title": "Agency & Implementation", "description": "Develop agency and vision in scoping, planning and design in an area of individual interest and focus together with a design concept with associated emergent specialist skills to high levels of practical resolution including testing and validation."}, {"title": "Professional Consolidation (Part 1)", "description": "Undergo a process of development and consolidation of external experience relating to professional pathways in organisations, own ventures or research fields."}, {"title": "Professional Consolidation (Part 2)", "description": "Develop personal-professional agency to define and plan individual and team-based directions to commence the second year of study."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Year 2": {"items": [{"title": "Transdisciplinary Teamwork & Leadership", "description": "Learn to create innovation design engineering value with validated potential impact through effective team working in a defined area of contextual need or opportunity."}, {"title": "Context Exploration – Masters Project", "description": "Self-directed project: identify and investigate a context for study through a process of planning, primary and secondary research to discover important issues and opportunities for innovation design engineering."}, {"title": "Iterative Development – Masters Project", "description": "Self-directed project: build on the issues and opportunities uncovered in 'Context Exploration' with a focus on synthesis and evaluation of innovation design engineering opportunities, followed by iterative creation and evaluation of a range of ideas, concepts and embodiments with key stakeholders in terms of their potential impact from social, cultural, economic, ethical and environmental perspectives."}, {"title": "Validated Delivery – Masters Project", "description": "Self-directed project: build on the insights gained from the 'Iterative Development' with a focus on the iterative design, development and evaluation of the proposed innovation with key stakeholders for validation, communication and diffusion."}, {"title": "Choice of Electives", "description": "A range of Elective modules drawn from across the Dyson School of Design Engineering – more details to follow."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing", "description": "This module provides engineering students with the platform needed to solve future industry challenges, get the most out of 3D printing technology and optimise designs."}, {"title": "Design of Visual Systems", "description": "This module aims to provide overall knowledge and understanding of the human visual system, and the technology available for design engineers to acquire , analyse, interpret and exploit visual information gathered with modern electronic components."}, {"title": "Sustainable Design and Strategy", "description": "This module aims to provide an understanding of the tools and techniques available to implement sustainable design and provide knowledge of the methods a company can employ to reduce environmental impacts, promote sustainable practices and build resilient propositions."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Storage Design", "description": "TBC"}, {"title": "Advanced Industrial Design", "description": "This module provides the opportunity to further develop industrial design skills and knowledge to a high professional level alongside gaining an understanding of significant emerging themes and methodologies within the field."}, {"title": "Audio Experience Design", "description": "This module is a n introduction to audio technology and perception , which includes acoustics, psychoacoustics, digital signal processing, audio recording techniques, audio reproduction techniques, 3D sound synthesis and reproduction and other selected topics ."}, {"title": "Designing Interventions for Behaviour Change", "description": "This module will develop your competence in scoping, analysing and developing creative interventions for behaviour change. Possible interventions include wearables to improve health, products for more sustainable consumption and policy to improve tech-enabled business models."}, {"title": "Economics and Finance for Systems Design", "description": "The module focuses on core principles in micro-economics, accounting, finance, uncertainty modelling, and decision-making needed to assess the economic performance of engineering systems and products."}, {"title": "Games Theory and Mechanism Design", "description": "This module aims at giving relevant basics to the students to analyse interaction within systems as games. title: Machine Learning and Data Science (Online) MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop an in-depth understanding of machine learning models and learn to apply them to real-world problems.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Programming for Data Science", "description": "Gain fluency in both R and Python, for proficient use in later modules. Topics include random number generation, using vectors and matrices, working with APIs, and reading from/writing to different file formats. The module also covers practices for ensuring code correctness, such as profiling, debugging and unit testing, and how to package code for distribution."}, {"title": "Applicable Mathematics", "description": "Gain familiarity with statistical and mathematical tools that will be used in later modules. You'll review the fundamentals of calculus, linear algebra, and probability theory, as well as other topics including matrix decomposition techniques, convergence of random variables, sample-based statistical inference, and numerical optimisation methods."}, {"title": "Exploratory Data Analytics and Visualisation", "description": "Produce convincing narrative summaries and informative visualisations for a variety of complex datasets. You'll learn how to evaluate the quality of a given dataset, diagnose and remedy missing and anomalous data, and consider the suitability of different exploratory analyses for various data types including spatial and temporal data."}, {"title": "Supervised Learning", "description": "Become familiar with data analysis and modelling, classification and resampling methods, and advanced topics like Random Forest and Support Vector Machines. Gain the skills and knowledge to choose the appropriate supervised learning technique to effectively analyse and interpret data."}, {"title": "Ethical Machine Learning and Data Science Part 1", "description": "Explore the ethical implications of the new capabilities offered by data science and artificial intelligence in this comprehensive and technical module. Delve into topics such as model explainability, causation, fairness, and privacy by examining real-world examples of shortcomings and negative outcomes. Increase your knowledge and skills in depth across two years through this three-part module."}, {"title": "Unsupervised Learning", "description": "Assess the tools and techniques for solving unsupervised learning challenges, exploring topics including clustering, dimension reduction and density estimation."}, {"title": "Bayesian Methods and Computation", "description": "Examine subjective probabilities and the Bayesian paradigm for making coherent individual decisions in the presence of uncertainty."}, {"title": "Learning Agents", "description": "Investigate key decision-making frameworks and develop expertise for taking machine learning beyond the prediction process to formal decision-making processes."}, {"title": "Unstructured Data Analysis", "description": "Learn the mathematics of techniques dealing with three unstructured data types: images, networks, and text. Master deep learning and well-established statistical methods to tackle unstructured data and implement statistical and machine learning tasks."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Select and explore an appropriate deep learning model architecture for a given supervised and unsupervised learning application. You'll be able to implement data and training pipelines for different types of neural networks, as well as implement appropriate evaluation measures and model selection strategies for supervised and unsupervised applications."}, {"title": "Big Data: Statistical Scalability with PySpark", "description": "Learn statistical concepts such as parameter estimation with large scale data and explore data sampling strategies in a Big Data world. Design and develop data analysis procedures using Big Data technology (Hadoop and Spark), learn to utilise Big Data technology to perform a rigorous statistical analysis, and describe and apply mathematical techniques for fitting statistical models at scale and dealing with streaming data."}, {"title": "Ethical Machine Learning and Data Science Part 2", "description": "Build on your existing knowledge of ethics in data science and artificial intelligence and explore real-world issues."}]}}}, "Individual Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - Machine Learning and Data Science (Online)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Goods and Services Tax (GST) for online courses": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - Machine Learning and Data Science (Online)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Goods and Services Tax (GST) for online courses": {"items": []}}}}

title: Machine Learning and Big Data in the Physical Sciences MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Deepen your understanding of the methodologies used in research involving large data sets.

large scale data analysis in the physical sciences, and cover key concepts in statistical modelling and statistical inference."}, {"title": "Applied Machine Learning", "description": "Receive hands-on experience of the techniques required to analyse large data sets and develop your knowledge of the Python computing language."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Accelerated Processing for Big Data Analysis", "description": "Become familiar with accelerators in computing and learn how to find the best architecture for the problem/algorithm."}, {"title": "Advanced Particle Physics", "description": "Take a look at the \"Standard Model\" (SM) in detail and discover why it has become so important in the study of particle physics."}, {"title": "Computational Physics", "description": "Explore finite difference methods to solve differential equations in physics, and design and write computer programs to solve physics problems."}, {"title":
