title: Mathematics and Finance MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Broaden your knowledge of mathematics and quantitative finance for a career in the financial services sector.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Fundamental of Option Pricing", "description": "Become familiar with option pricing theory and its mathematical and conceptual underpinnings"}, {"title": "Statistical Methods for Finance", "description": "Understand the new regulations imposed on banks to require more statistical knowledge and assess the current needs of the financial sector."}, {"title": "Stochastic Processes", "description": "Explore probability theory, measure theory and the basic tools from stochastic analysis that provide the mathematical foundations for option pricing theory."}, {"title": "Quantitative Risk Management", "description": "Learn why proper risk management is of utmost importance for the solvency of financial institutions and stability of the entire financial system."}, {"title": "Interest Rate Models", "description": "Understand the theory and practice of term structure of interest rates in relation to credit risk, funding liquidity costs, collateral modelling and multiple curves."}, {"title": "Computing for Finance", "description": "Become familiar with programming in C++ and in Python for quantitative finance problems."}, {"title": "Simulation Methods for Finance", "description": "Evaluate derivatives used in today's financial markets and examine simulation methods used in finance and probabilistic numerical methods for PDEs."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Optimisation in Machine Learning", "description": "Discover how to solve several classes of optimisation problems, including linear, quadratic, stochastic, conic, and robust programming."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Learn the structure and components of multi-layer neural nets and develop deep neural networks to solve computational and statistical problems in finance."}, {"title": "Portfolio Management", "description": "Understand the principles of quantitative portfolio management and apply and implement widely-used approaches such as factor models and momentum strategies."}, {"title": "Quantum Machine Learning in Finance", "description": "Discover how quantum computing technology and algorithms can be used to solve financial problems, including portfolio optimisation and data generation."}, {"title": "Reinforcement Learning", "description": "Develop your understanding of data analysis and 'machine learning' techniques, illustrated by applications in finance."}, {"title": "Quantitative Trading and Price Impact", "description": "Study specificities of automated trading and develop the mathematical tools required to construct trading algorithms in a high-frequency framework."}, {"title": "Numerical Methods in Finance", "description": "Explore the main numerical tools required to work in a quantitative field, including the mathematical techniques underlying Finite difference schemes, Fourier transforms, and quadrature and linear programming."}, {"title": "Market Microstructure", "description": "Develop a thorough understanding of how trades occur in financial markets and learn how to measure liquidity and recognise the recent increase in liquidity fragmentation and hidden, \"dark\" liquidity."}, {"title": "Stochastic Control in Finance", "description": "Apply the main concepts and techniques from dynamics stochastic optimisation and stochastic control theory to the realm of quantitative finance."}, {"title": "Topics in Derivatives Pricing", "description": "Advance your knowledge of derivatives pricing and asset allocation and build familiarity with the stochastic volatility model and jump diffusion model."}, {"title": "Selected Topics in Quantitative Finance", "description": "Complement your existing financial knowledge by building an appreciation of the specificities of foreign exchange and fixed income markets."}, {"title": "Generative Modelling in Finance", "description": "You will explore leading generative AI methods, including denoising diffusion models, flow matching, and neural stochastic differential equations, and discover how these differential equation–based techniques drive cutting-edge image, audio, and video generation (e.g., Stable Diffusion 3, Movie Gen Video) as well as breakthroughs in science such as AlphaFold 3."}]}}}, "Research project": title: Medical Device Design and Entrepreneurship MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop research and analytical skills towards a career in bioengineering or for further PHD study.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Data Analysis for Research", "description": "Explore key data analysis methods used in bioengineering and life sciences research. Learn how to apply statistical techniques and integrate them into your own research projects."}, {"title": "Effective Communication Skills", "description": "Learn essential skills to communicate your business ideas effectively in a variety of media, from traditional outlets to social media platforms.  You'll learn about different audiences including angel investors, venture capital and grant-funding bodies, government and regulatory bodies, and the general public."}, {"title": "Medical Device Certification", "description": "Deepen your understanding of the key skills needed by professional engineers in the development of medical systems and devices, specifically in the preparation of regulatory approval."}, {"title": "Financial Forecasting, Deal Structuring and Negotiations", "description": "Develop core skills and learn key concepts to plan, start and run a technology business in medical devices. You'll gain a critical understanding of fundraising and financial planning, contracts and law, and business negotiation, through lectures, case studies and practical workshops."}, {"title": "Market Analysis for Medical Device Entrepreneurship", "description": "Start your research journey by exploring the market landscape for your medical device idea. In this module, you'll analyse user needs and industry trends to build a strong case for the technology you'll develop in your multi-term project."}, {"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship", "description": "Explore various aspects of medical device entrepreneurship, looking at case studies from start-ups, industry and investment firms to gain a sense of the process and challenges in developing your own business idea."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis", "description": "Explore the title: Medical Robotics and Image-Guided Intervention MRes | Study | Imperial College London

title: Master of Public Health (Online) | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Research the world's most pressing public health issues through a flexible online degree.

This is a prerequisite for progression to the three-year Master's pathway."}, {"title": "Quality Improvement in Healthcare", "description": "Recognise and utilise different approaches to quality improvement and critically evaluate these approaches."}, {"title": "Digital Health", "description": "Examine the portfolio of digital health technologies, and the opportunities to apply these technologies to improve the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare."}, {"title": "Global Health Innovations", "description": "Understand the roles and processes of innovation in global health, including simple, low-cost technologies and more complex models used in resource-constrained settings."}, {"title": "Health Economics", "description": "Study the basic principles of microeconomics and their application to healthcare."}, {"title": "Infectious Disease Modelling", "description": "Review the basic methods used in mathematical models and learn how to construct a mathematical model for a given infectious disease."}, {"title": "Machine Learning", "description": "Review the fundamental foundations of machine learning, unsupervised learning, supervised learning, and advanced topics such as ensemble learning and deep learning."}, {"title": "Participatory Approaches in Public Health", "description": "Scrutinise the process of designing an appropriate participatory approach to a given public health challenge, and examine the history, theory and practice of these approaches."}, {"title": "Population Health Improvement", "description": "Examine the theoretical basis and practical applications of health promotion, including methods for evaluating health promotion interventions. title: Nanomedicine and Nanodiagnostics MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Investigate the unique properties of nanoscale materials for the treatment, detection, visualisation and prevention of diseases.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Nanomedicine", "description": "Develop an understanding of the fundamentals of biomedical nanoscience, leading into nanomedicine and its applications. Students will become familiar with how nanomedicines are made, characterised and what the clinical translation and commercialisation pathway entails."}, {"title": "Molecular Imaging", "description": "Gain an overview of the applications of chemistry in imaging, including contrast agents for MRI, optical probes (including small molecules, fluorescent proteins and nanoparticles), tracers for PET and SPECT, and ultrasound imaging."}, {"title": "Bench-to-Bedside group project", "description": "Investigate a nanomedicine or nanodiagnostic model of your choice for the treatment of a specific disease. You'll then write a report on how to design, synthesise, characterise and test this model, before proposing a plan for translation to the clinic. Present your idea or invention in the form of a 10 minute business pitch to peers and programme supervisors."}, {"title": "Nanodiagnostics poster", "description": "Fully research a topic of your interest in nanodiagnostics, propose a hypothesis on the subject, and then prepare an engaging poster to be pitched to a scientific audience."}]}}}, "Research Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - MRes Chemistry courses": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - MRes Chemistry courses": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Neurotechnology MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop your expertise for a career at the interface between neuroscience and engineering.
structure_json: {"Core Modules": {"groups": {"Core Modules": {"items": [{"title": "Neuroscience", "description": "Gain a grounding in core neuroscience concepts and understand the 'state of the art' with regard to research methodology."}, {"title": "Data Analysis for Research", "description": "Learn data analysis methodologies and understand how to integrate these concepts into your research projects. "}, {"title": "Topics in Neural Engineering", "description": "Explore a broad range of topics related to neural engineering and relevant to your specific research project."}, {"title": "Frontiers in Neurotechnology Research", "description": "Become familiar with the breadth and variety of research in neurotechnology, and develop presentation, writing and critical analysis skills."}, {"title": "Planning for Research", "description": "Begin the background research and planning for your project. "}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Imaging Technologies for Systems Biology", "description": "Examine advanced imaging technologies and "Explore the core aspects of biological and clinical measurement such as data handling, sampling and measurement."}, {"title": "Bioengineering Approaches to Cancer", "description": "Understand the fundamental biological and biophysical processes involved in cancer and the application of bioengineering to better understand and manage the disease."}, {"title": "Biomimetics", "description": "Cover the scope of biomimetics and investigate the principles that help engineers solve technical problems using inspiration from nature."}, {"title": "Brain Machine Interfaces", "description": "Discover technology used in clinical settings for interfacing of the human brain to electronic circuitry."}, {"title": "Cellular and Molecular Mechanotransduction", "description": "Study biomechanics on a understanding the nervous system."}, {"title": "Human Neuromechanical Control and Learning", "description": "Assess the control of human movement from the perspective of both adaptation of the neural of computation involved in interpreting images."}, {"title": "Ionising Tissue and Flow imaging", "description": "Appreciate the basic physics of nuclear medicine and discover the range of applications {"title": "Principles of Biomedical Imaging", "description": "Examine how images of the body can be obtained using different forms of penetrating radiation and how different forms of imaging work."}, title: Geotechnical Engineering with Offshore Renewables MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Specialise in geotechnical engineering principles and apply them to offshore renewable energy infrastructure.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Seepage and Consolidation", "description": "Develop your understanding of the flow of water in soil strata under both steady state conditions (seepage) and transient conditions (consolidation)."}, {"title": "Strength and Deformation", "description": "Build upon basic principles of soil mechanics to establish modern frameworks for describing the behaviour of clays and sands under a variety of loading conditions using Critical State Soil Mechanics theory."}, {"title": "Analysis and Constitutive Modelling", "description": "Uncover the theory behind the methods of analysis available for geotechnical design and understand the assumptions behind different methods."}, {"title": "Laboratory Testing and Data Interpretation", "description": "Analyse the design of rigorous geotechnical laboratory testing programmes, and develop the critical skill and ability to recognise and assess experimental errors."}, {"title": "Structural Dynamics", "description": "Gain a grounding in the basic concepts and principles of structural dynamics, part of the integrated load analysis in offshore renewables. This module will train you in the idealization, analytical formulation, and mathematical solution of dynamic phenomena in structural engineering."}, {"title": "Hydrodynamic Loading", "description": "Master the fundamentals of hydrodynamic loading and structures in an offshore environment. This module will introduce to you wave theories and help you gain a fundamental understanding of fluid loading."}, {"title": "Design of Foundations and Retaining Structures", "description": "Learn how to design foundations and earth-retaining structures, solving typical geotechnical soil-structure interaction problems."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Infrastructure: Slopes and Embankments", "description": "Examine the geotechnical characteristics of slopes and embankments, and learn how to classify mechanisms that underpin landslides, considering both geomorphological and geotechnical criteria."}, {"title": "Applied Numerical Analysis", "description": "Discuss, prepare and run a Finite Element (FE) analysis of a geotechnical problem and compare between numerical and analytical solutions."}, {"title": "Design project: Offshore renewables", "description": "Liaise with an industrial client in groups to develop, design, and assess a solution for an offshore renewable energy project. You'll apply interdisciplinary knowledge to tackle real-world challenges in offshore renewable energy, develop practical skills for designing structures resilient to dynamic offshore conditions, cultivate teamwork and project management skills, and communicate complex design proposals effectively."}, {"title": "Offshore Geotechnical Engineering", "description": "This module will delve into the current techniques used in site geotechnical and geophysical exploration, soil characterisation, and basic design approaches for a number of foundation elements often used in offshore structures, such as suction caissons, piles, anchors and spudcans, as well as elements of pipeline geotechnics."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Fieldwork", "description": "Develop your geotechnical skills in the natural environment on three separate field trips spaced through the academic year. Gain first-hand experience of real world rock/soils, geological setting, geohazards and construction projects."}, {"title": "Current Developments in Geotechnical Engineering", "description": "Learn from experts in industry on current developments in the field and explore present prominent projects from all over the world."}]}}}, "Research project - Geotechnics": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT + 2YPT)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee (CEE 1YFT + 2YPT)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Optics and Photonics MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Discover why optics is of key importance to many industrial sectors on one of the College's longest-established courses.

title: Physics MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Build your physics knowledge to prepare for a research career within a university or national laboratory.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Classical Physics*", "description": "Gain a thorough understanding of classical physics at an advanced level and explore theories of quantum mechanics and general relativity."}, {"title": "Mathematical Methods for Physicists", "description": "Discover key mathematical methods used by physicists including "Carry out a self-study project in an area of your choice, with work assessed by coursework and practicals."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Hydrodynamics", "description": "Further your knowledge of supersonic compressible flows, shock physics, inertial confinement fusion and high energy density physics."}, {"title": "Information Theory", "description": "Understand the key physical concepts underlying laser and nonlinear optics and their contemporary applications."}, {"title": "Lasers (Level 6)", "description": "Acquire a mathematically rigorous understanding of laser physics and learn the basic mechanisms of laser action."}, {"title": "Light & Matter (Level 6)", "description": "Analyse the structure of atoms and molecules and their interactions with static and time-varying fields."}, {"title": "Medical Imaging: X-Rays and Ultrasound (Level 6)", "description": "Learn how physical principles are used to generate contrast in modern medical imaging using X-rays and ultrasound."}, {"title": "Nanotechnology in Consumer Electronics", "description": "Analyse the way physical properties can be manipulated at the nanoscale compared to bulk materials and how that underpins modern electronic devices."}, {"title": "Optical Communications", "description": "Become familiar with the operation principles and technology of optical fibre networks and the factors that can limit light transmission and the information it carries."}, {"title": "Quantum Systems I", "description": "Enhance your knowledge of title: Machine Learning and Process Systems Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop coding and mathematical skills relevant to the process industries.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Process Operations", "description": "Learn how to formulate, solve and interpret meaningful optimisation problems, embedding dynamic systems."}, {"title": "Advanced Optimisation for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Learn about state-of-the-art optimisation-based techniques for process synthesis, process design and molecular design, with a particular focus on mathematical programming."}, {"title": "Dynamic Behaviour in Process Systems", "description": "Learn how to systematically develop physics-based models of chemical processes and solve them using state-of-the-art computational tools."}, {"title": "Industrial Automation and Autonomous Systems", "description": "Develop the ability to design and build automation solutions and autonomous systems for a wide range of industrial applications."}, {"title": "Introduction to Programming and Python in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Master programming tasks from scratch with real-life, scientifically relevant examples and solutions drawn from chemical engineering practice."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop your understanding of advanced statistical learning and machine learning to solve a range of real-life chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning and Process Systems Engineering", "description": "Acquire working knowledge to equip you for advanced coursework in machine learning, optimisation, dynamical systems, and numerical computations."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules (Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Bioprocess Engineering", "description": "Review the relevant fundamentals of biochemistry, microbiology, and molecular biology, and explore the principles behind fermentation processes."}, {"title": "Advanced Environmental Engineering", "description": "Analyse how chemical discharges affect the planet and how the increased greenhouse effect, ozone depletion, smog formation and acid rain arise from human influences on natural cycles."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Design", "description": "Explore advanced topics in process design, with an emphasis on process modelling, optimisation theory and environmental sustainability, and associated software packages."}, {"title": "Applied Spectroscopy", "description": "Understand a range of analytical techniques needed to address challenges being faced by industry and explore leading spectroscopic methods."}, {"title": "Biochemical Engineering", "description": "Gain insights into the techniques used in biotechnology, which in many cases differ markedly from chemical engineering."}, {"title": "Carbon Capture and Clean Fossil Fuels", "description": "Understand the environmental impacts of fossil fuels and learn how to minimise the costs of CO 2 avoidance using a range of technologies."}, {"title": "Colloid and Interface Science", "description": "Delve into the fundamentals of colloid and interface science and analyse the nature of the various interparticle forces."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop a fundamental understanding of nonlinear dynamical systems to better appreciate complex phenomena in nature and a variety of chemical and biological engineering technological processes."}, {"title": "Modelling of Biological Systems", "description": "Interlink the biological principles of cellular physiology with the mathematical tools required for their analysis and modelling."}, {"title": "Molecular Modelling of Fluids", "description": "Understand the application of molecular theory and simulation in modelling fluids and fluid mixtures."}, {"title": "Practical Process Engineering in the Oil and Gas Industry", "description": "Understand the general workflows of facilities engineering teams and learn how to perform simple process and pipeline hydraulics hand calculations."}, {"title": "Product Characterisation", "description": "Develop your knowledge and experience in current experimental techniques and learn to analyse and apply these techniques to selected products."}, {"title": "Transport Processes in Biological Systems", "description": "Assess basic principles and concepts of fluid flow, heat and mass transfer relevant to physiological and biological systems, as well as more advanced mathematical models."}]}, "Optional modules (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Learn to apply mathematical and computational techniques to derive and solve equations of motion of fluids, which may be Newtonian or non-Newtonian, compressible or incompressible."}, {"title": "Biochemical Sensors", "description": "Gain biodevice fabrication techniques and learn how to apply these in industry through topics such as microfluids, synthetic systems, and probes for innovative product design."}, {"title": "Membrane Science and Membrane Separation Processes", "description": "Develop your ability to formulate and solve engineering problems involving the design of membranes and membrane modules for gas separation, reverse osmosis, nanofiltration and more."}, {"title": "Nuclear Chemical Engineering", "description": "Investigate the main chemical engineering processes associated with nuclear energy and work through problems related to mass and energy balance."}, {"title": "Particle Engineering", "description": "Explore your knowledge of particle technology and develop your skills in the key principles, concepts and technology to be confident to research and analyse a broader range of powder processing."}, {"title": "Process Heat Transfer", "description": "Carry out process heat transfer calculations to understand the basics and procedures to critically assess commercial codes in industry."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Technologies", "description": "Explore the tools required for the application of new energy and renewable energy systems to the problems faced by climate change and global energy security while transitioning to a zero emissions economy."}]}, "Business School (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Accounting Online", "description": "Develop accounting-related skills and examine their relevance to broader issues of financial decision-making and management control in organisations."}, {"title": "Business Economics", "description": "Analyse several economic tools and explore a range of microeconomic and macroeconomic topics, problems and policies."}, {"title": "Business Strategy", "description": "Examine the relevance of financial and management accounting techniques in financial decision making and management control of organisations."}, {"title": "Corporate Finance Online", "description": "An introduction to financial markets and the role they place in the macroeconomy, and how business risk is transferred and priced in equity and dept securities."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship Online", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered. This course is self-guided."}, {"title": "Finance and Financial Management", "description": "Enhance your accounting-related skills and gain a basic insight into the way that business performance is measured."}, {"title": "Leading Teams and Organisations", "description": "Develop and practise skills that will be used to identify, diagnose and evaluate key organisational issues and learn to work productively as a team."}, {"title": "Managing Innovation", "description": "Become equipped with the skills needed to organise and shape the innovation process in firms and learn how to evaluate managerial strategies."}, {"title": "Managerial Economics Online", "description": "Explore the value to businesses of understanding economics, concepts, tolls and analytical frameworks as well as the role of monetary and fiscal policy on business cycles."}, {"title": "Project Management", "description": "Develop an understanding of Project Management and apply it's tools to analyse, interpret an provide solutions to strategic, organisational and operative challenges."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee -": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Master of Public Health | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop key quantitative analytical skills for a career in public health, epidemiology and health services research.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Principles and Methods of Epidemiology", "description": "Become familiar with core concepts in epidemiology, and acquire the skills necessary to describe, analyse, interpret, and appraise epidemiological studies."}, {"title": "Foundations of Public Health Practice", "description": "Build your appreciation of a range of core public health principles and skills, and develop your expertise in problem solving and consulting."}, {"title": "Introduction to Statistical Thinking and Data Analysis", "description": "Understand the importance of statistical thinking in epidemiology, randomised trials and public health, and carry out a range of statistical analyses."}, {"title": "Research Methods", "description": "Explore core concepts related to the research cycle, and acquire key skills involved in designing, planning, and conducting research."}, {"title": "Health Economics", "description": "Study the basic principles of microeconomics and their application to healthcare. This module is delivered by the Imperial Business School."}]}}}, "Optional Modules": {"groups": {"Health Promotion and Service Improvement": {"items": [{"title": "Quality Improvement in Healthcare", "description": "Developed by the NIHR ARC-NWL team  (National Institute for Health and Care Research, Applied Research Collaboration Northwest London), this module draws on academic literature and research in quality improvement and applies it to real life practical examples. You may also carry out an external visit to meet quality improvement teams working in healthcare."}, {"title": "Population Health Improvement", "description": "Examine the theoretical basis and practical applications of health promotion, including methods for evaluating health promotion interventions."}, {"title": "Participatory Approaches in Public Health", "description": "Scrutinise the process of designing an appropriate participatory approach to a given public health challenge, and examine the history, theory and practice of these approaches."}, {"title": "Digital Health", "description": "Examine the portfolio of digital health technologies, and the opportunities to apply these technologies to improve the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare."}]}, "Global Health": {"items": [{"title": "Global Health Challenges and Governance", "description": "Appreciate the complexity of tackling health determinants, inequity, and health outcomes within a globalising world."}, {"title": "Global Health Innovations", "description": "Understand the roles and processes of innovation in global health, including simple, low-cost technologies and more complex models used in resource-constrained settings."}, {"title": "Health Systems Development", "description": "Analyse contrasting concepts that explain health systems and draw upon multiple disciplinary lenses, including organisational behaviour and health policy."}, {"title": "Emerging and Neglected Tropical Diseases", "description": "Develop skills to appraise public health strategies, control programmes, and surveillance systems for both emerging and neglected tropical diseases."}]}, "Environmental Health": {"items": [{"title": "Exposure Assessment", "description": "Realise the importance of exposure assessment in epidemiology, risk assessment, and public health protection, and critically evaluate different approaches to these assessments."}, {"title": "Environmental Epidemiology", "description": "Advance your knowledge of how to design, implement and analyse data in the framework of an environmental epidemiological study."}, {"title": "Environmental Policy and Impact Assessment", "description": "Build knowledge and skills around how to formulate, design, implement, and interpret health impact assessments, and their importance in influencing health policy."}, {"title": "Planetary Health", "description": "Explore the intricate connections between the health of our planet and public health. Through a 'One Health' approach, you'll explore global environmental challenges and examine their impacts on human health, animals and environmental justice issues."}, {"title": "Environmental data for public health", "description": "Explain the use of environmental data to tackle significant global public health challenges and explore the impacts of the use of waste plastic as a fuel. You'll address issues related to wastewater management, understand the impact of wildfires, and assess the environmental implications of electric vehicles."}]}, "Quantitative Method": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Statistics and Data Science", "description": "Understand key concepts in advanced statistics and data science and advance your skills using realistic data sets."}, {"title": "Infectious Diseases Modelling", "description": "Review the basic methods used in mathematical models and learn how to construct a mathematical model for a given infectious disease."}, {"title": "Nutritional Epidemiology", "description": "Become familiar with the underlying principles of public health nutrition, and nutritional epidemiology in the context of public health."}, {"title": "Environmental Epidemiology", "description": "Advance your knowledge of how to design, implement and analyse data in the framework of an environmental epidemiological study."}]}, "Infectious Disease": {"items": [{"title": "Emerging and Neglected Tropical Diseases", "description": "Develop skills to appraise public health strategies, control programmes, and surveillance systems for both emerging and neglected tropical diseases."}, {"title": "Global Health Challenges and Governance", "description": "Appreciate the complexity of tackling health determinants, inequity, and health outcomes within a globalising world."}, {"title": "Infectious Diseases Modelling", "description": "Review the basic methods used in mathematical models and learn how to construct a mathematical model for a given infectious disease."}]}, "Health Policy and Systems": {"items": [{"title": "Health Systems Development", "description": "Analyse contrasting concepts that explain health systems and draw upon multiple disciplinary lenses,including organisational behaviour and health policy."}, {"title": "Health Systems, Policy and Financing", "description": "Deepen your understanding of how health systems are organised and financed, and the advantages and disadvantages of different health financing models and delivery systems. This module is delivered by the Imperial Business School."}, {"title": "Commercial Determinants of Health and Health Policy", "description": "Utilise key health policy analysis models to explore the complexity of policy making and policy change, in the realm of the increasingly important issue of the commercial determinants of health."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - Standard SPH courses (Epidem, Public Health MPH, Health Data)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - Standard SPH courses (Epidem, Public Health MPH, Health Data)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Pure Mathematics (Formalisation of Mathematics) MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop mathematical skills that are highly valued in both research and the workplace.
structure_json: {"Optional modules": {"groups": {"Taught modules": {"items": [{"title": "Probability Theory 1", "description": "Explore the fundamental properties of probability, including probability measures. independent random variables and elements of Brownian motion."}, {"title": "Functional Analysis", "description": "Assess ideas of continuity and linear algebra, with a particular emphasis on vector spaces and linear maps."}, {"title": "Fourier Analysis and Theory of Distributions", "description": "Deepen your understanding of Fourier analysis and how the Fourier transform works."}, {"title": "Stochastic Calculus with Applications to Non-Linear Filtering", "description": "Become familiar with the stochastic calculus in relation to non-linear filtering and modern numerical methods for solving the filtering problem."}, {"title": "Probability Theory 2", "description": "Discover why Markov processes are widely used to model random evolutions and how the theory connects with many other subjects in mathematics."}, {"title": "Geometry of Curves and Surfaces", "description": "Understand the curvature of a surface in 3-dimensional space and expand your knowledge of topological surfaces."}, {"title": "Algebraic Curves", "description": "Build your understanding of algebraic curves and explore concepts including Meromorphic differentials and Abel's theorem."}, {"title": "Algebraic Topology", "description": "Engage with algebraic topology and advance your knowledge of homology theory, fundamental groups and the Galois correspondence for covering spaces."}, {"title": "Algebraic Geometry", "description": "Learn to use algebraic and geometric ideas together, studying basic concepts from both perspectives and applying them to numerous examples."}, {"title": "Riemannian Geometry", "description": "Appreciate geodesics and curvature and the relationship between them and use these ideas to analyse how local geometric conditions can lead to global topological constraints."}, {"title": "Manifolds", "description": "Explore the foundations and examples of manifolds, including smooth manifolds, quotients, tangent spaces and vector bundles."}, {"title": "Differential Topology", "description": "Delve into key aspects of differential topology, which is concerned with the topology of smooth manifolds."}, {"title": "Complex Manifolds", "description": "Enhance your understanding of the theory of almost complex manifolds and complex manifolds, considering examples including Kähler manifolds and complex projective manifolds."}, {"title": "Algebra 3", "description": "Further your appreciation of algebra and explore the basics of homological algebra, complexes and exact sequences."}, {"title": "Group Theory", "description": "Familiarise yourself with key concepts on this introduction to some of the more advanced topics in the theory of groups."}, {"title": "Galois Theory", "description": "Examine Galois theory and why the formula for the solution to a quadratic equation is well-known, while no formula is possible for quintics."}, {"title": "Graph Theory", "description": "Study the elementary theory of graphs and analyse why graphs are used in many areas of mathematics and other fields."}, {"title": "Group Representation Theory", "description": "Explore the representations of groups and the character of a group representation."}, {"title": "Formalising Mathematics", "description": "Discover how computer theorem provers are maturing and improve your understanding of this area of mathematics by studying the Lean theorem prover."}, {"title": "Commutative Algebra", "description": "Develop your knowledge further with this introduction to commutative algebra that looks into the prime and maximal ideals, the nilradical and the Jacobson radical."}, {"title": "Lie Algebras", "description": "Explore semisimple complex Lie algebras and the classification of irreducible representations."}, {"title": "Algebra 4", "description": "Analyse a range of advanced algebra topics, incorporating aspects of number theory, geometry and topology."}, {"title": "Number Theory", "description": "Examine the properties of natural numbers and assess various theorems relating to number theory."}, {"title": "Algebraic Number Theory", "description": "Gain an appreciation for algebraic number theory and advance your understanding of quadratic fields."}, {"title": "Elliptic Curves", "description": "Explore the different types of elliptic curves and investigate the Mordell-Weil theorem."}, {"title": "Advanced PDEs 1", "description": "Develop an understanding of partial differential equations (PDE) appearing in physics and geometry, and classical techniques to study them analytically."}, {"title": "Mathematical Logic", "description": "Analyse the way in which we reason formally about mathematical structures and look at the ZFC axioms to develop the notion of cardinality."}, {"title": "Geometric Complex Analysis", "description": "Analyse geometric notions associated with domains in the plane and their boundaries, and how they are transformed under holomorphic mappings."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Martingale Scholarships": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Martingale Scholarships": {"items": []}}}}

title: Quantum Fields and Fundamental Forces MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Gain the skills you need to undertake future PhD study in fundamental theoretical physics.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Unification", "description": "Discover the properties required for the Lagrangian of a field theory and understand how the form of the Standard Model Lagrangian follows from symmetries."}, {"title": "Quantum Field Theory", "description": "Explore why QFT (Quantum Field Theory) is essential to understand nature at smallest scales. You'll also learn how to use Feynman diagrams to describe physical processes using perturbation theory."}, {"title": "Quantum Electrodynamics", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of quantum electrodynamics and broaden your knowledge of quantum mechanics, Feynman diagrams and renormalization."}, {"title": "Particle Symmetries", "description": "Learn about the role of symmetry in physics, examine group theory and representation theory, and understand the importance of Lie groups and Lie algebras."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Quantum Field Theory", "description": "Deepen your appreciation of quantum field theory, examining path integrals, renormalisation and Non-Abelian gauge field theory."}, {"title": "Black Holes", "description": "Unpick the theory of classical black holes in General Relativity and discover why they will continue to play a central role in our future understanding of the quantum nature of spacetime."}, {"title": "Relativity and Cosmology", "description": "Learn about the fundamentals of relativity and cosmology, including FRW, thermal physics, radiation era physics and inflation."}, {"title": "Differential Geometry", "description": "Explore examples from mechanics, quantum theory, electromagnetism, general relativity and gauge theory and learn about their application in physics."}, {"title": "The Standard Model and Beyond", "description": "Develop your understanding of the Standard Model, consider anomalies and their consequences, and explore grand unification and its difficulties."}, {"title": "String Theory", "description": "Understand the fundamentals of string theory and enhance your knowledge of branes and brane spectroscopy."}, {"title": "Supersymmetry", "description": "Deepen your appreciation of supersymmetry, learn about superspace and superfields transformations and acquaint yourself with the supersymmetric Standard Model."}, {"title": "Foundations of Quantum Mechanics", "description": "Acquire the mathematical techniques and conceptual background necessary to understand the foundations of quantum mechanics."}, {"title": "Group Theory", "description": "Familiarise yourself with key concepts on this introduction to some of the more advanced topics in the theory of groups."}, {"title": "General Relativity", "description": "Consider key concepts of general relativity including the new world view of 4 dimensional Lorentzian spacetime and how the universe can be modelled by the Friedman metric."}, {"title": "Quantum Information", "description": "Advance your knowledge of the mathematical foundations of QI, uncover the essentials of entanglement theory, and learn about different aspects of quantum communication."}, {"title": "Quantum Theory of  Matter", "description": "Build your expertise in Quantum Theory of Matter,  exploring topics including the integer quantum Hall effect, the Berry phase and topology in condensed matter physics."}]}}}, "Independent Research": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirements": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - Quantum Fields": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - Quantum Fields": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, title: Renewable Energy with AI and Data Science: Geology and Geophysics | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Earth Science and Engineering
course_overview: Apply computational techniques to geological and geophysical data to characterise sites for renewable energy.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Numerical Programming in Python", "description": "Receive an introduction to numerical programming using Python and use it to understand, interpret and solve earth science problems."}, {"title": "Data Science and Machine Learning", "description": "Analyse concepts central to a data science approach and different types of classical machine learning algorithms."}, {"title": "Computational Mathematics", "description": "Explore the essential mathematics underpinning computational science, data science and machine learning."}, {"title": "Applying Computational/Data Science", "description": "Work collaboratively to solve problems using software and summarise your work using presentations."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Discover how to build neural networks to recognise images and language, generate new content, and make predictions by learning complex patterns from data."}, {"title": "Subsurface Fundamentals and Renewable Energy Technologies", "description": "Learn the fundamentals of subsurface properties and geological formations relevant for siting of renewable energy infrastructure and technology."}, {"title": "Depositional Environments and Geohazards for Renewables Infrastructure", "description": "Investigate key depositional environments that renewables infrastructure are commonly installed in and the associated geohazards and engineering challenges."}, {"title": "Geomechanics and Geotechnics", "description": "Learn the theories of stress and strain, elasticity, poroelasticity, and thermoelasticity and gain exposure to geotechnical data analysis."}, {"title": "Geophysics, Data Integration and Ground Modelling", "description": "Gain hands-on experience in interpreting offshore high-resolution geophysical data, and the development and VR visualisation of ground models."}]}}}, "Applied Computational/Data Science Project": {"groups": {}}, title: Reproductive and Developmental Biology | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Metabolism, Digestion and Reproduction
course_overview: Develop your skills for a scientific or clinical career in reproductive and developmental biology.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Gonads to Gametes", "description": "Explore the origins, development and function of the germ cells and the gonads, with a focus on how local and systemic signalling pathways regulate these processes from foetal life to adulthood. This module examines key biological events including germ cell specification and migration, sex determination, fetal gonadal development, folliculogenesis, spermatogenesis, and hormonal regulation of reproductive cycles, while also addressing clinical contexts such as reproductive disorders."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Eggs to Embryos", "description": "Develop your understanding of the cellular and molecular events that occur during fertilisation, in preimplantation embryo development, at implantation and early post-implantation. You will also examine the development of IVF and therapeutic assisted reproductive technologies, and the impact of the in vivo and in vitro environment on maturing gametes and preimplantation embryos."}, {"title": "Bumps to Babies", "description": "Explore the main events of human pregnancy, from the development of the placenta a nd embryo, to birth. This module covers normal and pathological pregnancy at the cellular and tissue level and includes consideration of basic biological processes, clinical and broader a spects of pregnancy, including disparities in healthcare and communicating to patients and the public about research."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - Reproductive and Developmental Biology": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - Reproductive and Developmental Biology": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Biomedical Research (Respiratory and Cardiovascular Science) MRes | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Metabolism, Digestion and Reproduction National Heart and Lung Institute
course_overview: Gain fundamental skills towards a career in biomedical research and build your knowledge of the basic physiology of cardiac function.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Grant Writing Exercise", "description": "Compose a grant proposal, appropriate for submission to an academic funding body. This will correspond to your research project(s)."}, {"title": "Research Project 1 and Research Project 2", "description": "You'll carry out two mini research projects, exploring some of the most technologically advanced approaches currently being applied to biomedical research. You have a wide range of research projects available to you. The projects available to you are determined by your chosen stream. You can also choose projects from other streams, though you will only have priority within your own stream. title: Responsible Mining and Metals Finance MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Imperial Business School Department of Earth Science and Engineering
course_overview: Deepen your understanding of technical and financial assessments of mining and metals projects, key to resourcing the energy transition.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mathematics for Finance", "description": "Analyse the theory of asset pricing and relevant mathematical tools and understand fundamental concepts such as state prices, arbitrage, payoff replication, and risk-neutral pricing."}, {"title": "Investment and Portfolio Management", "description": "Gain a critical understanding of important investment and portfolio management techniques used for portfolio management by fund managers, risk managers, pension funds and other financial institutions."}, {"title": "Derivatives", "description": "Learn about the growing markets for derivatives contracts, and obtain the necessary skills to value and use derivatives instruments in a purposeful way."}, {"title": "Resource Geology and Evaluation", "description": "Gain an understanding of geological principles and evaluation techniques for mineral deposits which underpin resource and reserve estimation."}, {"title": "Mining and Minerals Processing", "description": "Learn about technical evaluation of mining projects, including mining engineering, minerals processing and extractive metallurgy."}, {"title": "Mining Finance and Management", "description": "Develop skills required for the evaluation and successful development of projects in the resource sector, including business accounting, cash flow modelling, project management and strategic management."}, {"title": "Environmental and Social Considerations in Mining", "description": "Explore whole systems and broader Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) considerations, regarded as determining factors for the responsible extraction of primary resources."}, {"title": "Field Trip", "description": "Gain invaluable experience on a title: Science Communication MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Prepare for a range of science communication careers through academic and practical experience.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Science and its Social Contexts", "description": "Explore the contemporary debates surrounding science and its place in the world, and consider how scientific expertise in the public domain becomes controversial and contested."}, {"title": "Media Representation of Science", "description": "Assess how media texts are constructed in the coverage of science and the journalistic norms and practices that lead to this coverage."}, {"title": "Science Communication Practical Projects", "description": "In addition to an introduction to core skills and a term-long creative project, y ou will choose two strands in this module, which may include: Digital Media Campaigning; Exhibitions; Radio; Television; and Writing for Journalism. In each strand, you will work on practical projects that replicate professional output in that medium."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Documentary Film", "description": "Engage with seminal works in the history of documentary film and develop a critical eye to recent developments in factual TV."}, {"title": "Museums, Heritage and Science", "description": "Explore issues surrounding the construction of meaning in visual and spatial media and examine the problems of presenting complex and controversial science in museums."}, {"title": "Narrative", "description": "Examine key concepts from narrative theory to inform your narrative writing and consider important theoretical issues from a range of genres and media."}, {"title": "Science and Fiction", "description": "This module looks at the role of fiction in science communication, and the ways science and fiction have shaped each other over the centuries, covering literature, film, theatre, and games."}, {"title": "Science Communication and Global Justice", "description": "Critically examine perspectives on international development and the issues these raise for science communication."}, {"title": "Science Policy", "description": "Analyse the relationship between communication, science and policymaking and discover how public policy is determined."}, {"title": "Sound, Sign, Meaning in Radio", "description": "Consider influential works of radio documentary and drama to examine how audio media create visual images in listeners' minds and the implications this has for the truth-telling power of the medium."}]}}}, "Work Placement": {"groups": {}}, "Dissertation": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirements": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - title: Science Media Production MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop the expertise required to work in broadcast media television or radio.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Science and its Social Contexts", "description": "Explore contemporary debates surrounding science and its place in the world, and consider how scientific expertise in the public domain becomes controversial and contested."}, {"title": "Introduction to Film Form", "description": "Become familiar with different models of film form and narrative and explore foundational ideas of film theory."}, {"title": "Documentary Film", "description": "Engage with seminal works in the history of the documentary film and develop a critical eye to recent developments in factual TV."}, {"title": "Narrative", "description": "Examine key concepts from narrative theory to inform your narrative writing and consider important theoretical issues from a range of genres and media."}, {"title": "Sounds, Signs and Meanings in Radio", "description": "Consider influential works of radio documentary and drama to examine how audio media create visual images in listeners' minds and the implications this has for the truth-telling power of the medium."}, {"title": "Science Media Production Practical Projects", "description": "Build your practical skills in media production by carrying out two pieces of project work – a factual audio production and a short film."}]}}}, "Work Placement": {"groups": {}}, "Final Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirements": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Security and Resilience: Science and Technology | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Physics Institute of Security Science and Technology
course_overview: Deepen your understanding of the science and cutting-edge technologies that underpin global security.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Key Concepts: Security in Context", "description": "Evaluate security threats and risks in the wider societal context, and understand the main physical threats, detection and mitigation measures in key sectors."}, {"title": "Behavioural Science and Security", "description": "Examine the ways in which behavioural science research has been used to inform security. The different types of threat actors are considered with their aims and targets. The role of media, and managing the positive and negative potential of both the mainstream and social media, is discussed."}, {"title": "CBRNE: The Physical Threat Space", "description": "Understand the history and underlying science of CBRNE and environmental security and evaluate the threat posed by a wide variety of entities."}, {"title": "Infrastructure and Transport Security", "description": "Focus on the security of critical national infrastructure and transport systems, introducing the student to key concepts of both, and how security vulnerabilities are analysed."}, {"title": "Behavioural Research Methods", "description": "Examine the procedures related to commonly used behavioural research methods and build your appreciation of research ethics."}, {"title": "Cyber-Physical Systems Security", "description": "Learn fundamental concepts and necessary tools to understand security risks to cyber-physical systems, focusing on critical infrastructure systems and industrial control systems, and how to protect against these risks."}, {"title": "Sensors: Electronic and Natural", "description": "Explores the principles of environmental sensing, highlighting the context of point and standoff detection/sensor systems. A range of different detection technologies will be covered, including structure-based, chemistry-based and function-based sensors."}, {"title": "Short Project", "description": "Complete an individual research project with the guidance of an academic supervisor. Industry sponsored projects available."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Global Challenges Security Entrepreneurship", "description": "Develop core entrepreneurial skills by developing a solution to a real-world problem from our industry and government partners."}, {"title": "Introduction to Shock Physics", "description": "Through real-world examples, become introduced to the area of materials behaviour under ballistic, explosive and impact loading."}, {"title": "Short Project", "description": "Undertake a short project and produce a critical review in the form of an extended discussion document, white paper, technical review, or theory-oriented study."}, {"title": "Other departmental modules", "description": "Optional modules from other departments may be available at the discretion of the Programme Director. These include Physics, Mathematics, Computing, and Civil and Environmental Engineering."}, {"title": "Network and Web Security", "description": "Gain a broad knowledge of network and web security from the network to the application layer and understand underlying principles and techniques."}]}}}, "Long Summer Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirements": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee – Full-time": {"items": []}, "Home fee – Part-time": {"items": []}, "Top-up fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee – Full-time": {"items": []}, "Overseas fee – Part-time": {"items": []}, "Top-up fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Sensor Systems Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
course_overview: Learn to develop complete sensor systems and networks.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Sensors", "description": "Design, fabricate, and characterise sensors."}, {"title": "Advanced instrumentation", "description": "Gain working knowledge of the capabilities and limitations of signal measurement strategies, and practical skills in applying them."}, {"title": "Sensor systems and networks", "description": "Learn how sensor systems are implemented and deployed to provide optimal information about the physical world."}, {"title": "Microelectro-mechanical systems", "description": "Learn about the underlying physical principles, methods of fabrication and applications of a broad range of micro-scale devices that combine mechanical, electrical/electronic and optical functionalities."}, {"title": "Laboratory in Sensor Systems", "description": "Work in a team to develop, make, and validate a complete sensor system."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules - Autumn term": {"items": [{"title": "Communications: Physical Layer", "description": "Study the sources and detectors used in radio and optical communication links, and the behaviour of their signals as they propagate in various media."}, {"title": "Physical Imaging Systems", "description": "Learn about the physical operation of different imaging systems, starting with acoustic imaging and rising in frequency through electromagnetic methods operating at radio, microwave, terahertz, thermal, optical and X-ray frequencies."}, {"title": "Analogue Integrated Circuits and Systems", "description": "Understand analogue-integrated circuits and systems in CMOS and Bipolar technologies."}, {"title": "Biomedical Electronics", "description": "Familiarise yourself with how biomedical electronics can be used to create medical devices that interface with the human body."}, {"title": "Optimisation", "description": "Learn how to design computer algorithms for finding minima and maxima and discover how to interpret and modify algorithms found in standard computer packages."}, {"title": "Computational Sensing and Imaging", "description": "Study a co-design approach that leverages the symbiotic relationship between hardware and algorithms."}]}, "Optional modules - Spring term": {"items": [{"title": "Digital Signal Processing and Digital Filters", "description": "Analyse the design of digital filters and in multirate signal processing techniques."}, {"title": "Adaptive Signal Processing and Machine Intelligence", "description": "Explore the theoretical basis and applicability of modern methods for spectral estimation, algorithms which underlie adaptive signal processing, and machine intelligence techniques."}, {"title": "Analogue Signal Processing", "description": "Discover the analogue signal processing techniques that can be used to perform computation."}, {"title": "High Performance Analogue Electronics", "description": "Examine the design and implementation of high performance, analogue-integrated circuits and systems."}, {"title": "Information Theory", "description": "Examine the main concepts of information theory and its effect on communications."}]}}}, "Individual Research Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Soft Electronic Materials MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Create and optimise new types of electronic materials and devices for a diverse range of applications.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Fundamentals of Organic and Inorganic Semiconductors with Materials Synthesis and Processing", "description": "Examine the basic properties of semiconducting organic and inorganic materials and consider the methods required to deposit layers of inorganic and hybrid materials."}, {"title": "Device Physics and Application and Materials Characterisation", "description": "Engage with materials characterisation techniques relevant to assessing the microstructure and surface/interface properties of relevant electroactive materials."}, {"title": "Literature Review and Project Proposal", "description": "Research and provide critical summation of scientific literature in your given topic of study."}, {"title": "Research Project", "description": "You'll select a research project proposal in the first term following discussion with potential supervisors. You'll also participate in advanced practical skills courses, computational workshops and a journal club to help you successfully complete the project."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Statistics MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Discover a diverse range of statistical tools, applications and methods.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Applied Statistics", "description": "Examine statistical modelling and regression and apply it to realistic problems and real data."}, {"title": "Computational Statistics and Machine Learning", "description": "Engage with a number of computational methods that are key in modern statistics and learn to implement and apply these methods confidently."}, {"title": "Fundamentals of Statistical Inference", "description": "Appreciate different Bayesian and frequentist approaches to statistical inference and select and justify appropriate methods for hypothesis testing."}, {"title": "Probability for Statistics", "description": "Assess the key concepts of probability theory and learn how random variables and vectors and their distribution functions are defined."}, {"title": "Data Science", "description": "Become familiar with the most common data scientific methods and their uses and misuses."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Simulation Methods", "description": "Gain a basic understanding of simulation, along with its uses and limitations, and the models for which basic or sophisticated simulation methods can be applied."}, {"title": "Advanced Statistical Finance", "description": "Further your understanding of statistical finance by engaging with modern statistical methods for analysis of financial data."}, {"title": "Big Data: Statistical Scalability with PySpark", "description": "Learn statistical concepts such as parameter estimation with large scale data and explore data sampling strategies in a Big Data world. Design and develop data analysis procedures using Big Data technology (Hadoop and Spark), learn to utilise Big Data technology to perform a rigorous statistical analysis, and describe and apply mathematical techniques for fitting statistical models at scale and dealing with streaming data."}, {"title": "Deep Learning (7.5 ECTS)", "description": "Explore the building blocks of deep learning models, and how to design network architectures for specific applications."}, {"title": "Introduction to Statistical Finance", "description": "Explore fundamental concepts of quantitative finance and statistical methods that are widely used to analyse financial data."}, {"title": "Nonparametric Statistics", "description": "Learn modern techniques to solve various problems, including estimating distribution functions and their characteristics, as well as performing nonparametric density estimation and regression."}, {"title": "Probabilistic Generative Models", "description": "You will learn how to design, analyse, and implement probabilistic generative models. You will cover training, inference, and different model types such as autoregressive, implicit, and Bayesian nonparametric, and use Python to put these ideas into practice."}, {"title": "Spatial Statistics (7.5 ECTS)", "description": "Investigate theoretical and methodological statistical foundations for spatial data."}, {"title": "Statistical Learning for high-dimensional data", "description": "Appreciate the importance of handling high dimensional datasets, through the analysis of genetics (genomics) and bioinformatics data."}, {"title": "Stochastic Processes", "description": "Study stochastic processes and the basic tools from stochastic analysis that provide the mathematical foundations for option pricing theory."}, {"title": "Survival Models (7.5 ECTS)", "description": "Discover why survival models are fundamental to actuarial work and explore key actuarial applications."}, {"title": "Time Series Analysis (7.5 ECTS)", "description": "Examine discrete time stochastic processes and associated computational algorithms and approaches."}]}}}, "Statistics Research": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - Statistics streams": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Martingale Scholarships": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - Statistics streams": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}, "Martingale Scholarships": {"items": []}}}}
