title: General Structural Engineering with Data Science MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Explore the broad spectrum of structural engineering issues affecting civil engineering structures.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Reinforced Concrete 1", "description": "Examine the design and behaviour of reinforced concrete structures at the design ultimate limit state."}, {"title": "Steel Components", "description": "Understand the behaviour of steel structures and learn to design structural steel members and connections."}, {"title": "Structural Analysis", "description": "Gain fundamental insights into structural analysis, including the mechanics of materials and physical behaviour of structural elements."}, {"title": "Design of Steel Buildings", "description": "Analyse the conceptual design of a range of structural framing systems used in the construction sector and issues related to structural form and behaviour."}, {"title": "Reinforced Concrete 2", "description": "Gain a detailed understanding of the design of reinforced concrete slabs and structures like deep beams, squat shear walls and pile caps."}, {"title": "Statistical Modelling", "description": "Develop the relevant theory, methodology and computational techniques required for you to formulate and implement statistical models to represent real-world phenomena."}, {"title": "Machine Learning", "description": "Develop a comprehensive understanding of the three principal subfields of modern machine learning and learn how to implement these modules using programming language."}, {"title": "Data Engineering", "description": "This module will provide you with practical experience in constructing and validating models and algorithms and the necessary advanced computational skills to enable you to apply this knowledge to solving a range of complex civil engineering problems."}, {"title": "Design Project Data Science", "description": "You'll work in a small team to tackle a real-world design brief, guided by instructors and industry advisors. Together, you'll plan, manage, and present your project in a competitive setting that mirrors how companies pitch and deliver professional engineering solutions."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design of Timber and Masonry Structures", "description": "Familiarise yourself with the design of structures in timber and masonry and apply your knowledge to the design of simple conventional structures."}, {"title": "Cementitious Materials", "description": "Discover why cementitious materials are used throughout the built environment and learn about the chemistry behind them."}, {"title": "Structural Steel Technology", "description": "Develop your understanding of structural steel physical metallurgy and learn to apply this knowledge to the manufacture of steels to understand factors leading to corrosion and brittle fracture of steel."}, {"title": "Materials Selection", "description": "Explore the great diversity and properties of materials and learn how to systematically select the appropriate materials for engineering applications."}, {"title": "Finite Element Analysis", "description": "Understand the finite element method for structural analysis and investigate the accuracy and convergence characteristics of various finite elements."}, {"title": "Prestressed Concrete", "description": "Assess the structural behaviour and design criteria of prestressed concrete structures and review the current technology available for these structures."}, {"title": "Structural Dynamics", "description": "Become familiar with the most basic concepts and principles of dynamics as applied to structural engineering problems."}, {"title": "Structural Stability", "description": "Analyse the behaviour of structural components and systems that suffer from failure due to geometric nonlinearity."}, {"title": "Concrete Materials", "description": "Investigate a range of topics within the field of concrete technology and understand the key processes influencing the behaviour and performance of concrete in service."}, {"title": "Design of Bridges", "description": "Examine the design and construction of bridges, as well as the main construction procedures for short, medium and long span bridges."}, {"title": "Nonlinear Structural Analysis", "description": "Discover the systematic procedures for geometric and material nonlinear structural analysis and advance your knowledge of nonlinear analysis software."}, {"title": "Plated Structures", "description": "Understand the behaviour and design of plated steel structures including the elastic buckling and post-buckling of plates under in-plane loading."}, {"title": "Structural Fire Engineering", "description": "Evaluate the concepts and principles of structural fire safety engineering and use sophisticated numerical tools to undertake performance-based fire safety engineering computations."}, {"title": "Structural Reliability Theory", "description": "Explore the main concepts and principles of structural safety and gain an appreciation for the power of probabilistic methods in structural engineering."}, {"title": "Theory of Shells", "description": "Understand the fundamental concepts and principles of the analysis and design of thin-walled shelled structures."}, {"title": "Composite Structures", "description": "Analyse, evaluate and exploit the mechanical behaviour of fibre reinforced polymer composites to facilitate their use in engineering structures."}, {"title": "Concrete Structures", "description": "Investigate a range of topics within the field of concrete technology and understand the key processes influencing the behaviour and performance of concrete in service."}]}}}, "Design Project - Dissertation": title: Sustainable Energy Futures MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Mechanical Engineering Grantham Institute
course_overview: Gain the skills needed to join the next generation of leaders in the energy sector.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Low Carbon Technologies", "description": "Understand the fundamentals of modern/future energy systems, focusing on solar, nuclear and wind energy, in terms of their technical properties and economic and environmental impacts."}, {"title": "Methods for the Analysis of Energy Systems", "description": "Examine a range of tools for the analysis of energy systems and resources from both technical/capability and environmental impact viewpoints."}, {"title": "Energy Economics and Policy", "description": "Unravel the key issues in energy economics and policy, and how they tie in with technology development initiatives."}, {"title": "Debating/Research, Consultancy and Project Management Workshops", "description": "Explore current energy issues and improve your debating skills. title: Translational Research in Surgery, Perioperative and Critical Care | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop, adapt and trial new models of scientific exploration to accelerate innovations into surgical, perioperative and critical care practice.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Framework for innovation", "description": "You will explore how to spot clinical gaps, shape research ideas, identify unmet clinical needs, and build strong networks in SPCC. This module covers core themes of ethics, regulatory frameworks, funding, and knowledge mobilisation."}, {"title": "Frontiers of translational research", "description": "Explore emerging research frontiers in surgery, peri-operative and critical care (SPCC), including major biomedical and technological innovations across disciplines. You will focus on four key themes: models of human disease, advanced experimental techniques, imaging and interventional science, and bioinformatics with AI ."}, {"title": "Project Design in Translational Research", "description": "Prepare for your research project by joining your chosen research team. title: Transport MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Explore the movement of people and goods to prepare for a career in operations, engineering or transport planning.
structure_json: {"Pre-study": {"groups": {}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Transport Infrastructure and its Context", "description": "Gain a thorough understanding of key principles underlying transportation systems, including their operation, context, and relationship with the built environment. This foundational module provides the foundation for the topic that will be covered throughout the MSc course."}, {"title": "Analytical Methods", "description": "Explore the key analytical methods extensively used in transport research, encompassing both quantitative and qualitative approaches. This module covers theories, methodologies, and computational techniques with applications in optimisation, survey analysis, and geospatial data. It is delivered with a balanced focus in theoretical concepts as well as practical skills and their applications."}, {"title": "Traffic Engineering", "description": "Understand traffic engineering fundamentals, including macroscopic fundamental diagrams, shockwaves, queueing theory, and traffic microsimulation. Practical applications focus on solving real-world traffic problems, including signal control, congestion management, speed limits, parking management, and safety standards."}, {"title": "Transport Economics and Demand", "description": "Build a rigorous mathematical understanding of travel demand and transport supply models. This module covers aggregate and disaggregate modelling techniques, including discrete choice and stated preference methods, equipping you to evaluate transport policies through market analysis, cost-benefit assessment, and welfare maximisation using specialised software."}, {"title": "Transport Planning and Policy", "description": "Master key methods and concepts in transport planning and policy through the study of the four-stage travel demand model: trip generation, trip distribution, mode choice, and traffic assignment. You will apply these models practically, enhancing your skills in data handling, estimation, and interpretation while addressing contemporary policy issues and advanced modelling techniques."}, {"title": "Safety, Security and Human Factors", "description": "Investigate the complexities of safety and security in transportation systems, examining interactions among technology, procedures, and human factors within organisations. This module integrates quantitative analyses of crash data and system vulnerabilities with qualitative evaluations of legislative impacts on transport safety."}, {"title": "Sustainable Transport", "description": "Examine how transportation affects energy use, climate change, air quality, and noise pollution. Specific transport modes, such as active travel, road, aviation, and shipping, are discussed alongside critical innovations that promote sustainability"}, {"title": "Rail and Mass Transit Systems", "description": "Discover detailed insights into rail and mass transit operations, planning, infrastructure, and policy, informed by international case studies. This module addresses public transport principles, specific service requirements, economic drivers, and the historical and future contributions of mass transit to sustainable urban development."}, {"title": "Freight Transport and Logistics", "description": "Gain a thorough understanding of freight transport operations and the mathematical modelling techniques associated with efficient supply chain management and distribution strategies. Topics encompass analytics, decision models, optimisation tools, and specialised logistics applications (healthcare, humanitarian, disaster response)."}, {"title": "Air Transportation", "description": "Explore the air transportation system comprehensively, from aircraft operations and key technologies to essential human factors ensuring flight safety. You will study the influence of international aviation regulations and governance, as well as the safe integration of unmanned aerial systems (UAS) into urban airspace."}, {"title": "Intelligent and Autonomous Transport", "description": "Explore intelligent and autonomous transportation technologies driven by vehicle connectivity, automation and artificial intelligence. Learn how these innovations influence transport planning, infrastructure use, and decision-making, and gain practical skills in designing and operating intelligent transport systems with AI-driven data analysis."}, {"title": "Group Design Project", "description": "Building upon the knowledge covered by the programme throughout the year, this module allows you to consolidate your knowledge and understanding through practical application in the context of a transport design project. This module, delivered over 4 weeks full-time, provides you with an opportunity to work in teams on a significant piece of transport engineering design. Industrial partnership on the projects enables you to gain real-world insight into the design process. Emphasis is placed on effective team working, creativity, design understanding and practicality, the appropriate use of technical knowledge, and the ability to present effectively in written, poster and oral presentation forms. You will work with clients to develop the briefs into projects, exploring design proposals in an iterative manner, building towards the effective presentation of a comprehensive feasibility and outline design study."}]}}}, "Research project - Transport": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT only)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee (CEE 1YFT only)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Transport with Data Science MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Specialise in analysing large volumes of transport data and in developing models for efficient, sustainable, and resilient transport systems.
structure_json: {"Pre-study": {"groups": {}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Transport Infrastructure and its Context", "description": "Gain a thorough understanding of key principles underlying transportation systems, including their operation, context, and relationship with the built environment. This foundational module provides the foundation for the topic that will be covered throughout the MSc course."}, {"title": "Statistical Modelling", "description": "Develop fundamental skills in statistical modelling from both theoretical and applied perspectives. This module covers essential theory, methodology, and computational techniques for constructing statistical models to represent real-world scenarios, supported by practical training in R and RStudio."}, {"title": "Traffic Engineering", "description": "Understand traffic engineering fundamentals, including macroscopic fundamental diagrams, shockwaves, queueing theory, and traffic microsimulation. Practical applications focus on solving real-world traffic problems, including signal control, congestion management, speed limits, parking management, and safety standards."}, {"title": "Machine Learning", "description": "Gain comprehensive expertise in machine learning tailored to civil engineering applications. Key areas include supervised learning (regression, classification), unsupervised learning (clustering), large language models, and reinforcement learning. Hands-on training in Python using NumPy, scikit-learn, and PyTorch will enhance your practical skills. It will help you put theory into practice across a set of case studies in the civil engineering sector."}, {"title": "Transport Economics and Demand", "description": "Build a rigorous mathematical understanding of travel demand and transport supply models. This module covers aggregate and disaggregate modelling techniques, including discrete choice and stated preference methods, equipping you to evaluate transport policies through market analysis, cost-benefit assessment, and welfare maximisation using specialised software."}, {"title": "Sustainable Transport", "description": "Examine how transportation affects energy use, climate change, air quality, and noise pollution. Specific transport modes, such as active travel, road, aviation, and shipping, are discussed alongside critical innovations that promote sustainability"}, {"title": "Rail and Mass Transit Systems", "description": "Discover detailed insights into rail and mass transit operations, planning, infrastructure, and policy, informed by international case studies. This module addresses public transport principles, specific service requirements, economic drivers, and the historical and future contributions of mass transit to sustainable urban development."}, {"title": "Data Engineering", "description": "Develop practical experience constructing, validating, and deploying machine learning models and algorithms in Python. This module covers key areas including reinforcement learning, computer vision, developer tools, version control, cloud computing, visual analytics, data modelling, database management, and advanced data manipulation and visualisation techniques."}, {"title": "Freight Transport and Logistics", "description": "Gain a thorough understanding of freight transport operations and the mathematical modelling techniques associated with efficient supply chain management and distribution strategies. Topics encompass analytics, decision models, optimisation tools, and specialised logistics applications (healthcare, humanitarian, disaster response)."}, {"title": "Group Design Project", "description": "Building upon the knowledge covered by the programme throughout the year, this module allows you to consolidate your knowledge and understanding through practical application in the context of a transport design project. This module, delivered over 4 weeks full-time, provides you with an opportunity to work in teams on a significant piece of transport engineering design. Industrial partnership on the projects enables you to gain real-world insight into the design process. Emphasis is placed on effective team working, creativity, design understanding and practicality, the appropriate use of technical knowledge, and the ability to present effectively in written, poster and oral presentation forms. You will work with clients to develop the briefs into projects, exploring design proposals in an iterative manner, building towards the effective presentation of a comprehensive feasibility and outline design study."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Transport Planning and Policy", "description": "Master key methods and concepts in transport planning and policy through the study of the four-stage travel demand model: trip generation, trip distribution, mode choice, and traffic assignment. You will apply these models practically, enhancing your skills in data handling, estimation, and interpretation while addressing contemporary policy issues and advanced modelling techniques."}, {"title": "Safety, Security and Human Factors", "description": "Investigate the complexities of safety and security in transportation systems, examining interactions among technology, procedures, and human factors within organisations. This module integrates quantitative analyses of crash data and system vulnerabilities with qualitative evaluations of legislative impacts on transport safety."}]}, "Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Air Transportation", "description": "Explore the air transportation system comprehensively, from aircraft operations and key technologies to essential human factors ensuring flight safety. You will study the influence of international aviation regulations and governance, as well as the safe integration of unmanned aerial systems (UAS) into urban airspace."}, {"title": "Intelligent and Autonomous Transport", "description": "Explore intelligent and autonomous transportation technologies driven by vehicle connectivity, automation and artificial intelligence. Learn how these innovations influence transport planning, infrastructure use, and decision-making, and gain practical skills in designing and operating intelligent transport systems with AI-driven data analysis."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT only)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee (CEE 1YFT only)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Weekend MBA | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Take your executive skills to the next level, without impacting your career.
structure_json: {"Pre-study modules": {"groups": {}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {}}, "Elective modules": {"groups": {"Elective modules": {"items": [{"title": "Analytics & Operations", "description": ""}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship & Innovation", "description": ""}, {"title": "Finance", "description": ""}, {"title": "Leadership & Organisation", "description": ""}, {"title": "Marketing", "description": ""}, {"title": "Strategy", "description": ""}]}}}, "Global experiences": {"groups": {"Global experiences": {"items": [{"title": "Global Experience Week", "description": "The Global Experience Week is an opportunity to immerse yourself in the business environment of another country. Together with the rest of your class you will visit local and global companies and meet Business School alumni based in that country."}, {"title": "IB Glocal Electives", "description": "The IB Glocal Electives, which are shared across the MBA portfolio, teach students how to explore contemporary global business problems with a local perspective."}, {"title": "Global exchanges", "description": "The optional Global Exchanges programme allows you to increase your international exposure and build your network by taking advantage of specialised electives at one of our partner schools."}]}}}, "Applied learning": {"groups": {"Applied learning": {"items": [{"title": "Independent Project", "description": "Put the theory taught on the MBA into practice. You'll develop specialised expertise by researching a real business issue and influence real commercial outcomes, if your recommendations are implemented by a sponsoring organisation."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurial Journey", "description": "Work an idea into a product or service and pitch your proposition to venture capitalists, competing for a monetary prize. The journey is suitable for both those wanting to innovate as intrapreneurs from within an organisation, or start their own ventures. You will develop a value proposition, carry out customer discovery research, validate the product or service, and create a fully-fledged business proposal. Throughout the Journey, you will be able to collaborate with the Imperial Enterprise Lab to connect with investors and receive coaching support."}, {"title": "Capstone Consulting Experience", "description": "The Capstone Consulting Experience (CCE) gives you the opportunity to solve a complex/strategic problem facing a real client with a team of your peers from the Weekend MBA programme."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirements": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}, "Footnotes": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "2026 start": {"groups": {"Tuition fee - September start 2026": {"items": []}, "Tuition fee payment terms": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Aeronautical Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Learn how vehicles and structures interact with air in this professionally accredited, integrated Master's degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 1", "description": "Discover the fundamentals of aerodynamics, such as the basic laws of motion for incompressible fluid flow, mass conservation, and viscosity."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 1", "description": "Learn the key constructs and thought processes that will help you to solve engineering problems and become a MATLAB and Python scripting expert."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 1", "description": "Engage in engineering practice, and know the practical, legal, ethical, and manufacturing constraints, so you can come up with creative solutions."}, {"title": "Introduction to Aerospace", "description": "Formulate equations to predict key performance metrics like cruise range, operating envelope, and take-off and landing for different types of vehicles operating."}, {"title": "Materials 1", "description": "Determine the relationship between microstructure and mechanical response of engineering materials and natural materials. Stress analysis, solid mechanics, and material selection are introduced."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Become knowledgeable and skilled in mathematics in order to prepare for the first-year aeronautical programme and for the more advanced techniques required in later years."}, {"title": "Mechanics", "description": "Develop your understanding of Newtonian physics, particle dynamics, and momentum, as well as structural mechanics, dynamics, and flight mechanics."}, {"title": "Structures 1", "description": "Understand equilibrium, compatibility, stress/strain law, and other fundamentals of structural analysis."}, {"title": "Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer", "description": "Study thermodynamics, gas dynamics, and heat transfer before moving on to more advanced modules, like propulsion and aerodynamics."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 2", "description": "Explore incompressible and compressible aerodynamics and basic prediction methods for designing aerofoils."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 2", "description": "Develop your programming skills with the help of a compiled language (C++), and learn further numerical analysis techniques that you will need in both the Aeronautics course and, thereafter, in industry."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Project Development", "description": "Understand your customers and their needs, plan and cost the project, identify and mitigate risks, and create a project proposal. During subsequent projects, you will use the skills you learn in this module."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Technical", "description": "Know the practical, legal, ethical, and manufacturing constraints engineers must contend with when solving problems or planning projects."}, {"title": "Flight Dynamics and Control", "description": "Develop a working knowledge of flight vehicle dynamics, stability, and control. We review both the theoretical background and its practical application of predicting and controlling aircraft dynamics using the Department's Flight Simulation facility."}, {"title": "Materials 2", "description": "Learn how to predict failures under multiaxial loading that occur due to yielding, fractures, fatigue, and creep, and identify these failure mechanisms in practice."}, {"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Become familiar with probability and statistics, plus vector calculus and numerical analysis."}, {"title": "Mechatronics", "description": "Using 'system' concepts and Mechatronics, learn how to model electrical systems with mechanical systems."}, {"title": "Propulsion and Turbomachinery", "description": "Learn about ramjets, turbojets, and turbofans' theory, starting with the thermodynamic cycle before diving into individual components' aero-thermal properties."}, {"title": "Structures 2", "description": "Get an overview of matrix methods in overall structural analysis (hardness and flexibility), and structural dynamics (force equilibrium, Hamilton's principle, and Lagrange's equation)."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 3", "description": "Use compressible and incompressible aerodynamics, boundary layers, and finite aspect ratio wings to design aerospace vehicles."}, {"title": "Aerospace Vehicle Design", "description": "Develop a conventional aircraft using a basic set of operational requirements and integrating your prior knowledge and analytical skills and learn how vehicles are designed using multi-stage approaches."}, {"title": "Control Systems", "description": "Discover how automatic control systems are used in a wide range of technologies (not just Aeronautics, but Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Finance, Biology)."}, {"title": "Group Design Project", "description": "Take part in one of our five challenging research projects each year to learn about industrial engineering design in a large multidisciplinary team."}, {"title": "Structures 3", "description": "Apply structural principles to thin-walled structures representing aeroplane parts. Since modern aircraft are usually composites, learn homogeneous plate theory."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Finite Elements", "description": "Develop your understanding of the Finite Element Method, which uses a powerful mathematical abstraction based on function spaces, inner products, norms, and operators."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Find out about orbital mechanics, rigid body dynamics, and path planning problems, like time or fuel optimisation. Analysis of spacecraft motion, stability, and control is also included."}, {"title": "Advanced Fluid Dynamics and Fluid-Structure Interaction", "description": "Deploy advanced mathematical tools to analyse the broad scope of phenome related to fluid flows and their interaction with structures."}, {"title": "Mathematics 3", "description": "Learn about variational calculus and its applications, plus complex variables and techniques based on them. This approach is useful for designing hypersonic nosecones and deriving potential flow solutions."}, {"title": "Turbulence and Turbulence Modelling", "description": "Develop the background knowledge and physical understanding you need to evaluate turbulent models critically."}, {"title": "Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Develop a solid understanding of the theory and implementation of primarily 1D numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Computational Mechanics", "description": "Learn how to solve two-dimensional potential, electrostatic and acoustic problems using the finite element method and Boundary Element method."}, {"title": "Advanced Propulsion", "description": "Advance your knowledge of aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis of propulsion systems for high-speed flight."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Create an innovative culture, network, and creativity through open innovation practices."}, {"title": "Advanced Manufacturing", "description": "Understand the manufacturing processes of composite materials and their corresponding underlying manufacturing principles.."}, {"title": "High Performance Computing", "description": "Build proficiency in the use of the C++ programming language and the skills to be able to write efficient parallel programs."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Discover title: Aeronautics with Spacecraft Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Specialise in the design of space technologies in this professionally accredited, integrated Master's degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 1", "description": "Become familiar with aerodynamic essentials including  the basic laws of motion for incompressible fluid flow."}, {"title": "Structures 1", "description": "Discover the fundamental concepts for all structural analysis and learn how to apply them."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Approach mathematics as a logical and structured discipline and acquire the skills needed to move on to more advanced study."}, {"title": "Mechanics", "description": "Explore classical mechanics and develop your understanding of statics, kinematics and dynamics."}, {"title": "Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer", "description": "Learn the essentials of thermodynamics, gas dynamics, and heat transfer and build your foundational knowledge of propulsion and aerodynamics for more advanced study."}, {"title": "Materials 1", "description": "Examine the microstructure and mechanical response of all classes of engineering and natural materials."}, {"title": "Introduction to Aerospace", "description": "Learn about the broad types of aerial vehicles operating and their varied missions and design requirements, plus how equations can help predict key aircraft performance metrics."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 1", "description": "Acquire the basic computing and programming skills required for the solution of engineering problems."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 1", "description": "Engage in engineering practice and learn why engineers need an awareness of practical, legal, ethical and manufacturing constraints."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 2", "description": "Build on your existing knowledge of incompressible and compressible aerodynamics, and the basic prediction methods for aerofoil design at both low and high speed."}, {"title": "Structures 2", "description": "Advance your understanding of mechanics and structures and explore topics including matrix methods in overall structural analysis, structural dynamics and buckling."}, {"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Explore more advanced mathematics concepts including vector calculus, partial differential equations, and the theory of signals and systems."}, {"title": "Mechatronics", "description": "Obtain a fundamental grounding in the theory and practice of mechatronic systems relevant to aeronautics."}, {"title": "Propulsion and Turbomachinery", "description": "Uncover the fundamental theory of jet engines, including ramjets, turbojets and turbofans and examine the aero-thermal analysis of individual components in detail."}, {"title": "Materials 2", "description": "Further your understanding on the principles of aerospace materials and learn about emerging materials for future aerospace applications."}, {"title": "Flight Dynamics and Control", "description": "Examine the concepts associated with the dynamics, stability and control of flight vehicles and discover the techniques available to predict and control the dynamic behaviour of aircraft."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 2", "description": "Enhance your programming skills and learn about programming with a compiled language (C++) as well as further numerical analysis techniques."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Technical", "description": "Engage in multi-disciplinary design and optimisation work and build on your knowledge of engineering practice from your first year studies."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Project Development", "description": "Discover the basic considerations involved in developing, planning and costing a project as well as how to identify and mitigate associated risks."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 3", "description": "Deepen your understanding of the compressible and incompressible aerodynamics relevant to aerospace vehicle design."}, {"title": "Structures 3", "description": "Explore idealised thin-walled structures and plate theory as you build on the structural principles developed during your earlier studies."}, {"title": "Control Systems", "description": "Build on your prior understanding of dynamical systems and examine fundamental concepts in the analysis and design of automatic control systems."}, {"title": "Aerospace Vehicle Design", "description": "Integrate and apply your prior knowledge and analytical skills to the design of an aircraft and learn about the methods typically employed by vehicle design teams."}, {"title": "Group Design Project", "description": "Learn how to function and contribute creatively in a large multi-disciplinary team, simulating the industrial approach to engineering design and teamwork."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Learn industry standard methodology for spacecraft systems analysis and design."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Develop your understanding of methodologies for spacecraft structure design, from launchers to satellite platforms to habitable inflatable modules."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Apply orbital mechanics and rigid body mechanics to a wide range of problems in non-atmospheric flight."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Project", "description": "Complete an individual research project in your chosen area of research, which must include some element of originality."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Learn industry standard methodology for spacecraft systems analysis and design."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Develop your understanding of methodologies for spacecraft structure design, from launchers to satellite platforms to habitable inflatable modules."}, {"title": "Aerothermodynamics of Launchers and Re-Entry Vehicles", "description": "Explore the unique flow physics experienced by vehicles travelling at hypersonic speeds in an atmosphere and develop your understanding of aerodynamic analysis and experimentation."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Apply orbital mechanics and rigid body mechanics to a wide range of problems in non-atmospheric flight."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Finite Elements", "description": "Develop your understanding of the Finite Element Method, which uses a powerful mathematical abstraction based on function spaces, inner products, norms, and operators."}, {"title": "Advanced Fluid Dynamics and Fluid-Structure Interaction", "description": "Deploy advanced mathematical tools to analyse the broad scope of phenome related to fluid flows and their interaction with structures."}, {"title": "Mathematics 3", "description": "Learn about variational calculus and its applications, plus complex variables and techniques based on them. This approach is useful for designing hypersonic nosecones and deriving potential flow solutions."}, {"title": "Turbulence and Turbulence Modelling", "description": "Develop the background knowledge and physical understanding you need to evaluate turbulent models critically."}, {"title": "Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Develop a solid understanding of the theory and implementation of primarily 1D numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Computational Mechanics", "description": "Learn how to solve two-dimensional potential, electrostatic and acoustic problems using the finite element method and Boundary Element method."}, {"title": "Advanced Propulsion", "description": "Advance your knowledge of aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis of propulsion systems for high-speed flight."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Create an innovative culture, network, and creativity through open innovation practices."}, {"title": "Advanced Manufacturing", "description": "Understand the manufacturing processes of composite materials and their corresponding underlying manufacturing principles.."}, {"title": "High Performance Computing", "description": "Build proficiency in the use of the C++ programming language and the skills to be able to write efficient parallel programs."}, {"title": "Applications of Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Gain a better understanding of the physics and governing equations of fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Applications of Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Discover the key numerical methods used for solving the governing equations of fluid dynamics for aerodynamic design."}, {"title": "Lightweight Structures", "description": "Discover the mechanics of composite materials and foams, sandwich construction, and how lightweight structures are analysed, including design optimisation."}, {"title": "Aeroelasticity", "description": "Study the theory and practice of aeroelasticity in fixed-wing aircraft, including structural dynamics and turbulence dynamics, and how deformed air vehicles affect control."}, {"title": "Optimisation (IDX)", "description": "Examine the concepts and techniques associated with modern optimisation theory and practice."}, {"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing (IDX)", "description": "Analyse how additive manufacturing is helping solve future industry challenges and build your knowledge of advanced manufacturing methodologies."}, {"title": "Flow Instability and Transition", "description": "Learn how modern mathematical techniques are used to predict conditions when laminar-turbulent transition takes place."}, {"title": "Artificial Intelligence for Aerospace Engineers", "description": "Explore the most popular Machine Learning and AI algorithms used in aerospace research and industry."}, {"title": "BPES / Horizons (level 6 or 7)", "description": "Gain a greater understanding of the financial, strategic and operational context of your core discipline."}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": title: Biochemistry MSci | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Investigate the behaviour of living systems at the molecular and cellular level and gain enhanced research skills and experience.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biological Chemistry", "description": "You will gain an appreciation of the concept that living systems obey the same fundamental laws that govern all matter and that understanding any life process requires an understanding of the physics and chemistry of that process. You will develop the mathematical and computer tools to develop this appreciation through quantitative as well as descriptive modes of expression. Building on this background, the course introduces lipids, polysaccharides, proteins, enzymes and membranes as key mediators of biological processes."}, {"title": "Cell Biology", "description": "You will be introduced to the cellular context in which biochemical reactions take place by taking a tour through typical cells. You will learn fundamental knowledge about the structure and functioning of eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells. You will encounter highlights of current cell biology research including work done at Imperial and its clinical and/or sustainable development relevance."}, {"title": "Enzymes and Metabolism", "description": "In this module you will build on fundamental concepts covered in Biological Chemistry, giving detailed insights into molecular processes occurring in living systems. You will consider the functional groups and relevant reactions from organic chemistry that are used as a basis for understanding enzymatic reactions and the metabolic pathways they support."}, {"title": "Molecular Biology", "description": "In this module you will be introduced to the basic concepts of genetics, how they relate to biochemistry and how they underpin much of molecular biology. You will study how molecular biology techniques can and are being applied to study almost every area of biochemistry and biology."}, {"title": "Core Skills for Life Scientists", "description": "The module has four main themes - mathematics, communication skills, statistics, and bioinformatics. You will be introduced to programming and computer literacy skills in Python, and in R through statistics; and it will incorporate other core skills such as the use of lab notebooks and critical reflection on feedback."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Structural Biology", "description": "You will develop an understanding of the relationship between macromolecular structure and function in the cell. You will gain insights into the theory and practice of how protein samples can be expressed, purified and engineered for structural and functional analysis, including the latest technologies and how this is used to interrogate molecular function under physiological and pathological conditions."}, {"title": "Genes and Genomics", "description": "The course will build upon the fundamental molecular biology taught in the first year. You will learn about advances in genomic technology and reinforcing key concepts, in a module that will provide an overview of gene and genome structure, the control of gene expression, gene and genome manipulation and the key aspects of genomics."}, {"title": "Integrative Cell Biology", "description": "In Integrated Cell Biology you will develop an understanding of how molecules and cells are integrated into functional systems with a focus on how this occurs in mammals including humans. You will gain a deep appreciation and be able to clearly communicate and apply the principles of: cell signalling, neuronal communication and the brain and the constituent components and regulation of physiological processes within the immune system."}, {"title": "Protein Science", "description": "You will study how advanced analytical techniques can be used to define protein and other biomolecule structure and how this structural insight is used in modern advances in enzymology and protein-ligand interactions."}, {"title": "Bioinformatics, Programming and Statistics", "description": "In this module you will be provided with the background necessary to understand the rapid developments in computational, statistical and bioinformatic life sciences."}, {"title": "Tutored Dissertation", "description": "Guided by an academic you will research a specialised area of Biochemistry;  you will learn to review primary research literature and distil relevant information in order to write a review article on a specific area of scientific research."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Computational 'Omics", "description": "The course will provide students with skills required to perform computational analysis of genomic and protein sequences. The module will provide skills training in Linux, Python and running sequence analysis programs on the command line. Students will learn how variants are identified within a genome sequence and how the effect of coding variants on the protein product are determined. The course will build on Python programming skills developed in the Bioinformatics, Programming and Statistics core module."}, {"title": "Topics in Biotechnology", "description": "Topics in Biotechnology provides a theoretical and practical grounding in modern biotechnology. Biotechnology is introduced in a historical context, and by comparison with synthetic chemistry as the main 'competing technology'. This principle is apparent in the 'Exploiting Metabolism' lecture series, which through several examples links fundamental understanding of metabolic systems to their exploitation in applications."}, {"title": "Challenges in Cell Biology", "description": "This module will give students an understanding of current cell biology research challenges and the approaches being developed to tackle them. It will discuss areas of cell biology that are new to second year Biochemists and so complement their previous cell biology teaching as well as introduce themes that will be developed in several final year courses."}, {"title": "Applied Molecular Biochemistry", "description": "This module is based on the first year biochemistry module, in which the general metabolic pathways and enzyme mechanisms were presented. The goals of this module are to focus on (i) the most important energy converting pathways in plants, animals and bacteria and to put these pathways in the context of bioenergetics, (ii) mechanisms of protein folding."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Biological Sciences MSci | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Investigate the behaviour of living systems from the level of molecules and cells up to whole organisms and ecosystems and gain enhanced research skills and experience.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biological Chemistry and Microbiology", "description": "You will gain an overview of the biochemistry of enzymes, membranes, and metabolism, in a diversity of eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells. You will develop the necessary mathematical skills needed to analyse these systems quantitatively, and the necessary practical skills to purify proteins and assay enzymes."}, {"title": "Evolution and Diversity", "description": "You will gain an overview of the tree of life, especially in regard to animals, plants and fungi, and to allow you to gain a more detailed knowledge of the relationships, evolution, and key features of certain groups of organisms."}, {"title": "Cell Biology and Genetics", "description": "You will address central information transfer pathways in the cell (replication, transcription and translation), and develop your skills in analysing genetic systems in model organisms. You will explore examples of cellular interactions: neuronal signalling, vertebrate immunity, and viral infection. In the practical work you design experiments to investigate your own hypotheses."}, {"title": "Ecology and Evolution", "description": "In this module you will explore how the planet's biological diversity is organised by ecological processes into ecosystems, communities, and populations. You will develop your skills in statistics, experimental design, and practical fieldwork."}, {"title": "Core Skills for Life Scientists", "description": "The module has four main themes - mathematics, communication skills, statistics, and bioinformatics. You will be introduced to programming and computer literacy skills in Python, and in R through statistics; and it will incorporate some other core skills such as the use of lab notebooks and critical reflection on feedback."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group A": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group B": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group C": {"items": []}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group A": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group B": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group C": {"items": []}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Biomedical Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop a breadth and depth of engineering skills and knowledge to address problems in medicine and biology.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Bioengineering Science 1", "description": "Gain a fundamental understanding of the chemistry and materials science principles related to bioengineering, including how material properties are governed by their structure at different length scales. You'll also explore the foundations of classical thermodynamics and its applications in biomedical engineering and molecular sciences."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Uncover how to select the most appropriate mathematical technique for problem-solving and develop a platform of mathematical knowledge."}, {"title": "Computer Fundamentals and Programming 1", "description": "Learn the fundamentals of digital logic design and computer programming as you examine how digital computers communicate with the real world."}, {"title": "Mechanics and Electronics 1", "description": "Explore the principles of mechanics and electronics and the mathematical connections between the two. Gain practical experience working in electronics and mechanics labs and uncover how these concepts can be used to study bioengineering problems."}, {"title": "Medical and Biological Science 1", "description": "Develop a foundational understanding of the chemistry and materials science principles related to bioengineering. You'll also cultivate wet lab skills in preparing a range of biomaterials and practising key classification techniques."}, {"title": "Design and Professional Practice 1", "description": "Discover the principles of engineering design and broaden your practical skills as you utilise appropriate tools and software to solve a variety of design problems."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Build upon your previous mathematical studies and equip yourself with the essential skills and knowledge you'll utilise for the remainder of your Biomedical Engineering programme."}, {"title": "Signals and Control 2", "description": "Uncover the foundations of signal processing and linear control systems and their applications across the fields of bioengineering, biomedicine and medical engineering."}, {"title": "Fluid and Solid Mechanics 2", "description": "Examine the basic concepts of structural mechanics and their relevance in design and risk analysis, in addition to developing analytical skills in stress analysis. You'll also explore key equations in the study of fluid mechanics and apply these concepts to fluids problems within a biomedical context."}, {"title": "Electronics and Electromagnetics 2", "description": "Understand the fundamental concepts and physical laws for electrostatics and magnetostatics and examine their application to basic physical and engineering problems. Gain experience working with simple electronics circuits and DC ORCAD/SPICE simulation of simple transistor topologies."}, {"title": "Design and Professional Practice 2", "description": "Harness the principles of engineering design and professional practice while collaborating on a Design, Make and Test group project. Work in a team to tackle a real design problem, broadening your engineering design skills and applying learning from other modules to a practical challenge."}, {"title": "Programming 2", "description": "Advance your programming skills using the Python language. Engage in labs and assignments to develop coding fluency. Cover more complex programming skills, including data structures, object-oriented programming, and algorithm design."}, {"title": "Bioengineering Science 2", "description": "Broaden your understanding of the principles of thermodynamics and heat and mass transport in the context of biomedical engineering. Learn how to analyse transport-related processes using advanced mathematics and dimensional analysis, and how to formulate, manipulate and solve equations governing heat and mass transport."}, {"title": "Medical Science 2", "description": "Explore a range of physiological concepts and systems, including the nervous system, musculoskeletal system, endocrine system, gastrointestinal system, reproductive system and renal system. Learn about control processes in these systems, with an emphasis on the role of control, operational and design constraints within the nervous system."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules (all pathways)": {"items": [{"title": "Probability and Statistics for Bioengineering", "description": "Examine probability theory and the mathematical concepts that underlie statistical models. Learn how to apply statistical models to real-world data and equip yourself with the statistical skills and knowledge required for the advanced years of your Bioengineering programme."}, {"title": "Bioengineering Group Project", "description": "Gain experience and refine your skills in project management, time management, collaboration, reporting and general communication as you work in teams on a research project of your choice."}, {"title": "Modelling in Biology", "description": "Uncover the mathematical and computational modelling techniques used in biology and physiology. Explore nonlinear dynamics, networks in biology and the basics of stochastic processes in biology and medicine, and apply theory to practice as you develop your own models using MATLAB."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Choose from a range of subjects hosted outside of the department and learn alongside students from other areas of study."}]}, "Bioengineering Pathway": {"items": [{"title": "Biomedical Instrumentation", "description": "Develop your understanding of electronics components and systems architecture and their applications in different types of biomedical instrumentation."}]}, "Mechanical Bioengineering Pathway": {"items": [{"title": "Biomechanics", "description": "Explore the key concepts in biomechanics, including kinematics and kinetics of human locomotion and macro- and micro-circulatory mechanics in various organs. Learn methods for analysing gait and practical approaches to quantifying and controlling biofluid flows."}, {"title": "Physiological Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Gain an understanding of advanced concepts in fluid mechanics and numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics, and examine their applications within physiology."}, {"title": "Biomedical Advanced and Computational Stress Analysis", "description": "Examine advanced topics in mechanical drawing, stress analysis and finite element simulation in the context of biomedical applications. Learn how to design for the manufacture of biomedical devices, and obtain the skills required to become a stress analysis engineer in the biomedical/mechanical engineering industry."}]}, "Electrical Bioengineering Pathway": {"items": [{"title": "Biomedical Instrumentation", "description": "Develop your understanding of electronics components and systems architecture and their applications in different types of biomedical instrumentation."}, {"title": "Image Processing", "description": "Examine digital image processing and image analysis methods, and develop an appreciation of the computation involved in interpreting or 'parsing' images. Learn about the biomedical, clinical and research applications of image processing and computer vision."}, {"title": "Digital Biosignal Processing", "description": "Uncover the fundamental principles and techniques for representing, transforming and processing discrete-time signals. Deepen your knowledge through the practical implementation of theoretical concepts in biomedical applications."}]}, "Computational Bioengineering Pathway": {"items": [{"title": "Image Processing", "description": "Examine digital image processing and image analysis methods, and develop an appreciation of the computation involved in interpreting or 'parsing' images. Learn about the biomedical, clinical and research applications of image processing and computer vision."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Bioengineers", "description": "Leverage your existing programming skills and gain experience working in a development team on a significant bioengineering software project. Learn software engineering tools, including those required for project lifecycle management, requirements capture, design, modelling, testing and effective teamwork."}, {"title": "Digital Biosignal processing", "description": "Uncover the fundamental principles and techniques for representing, transforming and processing discrete-time signals. Deepen your knowledge through the practical implementation of theoretical concepts in biomedical applications."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Digital Biosignal processing", "description": "Uncover the fundamental principles and techniques for representing, transforming and processing discrete-time signals. Deepen your knowledge through the practical implementation of theoretical concepts in biomedical applications."}, {"title": "Image Processing", "description": "Examine digital image processing and image analysis methods, and develop an appreciation of the computation involved in interpreting or 'parsing' images. Learn about the biomedical, clinical and research applications of image processing and computer vision."}, {"title": "Physiological Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Gain an understanding of advanced concepts in fluid mechanics and numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics, and examine their applications within physiology."}, {"title": "Foundations of Synthetic Biology", "description": "Study the principles of genetic engineering, synthetic biology and the design of biological machines. Learn how to design CRISPR-based genome edits and metabolic biosynthesis pathways and apply this knowledge in a series of experimental lab practicals where you edit the genome of yeast and introduce new enzymes into these cells to get them to produce coloured pigments for art."}, {"title": "Human Centred Assistive and Rehabilitation Devices", "description": "Learn how to design intuitive and efficient rehabilitation systems and assistive devices, integrating mechatronics, human factors and computer games. Understand how to assess current and emergent systems against the principles of human-centred design."}, {"title": "Biomedical Instrumentation", "description": "Develop your understanding of electronics components and systems architecture and their applications in different types of biomedical instrumentation."}, {"title": "Biomedical Advanced and Computational Stress Analysis", "description": "Examine advanced topics in mechanical drawing, stress analysis and finite element simulation in the context of biomedical applications. Learn how to design for the manufacture of biomedical devices, and obtain the skills required to become a stress analysis engineer in the biomedical/mechanical engineering industry."}, {"title": "Biomimetics*", "description": "Discover the new interdisciplinary field of biomimetics, which explores how functional principles found in nature can inspire scientists and engineers to solve outstanding technological problems."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Project*", "description": "Draw upon the knowledge and skills you've developed throughout your degree to tackle an unfamiliar research problem. Gain an understanding of the research environment as you work independently on a year-long research project that will address unanswered questions and challenges within an area of bioengineering."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Computational Neuroscience*", "description": "Gain an appreciation of the role of computational and theoretical approaches to understanding the nervous system. Apply your knowledge by developing code and using numerical tools to develop models of brain function and processes."}, {"title": "Brain Machine Interfaces*", "description": "Uncover the science behind the interfacing of the human brain to electronic circuitry. Learn about newly developed technologies, such as brain-machine interfaces (restoring movement and communication for paralysed patients) and deep-brain stimulation (for treatment of Parkinson's disease)."}, {"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis*", "description": "Analyse and discuss the scientific literature relating to core aspects of biological and clinical measurement.  Broaden your understanding of data handling and fitness for purpose, chemical measurement in cells and in vivo, challenges of non-invasive chemical monitoring of human tissue and approaches to invasive monitoring of tissue."}, {"title": "Molecular, Cell and Tissue Biomechanics*", "description": "Explore the application of engineering principles and approaches to the study of biomechanical behaviour, bridging between the molecular, cellular and tissue level scales. Apply your knowledge of the principles of solid and fluid mechanics to analyse and understand processes and structures across a range of length scales."}, {"title": "Cellular and Molecular Mechanotransduction*", "description": "Learn how to analyse cell function and examine how cells transform mechanical stimuli into biochemical signalling. Understand how mechanical forces regulate biological and physiological function, mechanotransduction in physiological and pathological scenarios, and techniques to mechanically manipulate biological entities."}, {"title": "Human Neuromechanical Control and Learning*", "description": "Examine the control of human movement from the perspectives of both adaptation of the neural control system, and adaptation of properties of the mechanical plant. Supplement your understanding by reviewing published literature and drawing upon approaches from physiology, engineering and computational neuroscience."}, {"title": "Orthopaedic Biomechanics*", "description": "Develop your understanding of the basic mechanics of the musculoskeletal system. Explore the structure and function of the musculoskeletal tissues (bone, cartilage, muscle, tendon, ligament), the mechanics of the tissues, diseases and injury of the tissues, and associated clinical treatments."}, {"title": "Biomimetics*", "description": "Discover the new interdisciplinary field of biomimetics, which explores how functional principles found in nature can inspire scientists and engineers to solve outstanding technological problems."}, {"title": "Animal Locomotion and Bioinspired Robotics*", "description": "Receive practical training in bio-inspired robotics locomotion and learn about selected topics in animal locomotion. Consolidate your theoretical knowledge by participating in hands-on activities and reinforce your engineering skills through the implementation of mechatronics systems."}, {"title": "Application Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) for Bioengineering*", "description": "Learn the basics of simulation, physical layout and verification of Application Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) for bioengineering applications."}, {"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship*", "description": "Gain insight into the process and challenges involved in the development of new products in the medical sector. Analyse case studies and hear guest presentations from startups, investment firms and entrepreneurs and learn from their experiences in bringing medical devices to market."}, {"title": "Neuroscience*", "description": "Discover the core neuroscience concepts and explore the 'state of the art' in regards to methodology and learn to provide multi-level descriptions of common brain disorders."}, {"title": "Nanotechnologies for Cancer Diagnosis and Cancer Therapy*", "description": "Assess the latest in nanotechnological advances in the field of cancer diagnostics and cancer therapies. You'll explore how academic research can directly impact, through applied science, the way cancer patients are screened, diagnosed, monitored and treated. Developing your skills in molecular bioengineering and its applications in: development of screening tools, diagnosis at the point of care and nanotechnologies for targeted drug delivery."}, {"title": "Biomaterials for Biomedicine and Sustainability*", "description": "Examine the frontiers of biomaterials research and innovation by exploring the development of new biomaterials and highlighting their functionalities in various fields of application. Dive into their synthesis through the use of state-of-art technology such as synthetic biology and chemistry and biomimetic engineering."}, {"title": "Industrial Applications of Cellular Engineering*", "description": "Discover how engineering cell behaviours impact industrial biotechnology and the bioproduction of chemicals, sustainable agriculture, the environment and biofuels. Learn how academic research can lead to applied science with direct impact in industry and society."}]}, "Optional modules - Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship*", "description": "Gain insight into the process and challenges involved in the development of new products in the medical sector. Analyse case studies and hear guest presentations from startups, investment firms and entrepreneurs and learn from their experiences in bringing medical devices to market."}, {"title": "Business for Professional Engineers and Scientists", "description": "Extend your practical knowledge across a range of business and management topics and gain an understanding of the financial, strategic, operational and organisational context in which engineering and science takes place."}, {"title": "Medical Device Certification*", "description": "Assess and discover the key information and skills needed by professional engineering in development of medical systems and devices. You'll explore product development for medical devices as well as safety, hazards and safe working practice."}]}}}, "Year 4 (Year Abroad)": {"groups": {}}, "Year 4 (Year in Industry)": {"groups": {}}, "Year 5": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Project", "description": "Draw upon the knowledge and skills you've developed throughout your degree to tackle an unfamiliar research problem.
