title: Biomedical Technology Ventures BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Learn how to improve human healthcare through the application of technology.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Business Economics", "description": "Understand the economic principles, concepts and tools used to explain market conditions and analyse why business environments change over time."}, {"title": "Computer Fundamentals and Programming 1", "description": "Learn the fundamentals of digital logic design and computer programming as you examine how digital computers communicate with the real world."}, {"title": "Design and Professional Practice 1", "description": "Harness the principles of engineering design and professional practice while collaborating on a Design, Make and Test group project. Work in a team to tackle a real design problem, broadening your engineering design skills and applying learning from other modules to a practical challenge."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship Online", "description": "Build your knowledge, skills and experience in starting an innovative business and learn how to secure critical funding and structure a deal to ensure your business' viability."}, {"title": "Foundations of Biomedical Engineering", "description": "Learn the principles of mathematics, computational thinking, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and physics that you will draw upon throughout the Biomedical Technology Ventures course and begin developing technical electronics skills via a laboratory."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Uncover how to select the most appropriate mathematical technique for problem-solving and develop a platform of mathematical knowledge that you'll utilise throughout the Biomedical Engineering programme."}, {"title": "Medical and Biological Science 1", "description": "Develop a foundational understanding of biological systems with an emphasis on physiological control systems and related biotechnology advancement."}, {"title": "Sensors and Actuation", "description": "Explore the key components and underlying technology of active medical devices, with emphasis on the physical principles of sensing and actuation, along with developing laboratory-based rapid prototyping skills."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "An Introduction to Biomaterials", "description": "Examine the major classes of biomedical implant materials (including metals, ceramics and polymers), focusing on their clinical use as replacements for body parts or tissue and the various reasons for failure. Develop wet-lab technical skills through a biomaterial laboratory investigation."}, {"title": "Biomedical Technology Ventures Summer Internship", "description": "Gain hands-on experience in a commercial environment through a minimum six-week placement at a startup or a similarly suitable business."}, {"title": "Finance and Financial Management", "description": "Develop a foundational understanding of the tools and techniques used by organisations to analyse markets, measure business performance and guide financial decision-making."}, {"title": "Managing Innovation", "description": "Uncover how innovations emerge and gain adoption in the marketplace, and learn how businesses can transform themselves into effective innovators."}, {"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Build upon your previous mathematical studies and equip yourself with the essential skills and knowledge you'll utilise for the remainder of your Biomedical Engineering programme."}, {"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship 1", "description": "Gain insight into the process and challenges involved in the development of new products in the medical sector. Analyse case studies and hear guest presentations from startups, investment firms and entrepreneurs and learn from their experiences in bringing medical devices to market."}, {"title": "Medical Science 2", "description": "Explore a range of physiological concepts and systems, including the nervous system, musculoskeletal system, endocrine system, gastrointestinal system, reproductive system and renal system. Learn about control processes in these systems, with an emphasis on the role of control, operational and design constraints within the nervous system."}, {"title": "Programming 2", "description": "Further build on your knowledge of computer fundamentals and expand your understanding of programming through exploring data structures, object oriented programming, and algorithm design."}, {"title": "Probability and Statistics for Bioengineering", "description": "Develop your statistical knowledge and skills required by exploring mathematical concepts that underly statistical models and learn how to apply these models to real world data."}, {"title": "Principles of Design", "description": "Explore the principles of informed design by tackling a hands-on design challenge. You will be able to integrate theoretical knowledge and practical skills learned from other modules (multidisciplinary) and apply them to the design challenge."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Bioengineering Elective", "description": "Explore tailored technical bioengineering courses to enhance your expertise in specific areas of interest. Select from a curated list of elective options to expand your skill set."}, {"title": "Biomedical Technology Ventures Group Project", "description": "Cultivate skills in project management, planning, collaboration and communication as you work in teams and apply your knowledge to current research and device design problems."}, {"title": "Business Strategy", "description": "Understand the concepts, principles and frameworks of strategic management, along with the methodologies required to analyse, formulate and implement appropriate policies within an organisation."}, {"title": "Digital Healthcare", "description": "Gain an introduction to the rapidly expanding digital healthcare landscape and the roles of healthcare providers, epidemiology, clinical studies and health apps."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Choose from a range of subjects hosted outside of the department and learn alongside students from other areas of study."}, {"title": "Industrial Applications of Cellular Engineering", "description": "Discover the broad industrial and societal applications of cellular engineering and synthetic biology research. Learn how engineering cell behaviours has applications in fields such as industrial biotechnology, sustainable agriculture, biomedicine and pharmaceutical production."}, {"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship 2", "description": "Build upon your earlier studies in medical device entrepreneurship as you evaluate the relative importance of factors driving innovation and consider the advanced topics of strategy and business planning."}, {"title": "Medical Device Certification", "description": "Uncover the key information and skills required by professional engineers in the development of medical devices and when preparing a project for CE certification or regulatory approval."}, {"title": "Principles of Biomedical Imaging", "description": "Understand how images of the human body can be obtained using different forms of penetrating radiation. Explore the underlying systems, technologies and operating principles behind the imaging modalities of x-ray, computer tomography (CT), magnetic resonance (MRI), ultrasound, and general optical imaging work."}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Biotechnology MSci | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Investigate the behaviour of living systems at the molecular and cellular level, create links between biology and technology and gain enhanced research skills and experience.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biological Chemistry", "description": "You will gain an appreciation of the concept that living systems obey the same fundamental laws that govern all matter and that understanding any life process requires an understanding of the physics and chemistry of that process. You will develop the mathematical and computer tools to develop this appreciation through quantitative as well as descriptive modes of expression. Building on this background, the course introduces lipids, polysaccharides, proteins, enzymes and membranes as key mediators of biological processes."}, {"title": "Cell Biology", "description": "You will be introduced to the cellular context in which biochemical reactions take place by taking a tour through typical cells. You will learn fundamental knowledge about the structure and functioning of eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells. You will encounter highlights of current cell biology research including work done at Imperial and its clinical and/or sustainable development relevance."}, {"title": "Enzymes and Metabolism", "description": "In this module you will build on fundamental concepts covered in Biological Chemistry, giving detailed insights into molecular processes occurring in living systems. You will consider the functional groups and relevant reactions from organic chemistry that are used as a basis for understanding enzymatic reactions and the metabolic pathways they support."}, {"title": "Molecular Biology", "description": "In this module you will be introduced to the basic concepts of genetics, how they relate to biochemistry and how they underpin much of molecular biology. You will study how molecular biology techniques can and are being applied to study almost every area of biochemistry and biology."}, {"title": "Core Skills for Life Scientists", "description": "The module has four main themes  - mathematics, communication skills, statistics, and bioinformatics. You will be introduced to  programming and computer literacy skills in Python, and in R through statistics; and it will incorporate other core skills such as the use of lab notebooks and critical reflection on feedback."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Structural Biology", "description": "You will develop an understanding of the relationship between macromolecular structure and function in the cell. You will gain insights into the theory and practice of how protein samples can be expressed, purified and engineered for structural and functional analysis, including the latest technologies and how this is used to interrogate molecular function under physiological and pathological conditions."}, {"title": "Genes and Genomics", "description": "The course will build upon the fundamental molecular biology taught in the first year. You will learn about advances in genomic technology and reinforcing key concepts, in a module that will provide an overview of gene and genome structure, the control of gene expression, gene and genome manipulation and the key aspects of genomics."}, {"title": "Integrative Cell Biology", "description": "In Integrated Cell Biology you will develop an understanding of how molecules and cells are integrated into functional systems with a focus on how this occurs in mammals including humans. You will gain a deep appreciation and be able to clearly communicate and apply the principles of: cell signalling, neuronal communication and the brain and the constituent components and regulation of physiological processes within the immune system."}, {"title": "Protein Science", "description": "You will study how advanced analytical techniques can be used to define protein and other biomolecule structure and how this structural insight is used in modern advances in enzymology and protein-ligand interactions."}, {"title": "Bioinformatics, Programming and Statistics", "description": "In this module you will be provided with the background necessary to understand the rapid developments in computational, statistical and bioinformatic life sciences."}, {"title": "Tutored Dissertation", "description": "Guided by an academic you will research a specialised area of Biotechnology; you will learn to review primary research literature and distil relevant information in order to write a review article on a specific area of scientific research."}, {"title": "Topics in Biotechnology", "description": "You will gain a a theoretical and practical grounding in modern biotechnology. Although biotechnology is an applied discipline, it depends upon the underpinning sciences of biochemistry and molecular biology. You will design and troubleshoot experiments in biotechnology topics through a mini-biotechnology research project including design workshops and laboratory practicals."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Your I-Explore module offers you choices from a range of subjects hosted outside of the department. You will be taught alongside students from other courses with options including business, management and many more."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group A": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group B": {"items": []}, "Optional modules – Group C": {"items": []}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Chemical Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Apply scientific, engineering and business principles to a variety of complex practical issues in this accredited Master's degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mastery 1", "description": "Develop your understanding of the main principles of chemical engineering and apply these principles to chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "Process Analysis", "description": "Build the skills required to analyse and compare chemical processes and learn how to develop and analyse flow diagrams."}, {"title": "Chemical Engineering Practice 1", "description": "Learn a programming language and apply it to solve design problems. Develop your problem solving skills through group work."}, {"title": "Transfer Processes 1", "description": "Explain the behaviour and properties of fluids and solve basic problems related to fluid mechanics and heat and mass transfer."}, {"title": "Thermodynamics 1", "description": "Define and distinguish important principles related to thermodynamics and analyse one-component multi-phase systems."}, {"title": "Separation Processes 1", "description": "Analyse diffusional separation processes for simple gas-liquid and liquid-liquid systems and consider their economic viability."}, {"title": "Chemistry 1", "description": "Familiarise yourself with the main principles of chemistry, and identify and apply a number of theories and concepts to solve reactivity."}, {"title": "Mathematics Fundamentals", "description": "Understand how to select the most appropriate mathematical techniques for problem solving and use these to solve complex mathematical equations."}, {"title": "Physical Chemistry", "description": "Gain knowledge of the concepts that link atomic and molecular physical chemistry to macroscopic behaviour of gases, liquids and solids."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mastery 2", "description": "Reinforce your mastery of chemical engineering to tackle more practical real-life engineering problems."}, {"title": "Transfer Processes 2", "description": "Advance your understanding of the equations governing mass and momentum transfer of incompressible fluids."}, {"title": "Chemical Engineering Practice 2", "description": "Design and execute selected experiments for a variety of engineering problems in order to choose optimal solutions and/or deliver set targets."}, {"title": "Reaction Engineering 1", "description": "Engage with the fundamental theory for the design and analysis of (pseudo-) homogeneous chemical reactors."}, {"title": "Thermodynamics 2", "description": "Develop an understanding of the principles of a variety of industrially-significant processes concerned with energy conversion and use."}, {"title": "Process Dynamics and Control", "description": "Explore the transient behaviour of processes through the application of a variety of mathematical models."}, {"title": "Separation Processes 2", "description": "Build on your knowledge from Year 1 and analyse advanced distillation and extraction processes."}, {"title": "Engineering Mathematics", "description": "Review various mathematical concepts and methods used in chemical engineering, including vector calculus and partial differential equations."}, {"title": "Chemistry 2", "description": "Identify the chemical foundations and mechanisms that underpin chemical industrial processes and explore key concepts in biochemistry."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mastery 3", "description": "Further develop your mastery of chemical engineering towards an advanced level of proficiency in communication, problem solving and critical thinking."}, {"title": "Reaction Engineering 2", "description": "Apply a general problem-solving approach to design heterogeneous and multi-phase reactors and appreciate the underlying physics of different reactor types."}, {"title": "Particle Engineering", "description": "Assess the key principles of particle technology and apply these concepts in process design situations involving solids."}, {"title": "Process Design", "description": "Become familiar with structured approaches to the design of chemical processes and the associated business skills required to develop a business plan."}, {"title": "Safety and Loss Prevention", "description": "Analyse the hazards which are most often encountered in industrial process plants and learn how to identify them."}, {"title": "Environmental Engineering", "description": "Examine the environmental impacts of human activities and explore issues related to sustainability, waste minimisation, clean technology and green chemistry."}, {"title": "Chemical Engineering Practice 3", "description": "Extend the practical competencies gained in earlier modules to areas of design and research to further develop your expertise and engineering judgement."}, {"title": "Process Optimisation", "description": "Apply advanced numerical methods for optimisation of both linear and nonlinear models to real chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Nuclear Chemical Engineering", "description": "Investigate the main chemical engineering processes associated with nuclear energy and work through problems related to mass and energy balance."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Technologies", "description": "Learn how to apply fundamental operation principles of different energy storage and conversion technologies and explore different options for clean energy generation."}, {"title": "Biochemical Sensors", "description": "Investigate the application and use of biological sensors."}, {"title": "Process Heat Transfer", "description": "Build your awareness of varied problems of process heat transfer and appreciate the advantages and disadvantages of the respective heat exchanger types."}, {"title": "Advanced Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Apply mathematical techniques to derive and solve the equations of motion of fluids and solve problems in Stokes and potential flows."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Chemical Engineering Practice 4", "description": "Employ innovative thinking to develop new process strategies, technology and analytical ability across a research project and group design task."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Colloids and Interface Science", "description": "Understand the nature of various interparticle forces, and explain the significant forces between colloidal systems and how they can be calculated and measured."}, {"title": "Product Characterisation", "description": "Explore current experimental techniques for product characterisation and apply these methods to real-world products."}, {"title": "Applied Spectroscopy", "description": "Evaluate a broad range of spectroscopic methods and apply your skills to various chemical systems and processes."}, {"title": "Biochemical Engineering", "description": "Review the techniques used in biotechnology, which in many cases differ markedly from chemical engineering."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Operations", "description": "Formulate, solve and interpret meaningful optimisation problems, and appreciate conditions for optimality as well as commonly available solution techniques."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Optimisation", "description": "Review state-of-the-art optimisation based techniques for process synthesis, process design and molecular design, and learn how to use leading modelling software."}, {"title": "Dynamic Behaviour of Process Systems", "description": "Develop mathematically well-behaved models of the transient behaviour of process equipment."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Appreciate how nonlinear dynamical systems are key to our understanding of complex phenomena both in nature and in a variety of technological processes."}, {"title": "Modelling of Biological Systems", "description": "Interlink the biological principles of cellular physiology with the mathematical tools required for their analysis and modelling."}, {"title": "Advanced Bioprocess Engineering", "description": "Review the relevant fundamentals of biochemistry, microbiology, and molecular biology, and understand the principles behind fermentation processes."}, {"title": "Transport Processes in Biological Systems", "description": "Develop your appreciation of the basic principles of heat, mass and momentum transport and solve problems involving fluid flow, heat and mass transfer."}, {"title": "Molecular Modelling of Fluids", "description": "Build the background and skills needed to understand the application of molecular theory and simulation in modelling fluids and fluid mixtures."}]}}}, "Year 3 (Year Abroad)": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": title: Chemistry BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop your understanding of organic, inorganic and physical chemistry and build practical laboratory skills.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "i-Engage", "description": "Begin to engage with university chemistry and receive training in teamwork and giving feedback."}, {"title": "Language of Chemistry", "description": "Explore how structures and concepts in chemistry are represented and described and learn how to draw and name a variety of molecules."}, {"title": "Structure and Bonding: Atomic Structure to Molecular Orbitals", "description": "Become familiar with the simple tools used to predict molecular structures and use theoretical models to explain the bonding in molecules and other chemical structures."}, {"title": "Introduction to Spectroscopy", "description": "Develop your understanding of the physical and theoretical basis for spectroscopic measurements and examine spectroscopic techniques."}, {"title": "Reactivity at Carbon Centres", "description": "Learn about the major types of reactivity at carbon centres and learn how to rationalise trends in reactivity."}, {"title": "The Reactions Toolkit: Thermodynamics and Kinetics", "description": "Explore the major theories and methodologies used to interpret chemical reactions and chemical equilibrium at a macroscopic level."}, {"title": "Chemistry of the Elements: Hydrogen to Uranium", "description": "Examine concepts and trends in the chemistry of the s-, p-, d- and f- block elements, and their compounds."}, {"title": "Practical Chemistry 1", "description": "Develop skills for practical chemistry and begin to apply these to investigative practical work."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mathematics and Physics 1", "description": "Become familiar with important mathematical concepts important for the theoretical description of physical phenomena."}, {"title": "Medicinal Chemistry 1", "description": "Assess the principles that underpin medicinal chemistry and place drug design within a medicinal chemistry context."}, {"title": "Imperial Horizons", "description": "Stimulate your professional and intellectual growth in areas including languages, humanities and social sciences."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "i-Engage 2", "description": "Appreciate the expectations for your second year of learning and learn about inclusivity and diversity."}, {"title": "Electronic States and Bonding", "description": "Understand what electronic states are and why chemical bonds form, based on approximate quantum mechanical models."}, {"title": "Analysis of Molecules, Materials and Mixtures", "description": "Explore the underlying theories of spectroscopy, and investigate a variety of spectroscopic techniques and applications."}, {"title": "Solids, Liquids and Interfaces", "description": "Use thermodynamic quantities to describe the state of a system, phase and interface; and calculate how such quantities change during a chemical transformation."}, {"title": "Chemistry of Molecular Systems", "description": "Build on your knowledge of properties, reactivity and synthesis, and apply it to a wider range of molecular chemical systems."}, {"title": "Macromolecules and Materials", "description": "Extend your knowledge of properties, reactivity and synthesis to consider polymers and biomolecules such as carbohydrates and peptides."}, {"title": "Control and Selectivity in Molecular Synthesis", "description": "Apply your prior knowledge of synthesis and properties to explain the properties of larger molecules such as bio(macro)molecules or polymers."}, {"title": "Practical Chemistry 2", "description": "Develop your research skills through synthetic, physical/analytical and computational experimental work."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mathematics and Physics 2", "description": "Become familiar with mathematical techniques relevant in the analysis and interpretation of physical theories including electromagnetism."}, {"title": "Medicinal Chemistry 2", "description": "Further your knowledge of medicinal chemistry in areas including pharmacokinetics and the principles of drug discovery."}, {"title": "Imperial Horizons", "description": "Stimulate your professional and intellectual growth in areas including languages, humanities and social sciences."}, {"title": "BPES", "description": "Examine a range of business and management topics on a module delivered by the Imperial Business School."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Chemistry Topics 1", "description": "Explore five advanced chemistry topics. You'll pick from topics including advanced synthesis, materials chemistry, and soft condensed matter."}, {"title": "Advanced Chemistry Topics 2", "description": "Investigate a further five advanced chemistry topics. You'll pick from topics including biological chemistry, process chemistry and strategies of drug discovery."}, {"title": "Practical Chemistry 3 for BSc Chemistry", "description": "Advance your skills in practical chemistry and research by carrying out a short independent research project and conducting lab practicals."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Chemistry MSci | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop your appreciation of core chemistry through to Master's level in this professionally accredited course.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "i-Engage", "description": "Begin to engage with university chemistry and receive training in teamwork and giving feedback."}, {"title": "Language of Chemistry", "description": "Explore how structures and concepts in chemistry are represented and described and learn how to draw and name a variety of molecules."}, explain the bonding in molecules and other chemical structures."}, {"title": "Introduction to Spectroscopy", "description": "Develop your understanding of the physical and theoretical basis for title: Civil Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Learn to solve global challenges across the natural and built environment through a world-leading education on this integrated Master's degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Professional Engineering Practice", "description": "Understand the wide scope of the civil engineering profession and the types of projects that you may contribute to in the future. Develop and strengthen key practical, professional and transferable skills that are required to meet the major challenges in society."}, {"title": "Civil Engineering Design 1", "description": "Develop essential engineering skills, working in groups and using problem-based learning to find solutions to real engineering projects"}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Build the mathematical knowledge, skills and techniques required throughout your civil engineering programme, and learn how mathematics is applied to help solve engineering problems."}, {"title": "Computational Methods 1", "description": "Explore basic concepts in computer programming and numerical analysis and understand their importance within the discipline of civil engineering."}, {"title": "Mechanics", "description": "Learn the fundamental principles of mechanics, static and dynamic systems, and the different types of mechanics issues that can arise in civil engineering."}, {"title": "Structural Mechanics 1", "description": "Examine the behaviour of common structural forms and how they carry external forces through the development of internal forces in structural elements."}, {"title": "Materials", "description": "Analyse the behaviour of commonly used civil engineering materials, and learn how to evaluate and select appropriate materials for different civil engineering applications."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics 1", "description": "Understand the physical processes governing the behaviour of fluids at rest and in motion, and gain insight into the practical world of civil engineering fluid mechanics."}, {"title": "Geotechnics", "description": "Learn about fundamental soil mechanics and geotechnical engineering, geotechnical design principles and the importance of developing a detailed understanding of ground conditions in successful civil engineering."}, {"title": "Energy and Environmental Engineering", "description": "Explore the interdisciplinary nature of major processes in energy and environmental engineering. Gain an overview of the fundamental science in disciplines such as microbiology, chemistry and thermodynamics, focusing on their application to energy technologies and the environment."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Civil Engineering Design 2", "description": "Work individually and within a team to develop, critique, defend and augment conceptual designs at multiple scales."}, {"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Equip yourself with an essential toolbox of applied mathematical techniques that can be used to solve real-world engineering problems."}, {"title": "Computational Methods 2", "description": "Gain hands-on experience as you learn concepts of computer-assisted engineering, graphical presentation and programming. Solve a wide range of civil and environmental engineering problems using Python."}, {"title": "Statistics", "description": "Understand issues of uncertainty in civil and environmental engineering and learn how statistical tools are used to estimate uncertainty for different types of data."}, {"title": "Structural Mechanics 2", "description": "Extend your knowledge of mechanics and structural mechanics and develop a deeper understanding of the physical behaviour of structural elements and systems."}, {"title": "Structural Design", "description": "Examine the structural design basis and behaviour of individual elements in both reinforced concrete structures and steel structures."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics 2", "description": "Broaden your understanding of fluid mechanics and the additional complexities associated with unsteady fluid flows, two-dimensional flows, and real (not ideal) fluids."}, {"title": "Soils Mechanics and Engineering Geology", "description": "Learn the fundamental elements of soil and rock mechanics and the implications for engineering design, along with the associated geological histories and hazards."}, {"title": "Environmental Engineering: Water Resource and Supply Engineering", "description": "Apply principles of hydrology and water engineering to understand the concepts and processes governing the natural and man-made water cycle."}, {"title": "Business and Project Management", "description": "Explore the business environment in which civil engineering projects take place, focusing on concepts such as risk management, supply chains, project management and procurement, worker safety and environmental impact."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Civil Engineering Design 3", "description": "Consolidate your technical knowledge through practical application as you work on a significant civil engineering design project. Gain teamwork skills and real-world insight into the design process through industrial partnering on the project."}, {"title": "Computational Engineering Analysis", "description": "Learn the principal computational methods for civil engineering and assess the accuracy of computer-based solutions within structural and geotechnical engineering, fluid mechanics and heat transfer."}, {"title": "Structural Mechanics 3", "description": "Explore how structures reach the point of ultimate failure, and understand key issues regarding geometric and material nonlinearities, methods for analyses, and practical considerations of construction and safety."}, {"title": "Dynamics of Structures", "description": "Examine the basic principles of dynamics as applied to structural engineering, and learn how to formulate and solve engineering problems related to the modelling, design and assessment of structures subjected to dynamic action."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics 3", "description": "Extend your understanding of turbulent mixing and transport processes in fluid mechanics and understand their significance in areas of pollutant dispersion and in the modelling of natural and man-made hazards."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Engineering", "description": "Build upon your knowledge of soil mechanics with this introduction to geotechnical design, focusing on slope stability analysis, foundation design and retaining wall design."}, {"title": "Environmental Engineering –  Water and Wastewater Treatment, Waste and Resource Management", "description": "Uncover the fundamental principles for the design of drinking water supply and treatment works, wastewater collection and treatment systems, and strategies for waste and resource management."}, {"title": "Transport Systems", "description": "Explore the design principles of transport systems and their application to the movement of people and goods within the wider context of the civil engineering profession."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Nonlinear Structural Analysis", "description": "Learn how to apply systematic procedures for geometric and material nonlinear structural analysis, use advanced nonlinear analysis software and undertake stability and buckling analysis for multi-degree of freedom structural systems."}, {"title": "Theory of Shells", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts and principles of the analysis and design of thin-walled shell-structures."}, {"title": "Coastal Engineering", "description": "Understand the nearshore characteristics of waves, currents, tides and storm surges, and learn techniques for calculating the wave and current processes that occur in the coastal zone."}, {"title": "Highway Engineering", "description": "Explore the process of locating, designing, constructing and maintaining highways. Uncover concepts relating to speed limits, route location, horizontal and vertical alignment, pavement design, surface drainage and earthworks requirements for highway construction."}]}, "Optional modules - Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Concrete Structures", "description": "Develop a sound understanding of concrete structure design and learn advanced design techniques such as stress field analysis and strut and tie modelling."}, {"title": "Design of Timber and Masonry Structures", "description": "Learn the core principles of design in timber and masonry and develop your structural design skills in the conception and sizing of typical timber and masonry elements."}, {"title": "Traffic Engineering", "description": "Study concepts such as traffic flow measurement and analysis, queuing theory, principles of traffic signal control, management of road user groups, motorway monitoring theory, and survey methods and data analysis techniques used by traffic engineers."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Research Project", "description": "Undertake a specific piece of independent research in the form of a critical review, laboratory- or field-based experimental investigation, modelling/numerical analysis project, or a design-related project."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Operational Research and Systems Analysis", "description": "Explore operational research methods used in the systems approach to engineering and management, and the requisite tools for mathematical representation of decision-making problems."}, {"title": "Steel Structures and Design", "description": "Build upon your structural analysis knowledge to examine the design fundamentals of structural steelwork elements and the conceptual design of a range of structural framing systems."}, {"title": "Concrete Structures", "description": "Develop a sound understanding of concrete structure design and demonstrate the application of theory to practice through a design project."}, {"title": "Prestressed Concrete", "description": "Learn the fundamental principles of the structural behaviour and design criteria of prestressed concrete structures, and understand the mechanics that define its internal forces."}, {"title": "Applied Hydrodynamics", "description": "Enhance your understanding of fluid flows and fluid loading processes and investigate both steady and unsteady flows across a wide range of hydrodynamic civil applications."}, {"title": "Geotechnical Hazards", "description": "Examine the main geotechnical hazards – landslides, volcanoes, tsunamis and earthquakes – and their potential damaging effects on the built environment, and learn the fundamental elements of engineering seismology, seismic hazard assessment and soil dynamics."}, {"title": "Advanced Soil Mechanics", "description": "Interpret facets of soil behaviour for advanced design of geotechnical structures and explore the importance of computer-based geotechnical design calculations."}, {"title": "Design of Timber and Masonry Structures", "description": "Reflect upon the fundamental concepts and design philosophies related to timber and masonry elements and harness your knowledge through the design of simple conventional structures."}, {"title": "Water and Wastewater Engineering", "description": "Understand the key principles and emerging trends in the design, modelling and control of water supply and wastewater collection networks, and wastewater treatment processes."}, {"title": "Water Resources Engineering", "description": "Obtain the knowledge and skills to appraise water resources demand and availability, and devise engineering solutions needed for optimal resource management."}, {"title": "Waste Management Engineering", "description": "Learn the basic principles of waste and resource management in the context of civil engineering and gain knowledge and skills in the management, treatment, disposal and recycling options for solid waste."}, {"title": "Traffic Engineering", "description": "Study concepts such as traffic flow measurement and analysis, queuing theory, principles of traffic signal control, management of road user groups, motorway monitoring theory, and survey methods and data analysis techniques used by traffic engineers."}, {"title": "Transport Demand and Economics", "description": "Cultivate a rigorous mathematical understanding of the principal techniques used for modelling travel demand, transport supply, network performance and the appraisal of transport policies and projects."}, {"title": "Transport, Environmental Impacts & Safety", "description": "Study the principal environmental impacts, risks and safety concerns of transport, and discover tools and techniques for evaluating the effects on air quality, noise and climate at local and global scales."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics for the Built Environment", "description": "Our urban landscapes are becoming increasingly complex and populated, presenting broad-ranging challenges regarding the sustainability and resilience of cities and buildings. This module aims to equip students with techniques and understanding that is necessary for the prediction, design and control of flow systems in the built environment."}]}}}, "Year 4 (Year Abroad)": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test (ESAT) and next steps": {"groups": {"Admissions test (ESAT)": {"items": []}, "Next steps": {"items": []}}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Year abroad": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Year abroad": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

course_overview: Focus your study of computing on artificial intelligence in this integrated Master's degree.

title: Design Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Fuse design thinking with engineering knowledge and practice in this highly creative integrated Master's degree
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design Engineering Principles", "description": "This module offers a dynamic introduction to design engineering, focusing on three key areas: understanding the global and professional context of the field, exploring creative design mindsets and methodologies, and developing essential practical and intellectual skills. Through hands-on tutorials, practitioner-led presentations, and independent study, you will begin to critically analyse real-world challenges – particularly ethical, environmental, and social factors – while shaping your own approach to design engineering."}, {"title": "Computing 1: Introduction to Scientific Computing", "description": "Better understand computer programming through a hands-on approach and build your appreciation of the Python programming language and supporting tools."}, {"title": "Engineering Mathematics", "description": "Analyse the mathematical tools and techniques used to tackle a variety of design engineering problems."}, {"title": "Materials and Manufacturing", "description": "Identify common engineering materials and the means to manufacture them into geometries."}, {"title": "Human-centred Design Engineering", "description": "Develop competence in creative human-centred design engineering and improve your skills in design drawing, engineering drawing and 3D computer aided design."}, {"title": "Data Science", "description": "Explore a wide range of datasets, to perform data analysis and use key insights from statistics and machine learning."}, {"title": "Solid Mechanics 1", "description": "Learn how to link force and displacement using laws of physics and how this can be used to model several real-world problems."}, {"title": "Electronics 1: Introduction to Electronic Circuits, Sensors, and Mechatronics", "description": "Develop your understanding of analogue and digital electronics as found in all electronics systems."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Compulsory modules": {"items": [{"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree. Please note: this module does not contribute to the year or programme aggregate mark."}]}, "Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Sustainable Design Engineering", "description": "Examine key challenges for sustainability and specific principles and methods for sustainable design."}, {"title": "Physical Computing", "description": "Combine the approaches of physical computing and mechatronics and distinguish between a wide range of standard machine elements and electronic components."}, {"title": "Solid Mechanics 2", "description": "Progress your knowledge from Solid Mechanics 1 by advancing your understanding of kinematics and stress analysis."}, {"title": "Electronics 2: Signals, Systems, and Control", "description": "Gain a system perspective on electronic systems and improve your understanding of signal interpretation, processing and manipulation."}, {"title": "Finite Element Analysis", "description": "Use finite element programs in a practical way to solve problems in linear elastic stress analysis."}, {"title": "Thermofluids: Energy and Design", "description": "Consider the topic of energy within a design context and the associated engineering sciences of fluid mechanics, heat transfer and thermodynamics."}, {"title": "Industrial Design Engineering", "description": "Carry out a project brief that integrates a human-centred design approach with the creative design engineering of a complex electromechanical product."}, {"title": "Working in Organisations", "description": "Discover the range of organisations Design Engineers operate in and consider the current and future professional landscape, together with effectively preparing to best position yourselves on a career route that is most relevant and exciting."}, {"title": "Computing 2: Applications", "description": "Build upon your knowledge from Computing 1 by examining application programming with a particular focus on web applications and the technologies associated with this. You will assess user interface and experience, accessing and manipulating data sources, and client-server architectures."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design Engineering Futures", "description": "Work on an engineering design interdisciplinary group project and improve your project management and concept development skills."}, {"title": "Robotics 1: Introduction to Robotics", "description": "Build your foundational knowledge of the field of robotics and explore robot control and motion planning algorithms."}, {"title": "Robotics 2: Applied Robotics", "description": "Appreciate the practical aspects of robotics through tutorial and lab sessions that enable you to build hands-on experience in the field."}, {"title": "Optimisation", "description": "Assess common system design and engineering optimisation problems and use appropriate tools to solve them."}, {"title": "Innovation & Entrepreneurship", "description": "Explore entrepreneurial thinking styles that are important in developing radical forms of innovation."}, {"title": "Design Engineering Industry Placement (Part 1)", "description": "Gain practical industry experience on a substantial design engineering related project, or collection of related projects. Please note: this module does not contribute to the year or programme aggregate mark."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Industrial Design", "description": "Obtain a high level understanding of contemporary industrial design principles, and better understand industrial design process tools."}, {"title": "Audio Experience Design", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the basic principles of acoustics and digital signal processing and the physiology of the hearing system."}, {"title": "Designing Interventions for Behavioural Change", "description": "Develop your competence in scoping, analysing and developing creative interventions for behaviour change."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Design Engineers", "description": "Advance your understanding of machine learning in a design engineering context and the mathematical tools that underpin it."}, {"title": "Economics and Finance for Systems Design", "description": "Assess the economic performance of engineering systems and products through a range of core principles."}, {"title": "Game Theory and Mechanism Design", "description": "Learn the relevant basics to analyse interaction within systems as games. Understand principles to describe agents and the type of games they are involved in."}, {"title": "Selected Menu of Electives from Faculty/College", "description": "Choose from a range of optional modules as you develop your distinct professional identity."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Storage Design", "description": "Explore sustainable energy storage systems including advanced batteries, novel concepts, and integrated designs for electronics, vehicles, etc. Topics include materials, device design, fabrication, property testing, and sustainability assessment."}, {"title": "User Interfaces and Interactions", "description": "In this module, you will be introduced to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), covering key concepts, principles, and techniques for creating effective digital interfaces while highlighting the importance of equality, diversity, and inclusion in design."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design Engineering Industry Placement (Part 2)", "description": "Gain practical industry experience on a substantial design engineering related project and reflect on how your work has impacted on your professional development. Please note: this module does not contribute to the year or programme aggregate mark."}, {"title": "Design Engineering Master's Project", "description": "Complete your four-year design engineering journey by carrying out a major project in an area of your choice."}, {"title": "Enterprise Roll Out", "description": "Develop your knowledge of management and business practices from outside engineering and how they can be applied effectively in an entrepreneurial venture."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Industrial Design", "description": "Obtain a high level understanding of contemporary industrial design principles, and better understand industrial design process tools."}, {"title": "Audio Experience Design", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the basic principles of acoustics and digital signal processing and the physiology of the hearing system."}, {"title": "Designing Interventions for Behavioural Change", "description": "Develop your competence in scoping, analysing and developing creative interventions for behaviour change."}, {"title": "Economics and Finance for Systems Design", "description": "Assess the economic performance of engineering systems and products through a range of core principles."}, {"title": "Games and Mechanisms", "description": "XXX"}, {"title": "Game Theory and Mechanism Design", "description": "Learn the relevant basics to analyse interaction within systems as games. Understand principles to describe agents and the type of games they are involved in."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Design Engineers", "description": "Advance your understanding of machine learning in a design engineering context and the mathematical tools that underpin it."}, {"title": "Selected Menu of Electives from Faculty/College", "description": "Choose from a range of optional modules as you develop your distinct professional identity."}]}, "Optional modules - Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Design Analytics for the Sharing Economy", "description": "Better understand the sharing economy and how this new paradigm is causing a wave of disruption to empower citizens and communities."}, {"title": "Design Psychology", "description": "Build your knowledge of psychology and how design solutions to global challenges need to take into account human behaviour."}, {"title": "From Data to Product", "description": "Explore the very aspects of data science in order design products from data. Assess the methods of generating value from data, by going through relevant concepts within modern data science such as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics."}, {"title": "Nano Design Engineering", "description": "Explore how nanomaterials can be engineered to serve specific applications."}, {"title": "Responsible Engineering and Design Innovation", "description": "Critically analyse how technology products impact on individuals, their health and society as a whole."}, {"title": "Robotics Research Project", "description": "Assess the latest research in the field of applied robotics through hands-on project work."}, {"title": "Sensing and Internet of Things", "description": "Use techniques to develop software and hardware platforms for the Internet of Things and understand the basics of mobile sensing."}, {"title": "Transformational Play", "description": "Enhance your understanding of creating games and playful experiences for a range of entertainment and social issues such as health, education, sustainability, or social change. Learn the key concepts, aspects and methods of game design and play experiences through rapid making and critiquing of analogue games."}]}, "Optional modules - Group C": {"items": [{"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing", "description": "Improve your knowledge of current additive manufacturing (AM) technology, materials, trends and processes."}, {"title": "Design of Visual Systems", "description": "Discover and develop your understanding of the human visual system, and the technology available for design engineers to acquire, analyse, interpret and exploit visual information gathered with modern electronic components."}, {"title": "Inferential Statistics and Casual Reasoning", "description": "Learn about different modes of data and common tests and analyses as well as data cleaning and preparation techniques. You will also explore how to choose a suitable analysis for a given problem, as well as conduct appropriate reporting practices."}, {"title": "Sustainable Design and Strategy", "description": "Explore how to design for positive impact, and more preferable futures. You will also learn the tools and techniques available to implement sustainable design and provide knowledge of the methods a company can employ to reduce environmental impacts, promote sustainable practices and build resilient propositions"}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test (ESAT) and interview": {"groups": {"Admissions test (ESAT)": {"items": []}, "Interview": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Electrical and Electronic Engineering BEng | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
course_overview: Focus on the design and application of large and small scale electronic systems in this professionally accredited degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mathematics 1A", "description": "Understand why mathematics is the foundation of all engineering practice and build the robust mathematics skills needed to proceed to more complex modules."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1B", "description": "Build on your learning from Mathematics 1A and appreciate fundamental mathematical principles in an engineering context."}, {"title": "Topics in Electrical Engineering", "description": "Familiarise yourself with the interdisciplinary nature of electrical engineering and analyse the generation, transport and management of electrical power systems."}, {"title": "Analysis and Design of Circuits", "description": "Build a foundation in the analysis and design of electronic circuits, and explore key concepts that are essential for higher level study of electronics."}, {"title": "Digital and Computer Architecture", "description": "Develop your understanding of digital design and low-level computer operation to understand system design across the hardware - software boundary."}, {"title": "Programming for Engineers", "description": "Become familiar with programming using C++ and learn standard imperative programming skills such as control-flow, variables, and data structures."}, {"title": "Electronics Design Project", "description": "Apply your knowledge to a major group design project which considers the full design process, from the client brief to the demonstration of a prototype."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Mathematics for Engineers", "description": "Build on your first year studies to cover more advanced topics in mathematics that are relevant to both electrical and information engineering."}, {"title": "Signal and Systems", "description": "Learn how to take data in one domain and transform it to another domain to help analysis, and understand fundamental principles such as sampling and transforms."}, {"title": "Electromagnetism", "description": "Understand why electromagnetic systems are ubiquitous in electrical engineering and apply the techniques of Vector Calculus to obtain analytical solutions to problems."}, {"title": "Circuits and Systems", "description": "Build on your first year learning to analyse and design electronic circuits with a system level perspective."}, {"title": "Power Electronics and Power Systems", "description": "Explore the generation, transmission and applications of electrical power."}, {"title": "Communications", "description": "Discover how information is transmitted from one point to another in the presence of noise and build your awareness of information theory."}, {"title": "Control Systems", "description": "Become acquainted with basic elements of the theory of dynamic systems and the techniques used to design automatic control systems."}, {"title": "Electronics Design Project 2", "description": "Apply your knowledge to a major group design project which considers the full design process, from the client brief to the demonstration of a prototype."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}, {"title": "Individual project", "description": "Choose a project from a wide range of engineering topics and work in collaboration with a member of staff who is an expert in the proposed field."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Analogue Integrated Circuits and Systems", "description": "Understand how analogue integrated circuits and systems are used in CMOS and Bipolar technologies."}, {"title": "Biomedical Electronics", "description": "Familiarise yourself with how biomedical electronics can be used to create medical devices that interface with the human body."}, {"title": "Communication Networks", "description": "Develop a conceptual framework for analysing different communication networks and build your awareness of industry standards."}, {"title": "Control Engineering", "description": "Build your knowledge of advanced modern control methodologies and explore topics including Kalman filtering and tracking, fault detection and isolation, and linear matrix inequalities."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Assess fundamental concepts and advanced methodologies of deep learning and relate them to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Digital Signal Processing", "description": "Appreciate the fundamental principles and applications of digital signal processing, including sampling theory, z-transforms and system functions."}, {"title": "Digital Systems Design", "description": "Design digital systems of medium complexity, and learn how to implement the design with FPGA/CPLD devices, memory devices and microprocessors."}, {"title": "Electrical Energy Systems", "description": "Explore the basic elements and title: Electrical and Electronic Engineering with Management MEng | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
course_overview: Get set for business with advanced technical knowledge and a specialist business programme in this integrated Master's degree.

title: Electronic and Information Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London

title: Mathematics with Applied Mathematics/Mathematical Physics BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Engage with mathematical ideas and use problem-solving skills and advanced logic to understand real-world phenomena
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to University Mathematics", "description": "Transition towards the way you will be expected to think about and approach mathematics during your degree, with emphasis on the importance of precise definitions and rigorous proofs."}, {"title": "Analysis 1", "description": "Undertake a rigorous treatment of the concept of a limit, as applied to sequences, series and functions."}, {"title": "Linear Algebra and Groups", "description": "Generalise what you already know about systems of linear equations and matrices and view them in more abstract, and more geometric, frameworks of vector spaces and linear transformations."}, {"title": "Calculus and Applications", "description": "Explore a selection of mathematical tools that will enable you to solve more complex problems in applied mathematics than you will have tackled previously."}, {"title": "Probability and Statistics", "description": "Focus on probability concepts, within an axiomatic framework. There will be a strong emphasis on principles of modelling and data analysis and you will learn to use the formal language of probability."}, {"title": "Introduction to Computation", "description": "Gain knowledge of programming in Python through illustrative examples, practice questions and assessment tasks, guided by computational principles and their underlying mathematical concepts."}, {"title": "An Introduction to Applied Mathematics", "description": "Identify how mathematical ideas can be used to underpin a range of scientific problems and familiarise yourself with a mathematical framework that embraces multiple disciplines from engineering to economics and statistics."}, {"title": "Individual Research Project", "description": "Develop elementary research skills in mathematics while exploring your personal interests in a specific area of mathematics."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Linear Algebra and Numerical Analysis", "description": "Examine how to find matrices for a linear transformation which reflect its important features, culminating in the rational and Jordan canonical forms, and prove the fundamental Cayley-Hamilton Theorem."}, {"title": "Analysis 2", "description": "Explore higher-dimensional derivatives, leading to the inverse and implicit function theorems, alongside metric and topological spaces as generalisations of n dimensional spaces, and limiting behaviour of sequences in such spaces."}, {"title": "Multi-variable Calculus and Differential Equations", "description": "Gain an understanding of advanced topics in calculus and ordinary differential equations, including an introduction to multi-dimensional vector calculus and differential operators."}, {"title": "Group Research Project", "description": "Further your mathematical research and communication skills while developing transferable teamwork and presentation skills."}, {"title": "Partial Differential Equations in Action", "description": "Learn about partial differential equations and the concept of modelling in applied mathematics, with a focus on practical application."}, {"title": "I-Explore module", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}, {"title": "Statistical Modelling 1", "description": "Develop the traditional concepts of statistical inference, including maximum likelihood, hypothesis testing and interval estimation and apply them to the linear model that arises in many practical situations."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Groups and Rings", "description": "Study examples of groups and homomorphisms, along with applications of group theory and rings, a class of algebraic object equipped with both addition and multiplication."}, {"title": "Lebesgue Measure and Integration", "description": "Explore Lebesgue's theory of measure and integration, a powerful extension of the Riemann integral and an essential tool in all aspects of analysis and its applications, including probability, stochastic processes and PDEs."}, {"title": "Probability for Statistics", "description": "Investigate probability concepts that are useful in applications, particularly to statistics, focusing on the joint behaviour of several random variables."}, {"title": "Statistical Modelling 1", "description": "Develop the traditional concepts of statistical inference, including maximum likelihood, hypothesis testing and interval estimation and apply them to the linear model that arises in many practical situations."}, {"title": "Network Science", "description": "Foray into an ever-evolving interdisciplinary field in which concepts and methods from mathematics play a central role in the analysis of real-world systems from computing, science, and engineering."}, {"title": "Principles of Programming", "description": "Build a core of programming skills beyond those encountered in your first year through the object-oriented programming model, which is very widely used and taught in Python."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": In such fields, the familiar unique factorisation enjoyed by the integers may fail, but the extent of the failure is measured by the class group."}, {"title": "Algebraic Topology", "description": "Engage with algebraic topology and advance your knowledge of homology theory, fundamental groups and the Galois correspondence for covering spaces."}, {"title": "Applied Complex Analysis", "description": "Further your knowledge of mathematical techniques including the Wiener-Hopf method, Plemelj formulae, Hilbert problem, Orthogonal polynomials, the GrammSchmidt process, and the Rodrigues formula."}, {"title": "Applied Probability", "description": "Gain an understanding of the basics of stochastic processes and how they can be applied.
