methods."}, {"title": "Consumer Credit Risk Modelling", "description": "Develop the theory and practice of developing credit risk models in retail finance, exploring credit scoring and application scoring."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems", "description": "Examine the foundations of discrete-time dynamical systems and discover why they are so important to areas such as finance, physics, biology and social sciences."}, {"title": "Dynamics of Games and Learning", "description": "Explore modelling learning through studying the dynamics of games and analyse learning models used by technology companies."}, {"title": "Finite Elements: Numerical Analysis and Implementation", "description": "Develop a deep understanding of the finite element method by spanning both its analysis and implementation."}, {"title": "Fluid Dynamics 1", "description": "Be presented with a derivation of the Navier-Stokes and learn techniques to simplify and solve the equation with the purpose of describing the motion of fluids at different conditions."}, {"title": "Fluid Dynamics 2", "description": "Seek out simplifications in the Navier-Stokes formulation and learn how to solve Prandtl's boundary-layer equations."}, {"title": "Function Spaces and Applications", "description": "Broaden your knowledge of basic function spaces and the basic methodologies needed to undertake the analysis of partial differential equations."}, {"title": "Functional Analysis", "description": "Assess ideas of continuity and linear algebra, with a particular emphasis on vector spaces and linear maps."}, {"title": "Galois Theory", "description": "Learn why the formula for the solution to a quadratic equation and similar formulae for cubic and quartic equations are well-known but no formula is possible for quintics."}, {"title": "Geometric Complex Analysis", "description": "Analyse the study and functions of complex numbers and look at solving two-dimensional problems in physics such as hydrodynamics and Ferromagnetism."}, {"title": "Group Representation Theory", "description": "Explore the representations of groups and the character of a group representation."}, {"title": "Group Theory", "description": "Familiarise yourself with key concepts on this introduction to some of the more advanced topics in the theory of groups."}, {"title": "Introduction to Geophysical Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Advance your knowledge of fluid-dynamics relating to geophysics through a mix of theory and applications."}, {"title": "Markov Processes", "description": "Discover why Markov processes are widely used to model random evolutions and how the theory connects with many other subjects in mathematics."}, {"title": "Mathematical Biology", "description": "Learn how to describe the application of mathematical models to biological phenomena and give consideration to problems typical of particular organisms and environments."}, {"title": "Mathematical Finance: An Introduction to Option Pricing", "description": "Engage with the mathematical modelling of derivatives securities, which focuses on the pricing and hedging of derivatives using a probabilistic representation of market uncertainty."}, {"title": "Mathematical Logic", "description": "Analyse mathematical structures by looking into the foundational issues of mathematics such as formal logic and set theory."}, {"title": "Mathematics of Business and Economics", "description": "Discover microeconomics and macroeconomics and consider the motivations and optimal behaviours of firms and consumers in the marketplace."}, {"title": "Mathematics Research Project", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding with a supervised independent project in a particular area or topic. The project may be theoretical or computational."}, {"title": "Methods for Data Science", "description": "Learn how to visualise and explore data in R, and understand the fundamental concepts and challenges of learning from data."}, {"title": "Number Theory", "description": "Focus on the properties of natural numbers, and in particular of prime numbers, which can be proved by elementary methods."}, {"title": "Numerical Solutions of Ordinary Differential Equations", "description": "Explore a range of techniques for solving ordinary differential equations, including the Runge-Kutta, extrapolation and linear multistep methods."}, {"title": "Probability Theory", "description": "Explore the fundamental properties of probability, including probability measures. independent random variables and elements of Brownian motion."}, {"title": "Quantum Mechanics 1", "description": "Untangle the theory of quantum mechanics and discover why it provides the basis for many areas of contemporary physics."}, {"title": "Quantum Mechanics 2", "description": "Build on topics covered in Quantum Mechanics I and further your understanding of key areas of contemporary physics."}, {"title": "Scientific Computing", "description": "Engage with the efficient algorithms deployed to solve mathematical problems using computation and become comfortable with the Python programming language."}, {"title": "Special Relativity and Electromagnetism", "description": "Discover how advances in modern theoretical physics are being made and become familiar with the classical theory of fields."}, {"title": "Applied Statistical Inference", "description": "Develop the traditional concepts of statistical inference, including maximum likelihood, hypothesis testing and interval estimation and apply them to the linear model that arises in many practical situations."}, {"title": "Statistical Theory", "description": "Familiarise with the criteria and the theoretical results necessary to develop and evaluate optimum statistical procedures in hypothesis testing, point and interval estimation."}, {"title": "Stochastic Simulation", "description": "Build an up-to-date understanding of computational simulation methods, covering areas from basic random variate generation to the Monte Carlo methodology."}, {"title": "Survival Models", "description": "Examine survival models that are fundamental to actuarial work, as well as being a key concept in medical statistics, with particular emphasis on actuarial applications."}, {"title": "Tensor Calculus and General Relativity", "description": "Advance your understanding of Tensor calculus and explore concepts including Riemannian geometry, Einstein's field equations and the Newtonian approximation."}, {"title": "Time Series Analysis", "description": "Learn the basic statistical concepts and reasoning relevant to atmospheric science and gain experience in the proper use of statistical methods for the analysis of weather and climate data."}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, title: Mathematics with Mathematical Computation BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Apply mathematical thinking to theoretical computer science and advance your knowledge of high performance computing
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to University Mathematics", "description": "Transition towards the way you will be expected to think about and approach mathematics during your degree, with emphasis on the importance of precise definitions and rigorous proofs."}, {"title": "Analysis 1", "description": "Undertake a rigorous treatment of the concept of a limit, as applied to sequences, series and functions."}, {"title": "Linear Algebra and Groups", "description": "Generalise what you already know about systems of linear equations and matrices and view them in more abstract, and more geometric, frameworks of vector spaces and linear transformations."}, {"title": "Calculus and Applications", "description": "Explore a selection of mathematical tools that will enable you to solve more complex problems in applied mathematics than you will have tackled previously."}, {"title": "Probability and Statistics", "description": "Focus on probability concepts, within an axiomatic framework. There will be a strong emphasis on principles of modelling and data analysis and you will learn to use the formal language of probability."}, {"title": "Introduction to Computation", "description": "Gain knowledge of programming in Python through illustrative examples, practice questions and assessment tasks, guided by computational principles and their underlying mathematical concepts."}, {"title": "An Introduction to Applied Mathematics", "description": "Identify how mathematical ideas can be used to underpin a range of scientific problems and familiarise yourself with a mathematical framework that embraces multiple disciplines from engineering to economics and statistics."}, {"title": "Individual Research Project", "description": "Develop elementary research skills in mathematics while exploring your personal interests in a specific area of mathematics."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Analysis 2", "description": "Explore higher-dimensional derivatives, leading to the inverse and implicit function theorems, alongside metric and topological spaces as generalisations of n dimensional spaces, and limiting behaviour of sequences in such spaces."}, {"title": "Group Research Project", "description": "Further your mathematical research and communication skills while developing transferable teamwork and presentation skills."}, {"title": "Linear Algebra and Numerical Analysis", "description": "Examine how to find matrices for a linear transformation which reflect its important features, culminating in the rational and Jordan canonical forms, and prove the fundamental Cayley-Hamilton Theorem."}, {"title": "Multi-variable Calculus and Differential Equations", "description": "Gain an understanding of advanced topics in calculus and ordinary differential equations, including an introduction to multi-dimensional vector calculus and differential operators."}, {"title": "Principles of Programming", "description": "Build a core of programming skills beyond those encountered in your first year through the object-oriented programming model, which is very widely used and taught in Python."}, {"title": "I-Explore module", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Groups and Rings", "description": "Study examples of groups and homomorphisms, along with applications of group theory and rings, a class of algebraic object equipped with both addition and multiplication."}, {"title": "Lebesgue Measure and Integration", "description": "Explore Lebesgue's theory of measure and integration, a powerful extension of the Riemann integral and an essential tool in all aspects of analysis and its applications, including probability, stochastic processes and PDEs."}, {"title": "Partial Differential Equations in Action", "description": "Learn about partial differential equations and the concept of modelling in applied mathematics, with a focus on practical application."}, {"title": "Probability for Statistics", "description": "Investigate probability concepts that are useful in applications, particularly to statistics, focusing on the joint behaviour of several random variables."}, {"title": "Statistical Modelling 1", "description": "Develop the traditional concepts of statistical inference, including maximum likelihood, hypothesis testing and interval estimation and apply them to the linear model that arises in many practical situations."}, {"title": "Network Science", "description": "Foray into an ever-evolving interdisciplinary field in which concepts and methods from mathematics play a central role in the analysis of real-world systems from computing, science, and engineering."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, title: Mathematics with Statistics for Finance BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Learn to apply statistical methods to solve problems facing financial services industries.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Introduction to University Mathematics", "description": "Transition towards the way you will be expected to think about and approach mathematics during your degree, with emphasis on the importance of precise definitions and rigorous proofs."}, {"title": "Analysis 1", "description": "Undertake a rigorous treatment of the concept of a limit, as applied to sequences, series and functions."}, {"title": "Linear Algebra and Groups", "description": "Generalise what you already know about systems of linear equations and matrices and view them in more abstract, and more geometric, frameworks of vector spaces and linear transformations."}, {"title": "Calculus and Applications", "description": "Explore a selection of mathematical tools that will enable you to solve more complex problems in applied mathematics than you will have tackled previously."}, {"title": "Probability and Statistics", "description": "Focus on probability concepts, within an axiomatic framework. There will be a strong emphasis on principles of modelling and data analysis and you will learn to use the formal language of probability."}, {"title": "Introduction to Computation", "description": "Gain knowledge of programming in Python through illustrative examples, practice questions and assessment tasks, guided by computational principles and their underlying mathematical concepts."}, {"title": "An Introduction to Applied Mathematics", "description": "Identify how mathematical ideas can be used to underpin a range of scientific problems and familiarise yourself with a mathematical framework that embraces multiple disciplines from engineering to economics and statistics."}, {"title": "Individual Research Project", "description": "Develop elementary research skills in mathematics while exploring your personal interests in a specific area of mathematics."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Analysis 2", "description": "Explore higher-dimensional derivatives, leading to the inverse and implicit function theorems, alongside metric and topological spaces as generalisations of n dimensional spaces, and limiting behaviour of sequences in such spaces."}, {"title": "Group Research Project", "description": "Further your mathematical research and communication skills while developing transferable teamwork and presentation skills."}, {"title": "Linear Algebra and Numerical Analysis", "description": "Examine how to find matrices for a linear transformation which reflect its important features, culminating in the rational and Jordan canonical forms, and prove the fundamental Cayley-Hamilton Theorem."}, {"title": "Multi-variable Calculus and Differential Equations", "description": "Gain an understanding of advanced topics in calculus and ordinary differential equations, including an introduction to multi-dimensional vector calculus and differential operators."}, {"title": "I-Explore module", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}, {"title": "Probability for Statistics", "description": "Investigate probability concepts that are useful in applications, particularly to statistics, focusing on the joint behaviour of several random variables."}, {"title": "Statistical Modelling 1", "description": "Develop the traditional concepts of statistical inference, including maximum likelihood, hypothesis testing and interval estimation and apply them to the linear model that arises in many practical situations."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Groups and Rings", "description": "Study examples of groups and homomorphisms, along with applications of group theory and rings, a class of Python."}, {"title": "Network Science", "description": "Foray into an ever-evolving interdisciplinary field in which concepts and methods from mathematics play a central role in the analysis of real-world systems from computing, science, and engineering."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support title: Mechanical Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop your creative, practical and transferable skills through a broad mechanical engineering curriculum.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design and Manufacture 1", "description": "Learn about the design process from brief to manufacture, including how to produce a product design specification."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics 1", "description": "Explore a range of fluid dynamics mechanisms and forces to gain a solid understanding of the fundamentals."}, {"title": "Materials 1", "description": "Discover the important mechanical properties and learn about the concept and practice of materials selection."}, {"title": "Mathematics and Computing 1", and other forms of energy and distinguish between reversible and irreversible processes."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Design and Manufacture 2", "description": "}]}, "Optional modules – Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Aircraft Engine Technology", "description": "Design a jet engine for a civil airliner in a small group and improve your understanding of aerodynamic design choices."}, {"title": "Mechanical Transmissions Technology", "description": "Explore the design and technology of mechanical transmission systems and design and analyse geared drive systems."}, {"title": "Metal Processing Technology", "description": "Examine the metal forming technologies used for the manufacture of a range of metal components such as automotive and aircraft body panels."}, {"title": "Future Clean Transport Technology", "description": "Learn how to construct physical and computational models of processes occurring in IC engines, hybrid-electric powertrains and energy storage systems."}]}, "Optional modules – Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Control", "description": "Build your working knowledge of modelling, analysis and design methods in relation to continuous and discrete control systems."}, {"title": "Advanced Numerical Methods for Engineers", "description": "This module builds on first- and second-year numerical methods to give you a deeper understanding of modern techniques used by engineers in both industry and research. You will study topics such as mesh generation, linear algebra and matrix solvers, as well as numerical methods for solving ODEs and PDEs in real-world applications."}, {"title": "Advanced Stress Analysis", "description": "Investigate fundamental elasticity and plasticity theory, problems and solutions."}, {"title": "Applied Vibration Engineering", "description": "Use the theoretical principles of vibration and vibration analysis techniques to solve vibration problems."}, {"title": "Automotive Design with Motorsport B", "description": "Tackle real-life automotive design problems using the knowledge and skills gained during the course."}, {"title": "Combustion Safety and Fire Dynamics", "description": "Analyse the scientific foundations of combustion and assess trends relating to the global utilisation of fuels for energy consumption."}, {"title": "Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Engage with the mathematical formulation used for a range of heat and fluid flow problems."}, {"title": "Composite Materials", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of composite materials, including the mechanics of fibre and particle reinforced composites and their methods of manufacture."}, {"title": "Computational Continuum Mechanics B", "description": "Consolidate your existing knowledge of continuum mechanics and build your appreciation of the finite element method."}, {"title": "Design, Art and Creativity B", "description": "Learn how to brainstorm effectively and keep an open mind in relation to the design process."}, {"title": "Embedded C for Microcontrollers B", "description": "Develop your familiarity with the C programming language and write simple programs to manipulate data."}, {"title": "Energy Systems", "description": "Learn how to define an energy system and identify its major components."}, {"title": "Environmental and Applied Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Apply the principles of fluid mechanics and thermodynamics to a range of engineering and environmental problems."}, {"title": "Equality, Diversity and Inclusion in Engineering B", "description": "You will learn about and engage with engineering in the context of global society and within the engineering industry. You'll then apply this knowledge to create and plan initiatives, gaining an understanding of being an EDI champion and improving interpersonal skills."}, {"title": "Fracture Mechanics B", "description": "Build on your existing knowledge of fracture mechanics and learn how to predict the residual strength of a flawed structure."}, {"title": "Fluid Mechanics 3B", "description": "Deepen your appreciation of fluid mechanics and use numerical solutions to describe the fundamental features of fluid flow."}, {"title": "Finite Element Analysis and Applications B", "description": "Gain practical experience in analysis using an industry-standard, interactive, finite element program."}, {"title": "Interfacing and Data Processing", "description": "Explore data processing methods used for industrial processes and understand their purpose."}, {"title": "Introduction to Nuclear Energy B", "description": "Explore technical, social, economic and environmental issues related to nuclear energy."}, {"title": "Introduction to Robotics", "description": "This Mechatronics module introduces the fundamental theory of mechanical manipulators and applies these concepts to practical problem-solving. You will also gain an introduction to key computer vision techniques, linking robotics with real-world applications."}, {"title": "Machine Learning", "description": "Build your knowledge of the basic theory of machine learning (ML) and explore the workings of neural networks (NN)."}, {"title": "Manufacturing Technology and Management B", "description": "This Level 7 MTM module develops your knowledge of CNC machining, CAM programming, cutting tool selection, metrology, and lean methodologies, including value stream mapping, 5S, PDCA, and statistical process control. Unlike the Level 6 module, it places greater emphasis on product costing and process management within coursework, and you cannot take both for credit towards your degree."}, {"title": "Mathematics B", "description": "You'll show how mathematics can be used to characterise and model the qualitative behaviour of a system without solving in detail the equations controlling the evolution of the system. This is a level 6 version of the enhanced level 7 Mathematics module and students cannot take both for credit towards their final degree."}, {"title": "Mechatronics 3B", "description": "This Level 7 Mechatronics module builds on ME1 and ME2 by exploring advanced control theory and introducing electronic components not covered in earlier courses, giving you the knowledge to design and realise a complete mechatronic system. As an enhanced version of the Level 6 module, it cannot be taken for credit alongside that course."}, {"title": "Nuclear Fusion B", "description": "The module will provide an introduction to the theoretical concepts of fusion, including the necessary physics for understanding potential applications."}, {"title": "Nuclear Reactor Physics", "description": "Broaden your understanding of the reactor physics of nuclear reactors, including neutron conservation and neutron diffusion."}, {"title": "Nuclear Thermal Hydraulics", "description": "Analyse turbulent flow and heat transfer in both single-phase and two-phase systems within nuclear reactors."}, {"title": "Robot Dynamics and Control", "description": "This module introduces the core theory of robot dynamics and control, with a strong emphasis on applying these concepts to practical problems. You will also explore the control of rigid multibody systems and flexible structures, gaining experience that connects theory to real engineering challenges."}, {"title": "Statistics B", "description": "This module aims to develop statistical methods and procedures that can be confidently applied and the results reported in a professional manner revealing both good understanding and interpretation."}, {"title": "Stress Analysis 3B", "description": "Further develop your understanding of stress analysis theories and techniques."}, {"title": "Structure, Properties and Applications of Polymers B", "description": "This module aims to develop an understanding of the mechanical properties, processing characteristics and failure modes of the principal classes of polymers, in terms of their structure and to use such data for material selection."}, {"title": "Sustainable Engineering Design", "description": "This module explores how mechanical engineers can design and manufacture products, processes, and systems in ways that are ethical, energy-efficient, and environmentally responsible. Using the UN Sustainable Development Goals as a foundation, you will learn sustainability frameworks and assessment methods to create solutions that minimise impact and support long-term viability."}, {"title": "Tribology B", "description": "This Level 7 Tribology module introduces the key concepts of friction, lubrication, and wear, with a focus on the design and performance of lubricated machine components. It builds on the Level 6 version (which cannot be taken for credit alongside it) and equips you with the knowledge and resources to address tribological challenges you may encounter in future engineering careers."}]}, "Optional modules – Group C": {"items": [{"title": "Inter Departmental Exchange (IDX) modules", "description": "There are multiple modules available through Inter Departmental Exchange (IDX). These modules allow you to take a module from another discipline, preparing you for interdisciplinary work. title: Medical Biosciences BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Assess the critical challenges facing human health and develop your management potential.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Chemistry of Biological Interactions", "description": "Investigate the role that chemicals and macromolecules play at the cellular, molecular, and system levels, using examples to illustrate their real-world implications."}, {"title": "Integrative Body Systems", "description": "Learn how the nervous system controls and regulates the functioning of the body, and the fundamentals of the musculoskeletal system."}, {"title": "Lab Pod 1", "description": "Explore real scientific questions in a supportive, yet challenging environment, modelled after an active research lab, and experience the excitement of performing scientific research."}, {"title": "Molecular & Cellular Biology", "description": "Gain a thorough understanding of molecular biology and cellular biology in order to comprehend the impact of these disciplines on human health."}, {"title": "Statistics", "description": "Learn how to explore data sets and undertake rigorous statistical analysis. "}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Genetics & Genomics", "description": "Find out how DNA differs between and within individuals, and how genetic linkage mapping and DNA sequencing detect these differences."}, {"title": "Lab Pod 2", "description": "Test your own hypotheses in teams based on an individual research problem."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Microbiome in Health & Disease", "description": "Explore how microbiota influence human health and disease and become familiar with the key platforms and methods that characterise the microbiome."}, {"title": "Pharmacology & Toxicology", "description": "Analyse the concepts that underpin pharmacology and toxicology and evaluate the pharmacological and toxicological responses of key therapeutic agents."}, {"title": "Stem Cells & Reproductive Biology", "description": "Obtain an understanding of stem cell biology from embryonic and adult stem cells, including aspects of mammalian development and reproduction, and how these cells can be used in basic research, disease modelling, and in regenerative medicine."}, {"title": "Cancer Biology", "description": "Learn about basic carcinogenesis, tumour biology, and personalised medicine."}, {"title": "Cardiovascular & Thoracic Biology", "description": "Analyse the basic physiology of the heart and lungs and begin to understand how genetics and the environment contribute to heart and lung disease."}, {"title": "Immunology & Inflammation", "description": "Get a deeper understanding of the physiology of the immune system, including how it functions, develops, and interacts with pathogens."}, {"title": "Neuroscience", "description": "Examine nervous system function and dysfunction, from molecules to disease, using case studies to create a real-life context for the knowledge acquired."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core project modules": {"items": [{"title": "Laboratory Based Research Project (duration: 20 weeks)", "description": "Conduct five months of research in a 'wet' or 'dry' lab, in areas such as cell biology, stem cells, regeneration, clinical, data science, or computational research among many others."}, {"title": "Literature Based Research Project (duration: 14 weeks)", "description": "Research a topic of your interest within or related to biomedical sciences in depth or analyse a relevant major health issue, focusing on associated theories and developments."}, {"title": "Work Placement Based Project (duration: 14 weeks)", "description": "Gain real-world experience and apply theoretical skills by working in a relevant organisation in the public, private or third sector."}]}, "Compulsory project modules": {"items": [{"title": "Creative Reflection on Professional Practice (CREF)", "description": "Develop skills in creative reflection to think critically about your learning experiences to date and explore new creative activities with professional guest artists."}, {"title": "Science Communication & Public Engagement Advanced (SCPE-A)", "description": "Understand the social contexts that underpin communication of biomedical sciences and apply this to practical, public focused communications in a variety of media."}]}, "Optional project modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biology of Ageing", "description": "Develop analytical and data evaluation skills, and learn how ageing and genetics impact neurodegenerative disorders."}, {"title": "Biomedicine Data Science", "description": "Evaluate which machine learning algorithms are appropriate for different research questions, analyse the outputs of these algorithms on large biomedical datasets, and visualise the results."}, {"title": "Designing Drugs for the 21st Century", "description": "Learn how drugs are developed from chemists and industry professionals, who will give you insight into their own career paths and patient involvement."}, {"title": "Ethics and Medical Regulation", "description": "This module invites students to evaluate the purpose and value of biomedical research within society in order to critique from an ethical perspective the current regulatory framework in the UK. The focus will be on the regulation of clinical trials including research in low income settings. Historical context will be provided through discussion of major scandals and controversies from the 20th century and more recently. Students will explore the ability of co-production and community engagement in the development and design of clinical research to promote issues autonomy and issues of justice and equity."}, {"title": "Global Health", "description": "Look at global disease trends from a public health, political, ethical, and epidemiological perspective."}, {"title": "Innovation and Translation in Medicine", "description": "Understand the steps needed to establish research-led thinking to the development of transformational medical technologies and devices."}, {"title": "Nanobiology & Biomaterials", "description": "Learn how biomaterials and nanomaterials are used in biomedical research, clinical trials, and treatments."}, {"title": "Obesity & Diabetes", "description": "Deepen your understanding of obesity prevalence, diabetes medications, appetite control, bariatric surgery, and genetics."}, {"title": "Regenerative Medicine", "description": "Examine regenerative medicine strategies to repair and rebuild organs including stem cells, endogenous repair and biomaterials."}, {"title": "Precision Medicine", "description": "Evaluate the major resources and analyses available for large-scale biological data; compare \"big data\" and \"precision medicine\" approaches."}, {"title": "Science Communication & Public Engagement (SCPE)", "description": "Learn practical skills for communicating biomedical sciences to a range of non-expert audiences."}, {"title": "Targeting Antimicrobial Resistance", "description": "Analyse how antimicrobial drugs work, how bacteria develop resistance to them, and what consequences this has for patients."}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Medical Biosciences Master Scholarship": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Medical Biosciences Master Scholarship": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Medicine MBBS/BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Study medicine with an integrated approach and start your career with an MBBS and BSc qualification. Applications for this course are now closed.
structure_json: {"Phase 1 (years 1-3)": {"groups": {"Phase 1a modules": {"items": [{"title": "Principles of Medicine", "description": "Gain an understanding of the key concepts in health and disease and develop your research and clinical skills in integrated classes."}, {"title": "Bioregulatory Systems 1a", "description": "Explore areas such as neurology, endocrinology, dermatology, cardiovascular and respiratory biology, and gastroenterology."}, {"title": "Clinical and Scientific Integration 1a", "description": "Prepare for clinical practice by developing your reasoning skills through authentic clinical cases."}, {"title": "Patients, Communities and Healthcare 1a", "description": "Discover how the biological, psychological and social aspects of health, illness and disease interact with each other to impact on patient experiences and on health outcomes."}, {"title": "Lifestyle Medicine and Prevention 1a", "description": "Develop a foundation of skills to support patients to make positive behaviour changes using evidence-based strategies, including communication skills."}]}, "Phase 1b modules": {"items": [{"title": "Bioregulatory Systems 1b", "description": "Build upon previous modules to enhance your knowledge and understanding of human health and disease and develop professional skills and values."}, {"title": "Clinical and Scientific Integration 1b", "description": "Link theory to practice with a focus on applying the science of complex adaptive systems to clinical care."}, {"title": "Patients, Communities and Healthcare 1b", "description": "Broaden your communication skills and practice simple bedside/couch tests and procedures on patients in a ward-based clinical environment."}, {"title": "Lifestyle Medicine and Prevention 1b", "description": "Deepen your skills in working with patients to make positive behaviour changes and consider patients' lifestyle choices in the context of social determinants of health."}, {"title": "Clinical Research and Innovation", "description": "Discover the skills required to understand scientific aspects behind the practice of medicine through research experience and integrated classes."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Your I-Explore module offers you choices from a range of subjects hosted outside of the department. You will be taught alongside students from other courses with options including business, management and many more."}]}, "Phase 1c module": {"items": [{"title": "Patients, Communities and Healthcare 1c", "description": "Prepare for your transition to predominantly clinical settings by undertaking a community apprenticeship in general practice (Medicine in the Community Apprenticeship (MICA)), plus clinical placements within secondary care medical (Medicine) and surgical (Surgery) teams."}]}}}, "Phase 2 (year 4)": {"groups": {}}, "Phase 3 (years 5-6)": {"groups": {"Phase 3a modules": {"items": [{"title": "Patients, Communities and Healthcare 3a", "description": "Identify experiential learning strategies for healthcare delivery settings and reflect on the professional values, behaviours and responsibilities required to be involved in direct patient care."}, {"title": "Pathology", "description": "Develop your knowledge further by using pathological patterns, data and appropriate laboratory investigations to make a clinical diagnosis, management plan and assess progress and outcome."}]}, "Phase 3b modules": {"items": [{"title": "Patients, Communities and Healthcare 3b", "description": "This is the second part of this module and continues on the same topics."}, {"title": "Preparedness for Practice", "description": "Undertake a pre-foundation elective and a pre-foundation assistantship and learn practical skills such as organising ward rounds, writing notes, recommending prescriptions, making referrals and carrying out core procedures."}]}}}, "A-levels": title: Medicine (Graduate Entry) (MBBS 4YFT) | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Study at the Pears Cumbria School of Medicine (PCSM), a collaborative and inclusive medical school embedded in the communities of Cumbria, training clinicians who are innovative, adaptable and focused on the delivery of high-quality person-centred care. Applications for this course are now closed.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Medical Sciences 1", "description": "Explore the anatomy and physiology of the major organ systems with a focus on how pathophysiology underpins disease."}, {"title": "Clinical Skills and Professional Practice 1", "description": "Develop your clinical skills and professionalism and explore the roles and responsibilities of a medical student and a doctor."}, {"title": "Prevention and Healthcare Delivery 1", "description": "Explore the social, psychological, and behavioural factors that contribute to health and healthcare delivery."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Medical Sciences 2", "description": "Integrate the key concepts introduced in Medical Sciences 1 to adopt an evidence-informed approach to managing patients with multiple long-term conditions."}, {"title": "Clinical Skills and Professional Practice 2", "description": "Further develop your clinical skills and professionalism; undertake clinical placements across the region, in general practice, community and mental health, and medical and surgical secondary care."}, {"title": "Prevention and Healthcare Delivery 2", "description": "Deepen your understanding of the key concepts in social sciences and population health, while considering the practical aspects of applying research and healthcare data to improve health outcomes."}]}}}, "Year 3 & 4": {"groups": {"Year 3": {"items": [{"title": "Clinical Skills and Professional Practice 3", "description": "Experience situational learning on clinical placement across the region, in a range of specialties, in both community and secondary care."}]}, "Year 4": {"items": [{"title": "Clinical Skills and Professional Practice 4", "description": "Builds further on clinical skills, the professional capabilities, and the knowledge that is required for the Medical Licencing Assessment. The module also includes a pre-foundation assistantship and an elective period."}]}}}, "Academic requirements": {"groups": {"Academic requirements": {"items": []}, "Subject requirements": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions tests (GAMSAT or UCAT)": {"groups": {"Admissions Test (GAMSAT or UCAT)": {"items": []}, "Admissions requirement": {"items": []}}}, "English requirements": {"groups": {}}, "Widening participation": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

course_overview: Build on your study of Medicine with the chance to complete a PhD as part of your course. Applications for this course are now closed.

title: Microbiology BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Focus your study on all types of microorganisms, acquiring the theoretical and practical skills needed for a career in microbiology.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Biological Chemistry and Microbiology", "description": "Build your understanding of living systems in terms of their underlying physics and chemistry."}, {"title": "Evolution and Diversity", "description": "Make sense of the diversity of the living world and the ways in which it has changed over the past 4.6 billion years."}, {"title": "Cell Biology and Genetics", "description": "Explore the behaviour of living cells and how they are influenced by both genetics and their environment."}, {"title": "Ecology and Evolution", "description": "Discover how the planet's biological diversity is organised by ecological processes, and develop skills in statistics, experimental design, and practical field-work."}, {"title": "Core Skills for Life Scientists", "description": "Develop core skills in analysis, data use, and communication to support your studies and future modules."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Applied Molecular Biology", "description": "Understand modern molecular and cell biology techniques and appreciate how such techniques are used in biological disciplines. You'll also explore bioinformatics and its role in genomics and molecular biology."}, {"title": "Genetics", "description": "Further your knowledge of key aspects of genetics study and learn about the increasingly important applied use of genetics in the 21st Century. Acquire in-depth knowledge of standard genetics/molecular biology techniques."}, {"title": "Bioinformatics, Programming and Statistics (BS)", "description": "Understand the rapid developments in computational, statistical and bioinformatic life sciences. Utilise statistical modelling and bioinformatic tools to understand complex biological datasets and make evidenced inferences."}, {"title": "Tutored Dissertation", "description": "Complete a tutored dissertation in an area of microbiology."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}, {"title": "Molecular Microbiology", "description": "Gain a fundamental understanding of molecular bacteriology. You'll also study the nature of viruses and how they progress."}, {"title": "Immunology", "description": "Enhance your knowledge of the organisation, development, and regulation of the immune system in health and disease."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Molecular and Cell Biology Skills", "description": "Develop the skills required to perform a range of molecular and cell biology investigations of prokaryotic and eukaryotic systems."}, {"title": "Computational Omics", "description": "Acquire the skills to perform computational analysis of genomic and protein sequences, with training in Linux, Python and running sequence analysis programs on the command line."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Optional modules – Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Metabolic & Network Engineering", "description": "Discover the theory and methodology that is used to engineer biology for an applied objective and build your awareness of the design, engineering and evaluation of biocatalytic systems."}, {"title": "Medical Microbiology", "description": "Gain an appreciation of the fine balance that exists between infectious agents and their human hosts and understand the nature of the immune response to selected infectious agents."}]}, "Optional modules – Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Symbiosis, Plant Immunity and Disease", "description": "Further your understanding of the molecular features of a number of representative plant-microbe interactions."}, {"title": "Advanced Topics in Infection & Immunity", "description": "Gain an insight into state-of-the-art infection and immunity research used to to address the specific problems of infections by a whole host of pathogens."}, {"title": "Disease Ecology and Epidemiology", "description": "Gain a grounding in the basic biology of diseases. Find out how we measure and model disease processes and learn about the ecological and evolutionary drivers of disease."}]}, "Optional modules – Group C": {"items": [{"title": "The Microbiome", "description": "Explore key microbial groups and broaden your knowledge on how ecological and evolutionary theories underpin our understanding of microbial communities."}, {"title": "Molecular Basis of Bacterial Infection", "description": "Develop an understanding of some of the fundamental principles of infectious diseases and expand your knowledge of biochemical, molecular and cellular technologies."}, {"title": "Synthetic Biology", "description": "Expand your knowledge on the principles of genetic engineering, synthetic biology and the design of biological machines."}, {"title": "Advanced Immunology", "description": "Develop a deeper appreciation of immunology and explore the mechanisms of cellular immunoregulation. You'll also examine the role of the immune system in cancer development and immunotherapies in treating cancer."}]}, "Optional modules – Group D": {"items": [{"title": "Science Communication plus Literature Research Project (Research Proposal)", "description": "Gain an overview of different methods of communication and understand how these are used to disseminate scientific content. "}, {"title": "Practical Research Project (Lab, Computational, Field)", "description": "Carry out a 10 week, full time research project, and build confidence in applying scientific methods to real-world life science problems. "}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "International Baccalaureate": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants": {"items": []}}}, "Other qualifications": {"groups": {"UK qualifications": {"items": []}, "International qualifications": {"items": []}}}, "Admissions test and interview": {"groups": {}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "Foundation programmes": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Tuition Fee Loan": {"items": []}, "Living cost loan": {"items": []}, "Imperial Bursary": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Extra costs": {"items": []}}}}

title: Molecular Bioengineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Explore engineering, biology and chemistry to understand how vital molecular level interactions can benefit human health
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Molecules and Energetics 1", "description": "Develop a foundational understanding of the chemistry and materials science principles related to bioengineering. Cultivate wet lab skills in preparing a range of biomaterials and practising key classification techniques."}, {"title": "Medical and Biochemical Science 1", "description": "Understand the underlying molecular basis of cellular and sub-cellular processes in cells and key concepts engineers use to interpret literature and models of cells."}, {"title": "Mathematics and Engineering 1", "description": "Acquire a platform of mathematical knowledge and understand the basic principles of physics, electrical and mechanical engineering."}, {"title": "Computer Fundamentals and Programming 1", "description": "Learn the fundamentals of digital logic design and computer programming as you examine how digital computers communicate with the real world."}, {"title": "Design and Professional Practice 1", "description": "Discover the principles of engineering design and broaden your practical skills as you utilise appropriate tools and software to solve a variety of design problems."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Molecules, Materials and Measurement 2", "description": "Extend your knowledge of materials and thermodynamics by examining how thermodynamics and quantum physics underpin the physical behaviour of materials-based systems."}, {"title": "Medical and Biochemical Science 2", "description": "Build upon your earlier studies as you explore new cellular and physiological concepts and uncover the regulators and modulators of gene expression. Broaden your wet lab skills and experience and learn a range of lab techniques."}, {"title": "Mathematics and Engineering 2", "description": "Advance your knowledge of electronics and mechanics through an introduction to electromagnetics and solid and fluid mechanics. Understand the principles of signals and control and practise solving mathematical, signals and control, electrical and mechanical problems posed in a bioengineering context."}, {"title": "Design and Professional Practice 2", "description": "Harness the principles of engineering design and professional practice while collaborating on a Design, Make and Test group project. Work in a team to tackle a real design problem, broadening your engineering design skills and applying learning from other modules to a practical challenge."}, {"title": "Programming 2", "description": "Advance your programming knowledge by extending the principles introduced in ANSCI C language across to the study of C++. Engage in labs focusing on more complex programming skills, including data structures, object-oriented programming and algorithm design."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Probability and Statistics for Bioengineering", "description": "Examine probability theory and the mathematical concepts that underlie statistical models. Learn how to apply statistical models to real-world data and equip yourself with the statistical skills and knowledge required for the advanced years of your Bioengineering programme."}, {"title": "Bioengineering Group Project", "description": "Cultivate skills in project management, planning, collaboration, communication and evaluation as you work in teams on a chosen research project. Your project may take various forms and could focus on design, computational work, bench work, extended literature reviews, or creating props for outreach programmes."}, {"title": "Biomaterials for Bioengineers", "description": "Examine the major classes of biomedical implant materials (including metals, ceramics and polymers), focusing on their clinical use as replacements for body parts or tissue and the various reasons for failure."}, {"title": "Foundations of Synthetic Biology", "description": "Study the principles of genetic engineering, synthetic biology and the design of biological machines. Extend your understanding of computational modelling of biological systems through practical application, and work on a mini i-Gem project using synthetic biology principles, computer modelling, ethics and experimental design."}, {"title": "Modelling in Biology", "description": "Uncover the mathematical and computational modelling techniques used in biology and physiology. Explore nonlinear dynamics, networks in biology and the basics of stochastic processes in biology and medicine, and apply theory to practice as you develop your own models using MATLAB."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Image Processing", "description": "Examine digital image processing and image analysis methods, and develop an appreciation of the computation involved in interpreting or 'parsing' images. Learn about the biomedical, clinical and research applications of image processing and computer vision."}, {"title": "Digital Biosignal Processing", "description": "Uncover the fundamental principles and techniques for representing, transforming and processing discrete-time signals. Deepen your knowledge through the practical implementation of theoretical concepts in biomedical applications."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Bioengineers", "description": "Leverage your existing programming skills and gain experience working in a development team on a significant bioengineering software project. Learn software engineering tools, including those required for project lifecycle management, requirements capture, design, modelling, testing and effective teamwork."}, {"title": "Human Centred Assistive and Rehabilitation Devices", "description": "Learn how to design intuitive and efficient rehabilitation systems and assistive devices, integrating mechatronics, human factors and computer games. Understand how to assess current and emergent systems against the principles of human-centred design."}, {"title": "Tissue Engineering and Regenerative Medicine", "description": "Understand the fundamental concepts of tissue development and learn how researchers are using these concepts to imitate nature in a lab setting, engineering cells and tissues that may be used to model diseases, treat diseases or develop drugs."}, {"title": "Advanced Imaging Technologies for Systems Biology and Biomedical Research", "description": "Learn how to critically evaluate and carefully design imaging experiments in order to analyse dynamic processes in complex biological systems."}, {"title": "Industrial Applications of Cellular Engineering", "description": "Uncover the broad industrial and societal applications of cellular engineering and synthetic biology research. Learn how engineering cell behaviours has applications in fields such as industrial biotechnology, sustainable agriculture, biomedicine and pharmaceutical production."}, {"title": "Biomimetics*", "description": "Discover the new interdisciplinary field of biomimetics, which explores how functional principles found in nature can inspire scientists and engineers to solve outstanding technological problems."}, {"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis*", "description": "Develop your skills further by exploring the core aspects of biological and clinical measurement and research topics such as: data handling and fitness for purpose, chemical measurement in cells, bioassays and other detection methods, and challenges of non-invasive chemical monitoring of human tissue."}, {"title": "Cellular and Molecular Mechanotransduction*", "description": "Develop your clinical understanding and learn to analyse cell function, with a particular emphasis on sub-cellular structures and functions involved in processes by which cells transform mechanical stimuli into biochemical signalling."}, {"title": "Bioengineering Approaches to Cancer*", "description": "Build upon your clinical understanding of the development, progression and challenges facing cancer management. Investigate how engineering principles and next generation technologies can be developed and best applied to the understanding and management of cancer."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Project*", "description": "Draw upon the knowledge and skills you've developed throughout your degree to tackle an unfamiliar research problem. Gain an understanding of the research environment as you work independently on a year-long research project that will address unanswered questions and challenges within an area of bioengineering."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Synthetic Biology*", "description": "Dive deeper into BioBrick concepts and explore advanced topics in synthetic biology. You will review the latest scientific literature and apply your knowledge as you devise solutions to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Advanced Chemical Sensors*", "description": "Examine the different methods for sensing and monitoring (bio)analytes and (bio)metabolites, both in vitro and in vivo. Learn the basic chemical sensing principles involved in these technologies, along with their biomedical applications and commercial considerations."}, {"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis*", "description": "Analyse and discuss the scientific literature relating to core aspects of biological and clinical measurement.  Broaden your understanding of data handling and fitness for purpose, chemical measurement in cells and in vivo, challenges of non-invasive chemical monitoring of human tissue and approaches to invasive monitoring of tissue."}, {"title": "Principles of Biomedical Imaging*", "description": "Understand how images of the human body can be obtained using different forms of penetrating radiation. Explore the underlying systems, technologies and operating principles behind the imaging modalities of x-ray, computer tomography (CT), magnetic resonance (MRI), ultrasound, and general optical imaging work."}, {"title": "Non-ionising Functional and Tissue Imaging*", "description": "Explore ultrasound, MRI and light-based imaging and find out what information on the anatomy, composition and physiology of the human body these non-ionising imaging modalities can provide. Learn how to analyse images obtained through these methods and their range of clinical applications."}, {"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship*", "description": "Gain insight into the process and challenges involved in the development of new products in the medical sector. Analyse case studies and hear guest presentations from startups, investment firms and entrepreneurs and learn from their experiences in bringing medical devices to market."}, {"title": "Animal Locomotion and Bioinspired Robots*", "description": "Receive practical training in bio-inspired robotics locomotion and learn about selected topics in animal locomotion. Consolidate your theoretical knowledge by participating in hands-on activities and reinforce your engineering skills through the implementation of mechatronics systems."}, {"title": "Biomimetics*", "description": "Discover the new interdisciplinary field of biomimetics, which explores how functional principles found in nature can inspire scientists and engineers to solve outstanding technological problems."}, {"title": "Biomaterials for Biomedicine and Sustainability*", "description": "Examine the frontiers of biomaterials research and innovation by exploring the development of new biomaterials and highlighting their functionalities in various fields of application. Dive into their synthesis through the use of state-of-art technology such as synthetic biology and chemistry and biomimetic engineering."}, {"title": "Industrial Applications of Cellular Engineering*", "description": "Discover how engineering cell behaviours impact industrial biotechnology and the bioproduction of chemicals, sustainable agriculture, the environment and biofuels. Learn how academic research can lead to applied science with direct impact in industry and society."}, {"title": "Nanotechnologies for Cancer Diagnosis and Cancer Therapy*", "description": "Assess the latest in nanotechnological advances in the field of cancer diagnostics and cancer therapies. You'll explore how academic research can directly impact, through applied science, the way cancer patients are screened, diagnosed, monitored and treated. Developing your skills in molecular bioengineering and its applications in: development of screening tools, diagnosis at the point of care and nanotechnologies for targeted drug delivery."}, {"title": "Neuroscience*", "description": "Discover the core neuroscience concepts and explore the 'state of the art' in regards to methodology and learn to provide multi-level descriptions of common brain disorders."}]}, "Optional modules - Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Medical Device Entrepreneurship*", "description": "Assess and discover the key information and skills needed by professional engineering in development of medical systems and devices. You'll explore product development for medical devices as well as safety, hazards and safe working practice."}, {"title": "Business for Professional Engineers and Scientists", "description": "Extend your practical knowledge across a range of business and management topics and gain an understanding of the financial, strategic, operational and organisational context in which engineering and science takes place."}, {"title": "Medical Device Certification*", "description": "Assess and discover the key information and skills needed by professional engineering in development of medical systems and devices. You'll explore product development for medical devices as well as safety, hazards and safe working practice."}]}}}, "Year 4  (Year Abroad)": {"groups": {}}, "Year 4 (Year in Industry)": {"groups": {}}, "Year 5": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Project", "description": "Draw upon the knowledge and skills you've developed throughout your degree to tackle an unfamiliar research problem. Gain an understanding of the research environment as you work independently on a year-long research project that will address unanswered questions and challenges within an area of bioengineering."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Synthetic Biology*", "description": "Dive deeper into BioBrick concepts and explore advanced topics in synthetic biology. You will review the latest scientific literature and apply your knowledge as you devise solutions to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Advanced Chemical Sensors*", "description": "Examine the different methods for sensing and monitoring (bio)analytes and (bio)metabolites, both in vitro and in vivo. Learn the basic chemical sensing principles involved in these technologies, along with their biomedical applications and commercial considerations."}, {"title": "Advanced Physiological Monitoring and Data Analysis*", "description": "Analyse and discuss the scientific literature relating to core aspects of biological and clinical measurement.  Broaden your understanding of data handling and fitness for purpose, chemical measurement in cells and in vivo, challenges of non-invasive chemical monitoring of human tissue and approaches to invasive monitoring of tissue."}, {"title": "Principles of Biomedical Imaging*", "description": "Understand how images of the human body can be obtained using different forms of penetrating radiation. Explore the underlying systems, technologies and operating principles behind the imaging modalities of x-ray, computer tomography (CT), magnetic resonance (MRI), ultrasound, and general optical imaging work."}, {"title": "Molecular and Tissue Imaging*", "description": "Explore ultrasound, MRI and light-based imaging and find out what information on the anatomy, composition and physiology of the human body these non-ionising imaging modalities can provide. title: Physics BSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Broaden your understanding of fundamental and applied physics in this professionally accredited degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Practical Physics: Laboratory, Computing and Problem Solving", "description": "Build your laboratory and computing skills and receive training in a range of experimental techniques covering several areas of physics."}, {"title": "Vector Fields, Electricity and Magnetism", "description": "Become familiar with the key concepts of vector calculus and use them to provide a foundational introduction to electricity and magnetism."}, {"title": "Mechanics and Relativity", "description": "Develop your understanding of the mathematics and physics of motion in space and time and advance your knowledge of classical mechanics."}, {"title": "Oscillations and Waves", "description": "Gain an in-depth knowledge of oscillation and waves and appreciate their importance in multiple areas of basic physics."}, {"title": "Statistics of Measurement and the Summer Project", "description": "Further develop your understanding of several practical aspects of physics and carry out a project in either practical physics, computational physics, or a blend of the two."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Electronics", "description": "Build your knowledge of circuit design and learn how to build simple circuits."}, {"title": "Mathematical Analysis", "description": "Learn to think \"like a mathematician\" and understand the mathematics underlying notions of limits and infinity, with particular emphasis on the underpinnings of Calculus."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Practical Physics", "description": "Advance your skills developed in Year 1 laboratory and computing by carrying out and exploring complex physical phenomena, analysing data using Python and utilising advanced coding techniques to carry out programming projects."}, {"title": "Thermal Physics and the Structure of Matter", "description": "Receive a grounding in the structure of matter at the microscopic and macroscopic levels and explore thermodynamics and statistical physics."}, {"title": "Differential Equations and Electromagnetism", "description": "Analyse various topics in electromagnetism (EM) and develop your knowledge of linear differential equations (DEs)."}, {"title": "Quantum Physics", "description": "Study the formal framework of quantum mechanics and apply this knowledge to atomic physics to explain the structure and behaviour of hydrogen and more complex atoms."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All of our undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Communicating Physics", "description": "Spend time in a local school, supporting teaching whilst gaining experience of the science education children experience."}, {"title": "Suns, Stars and Planets", "description": "Become familiar with the structure and evolution of the Sun and other stars, and learn about the key physical principles that determine the state of the planets in our own Solar System."}, {"title": "Mathematical Methods", "description": "Review several mathematical techniques fundamental for performing computations across physics and necessary for a proper formulation of its foundations. This includes analytic continuation, residues, integral transforms, calculus of variations, linear algebra including suffix notation."}, {"title": "Environmental Physics", "description": "Understand the application of core physical concepts to the Earth system, and develop a critical, practical awareness of global environmental change."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Third Year Physics Laboratory", "description": "Undertake three experimental investigations and develop a broad range of practical and intellectual skills."}, {"title": "Nuclear and Particle Physics", "description": "Examine the physics of elementary particles and nuclei, explore concepts associated with symmetries and use relativistic kinematics to calculate simple interactions."}, {"title": "Comprehensives", "description": "Test your problem-solving ability using the basic principles of physics before applying them to unfamiliar situations."}, {"title": "Solid State Physics", "description": "Cover the fundamentals of the physics of solids and explore how the properties of solids are determined by microscopic physics."}]}, "Optional modules - Projects": {"items": [{"title": "Self-Study Module", "description": "You will have the opportunity to carry out an independent research project into a current area of research within physics. This will strengthen your understanding of a specific topic and allow you to develop key research skills such as critically analysing scientific literature and synthesising information relevant to your area of study."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Lasers", "description": "Obtain a mathematically rigorous understanding of laser physics and examine the basic mechanisms of laser action and how real-world lasers operate."}, {"title": "Physics of Medical Imaging and Radiotherapy", "description": "Analyse a range of clinical imaging modalities and radiotherapies and understand the physical principles underlying the interactions of x-ray radiation with tissue."}, {"title": "Principles of Instrumentation", "description": "Investigate the principles and practice of instrument science and use a prototyping system to build and characterise key instrument components."}, {"title": "Plasma Physics", "description": "Discover the broad range of physical phenomena which determine the behaviour of plasmas and the importance of collective effects."}, {"title": "Statistical Mechanics", "description": "Study how the co-operative behaviour of many simple constituents can lead to the emergence of new physics, and investigate continuous phase transitions."}, {"title": "Foundations of Quantum Mechanics", "description": "Acquire the mathematical techniques and conceptual background required to understand the foundations of quantum mechanics."}, {"title": "Computational Physics", "description": "Build your understanding of the finite difference methods used to solve differential equations in physics."}, {"title": "Astrophysics", "description": "Apply physical concepts from your earlier studies to explain the formation, existence, and appearance of astronomical objects."}, {"title": "Group Theory", "description": "Become fluent in the language of representation theory and confident in its applications to non-relativistic quantum mechanics."}]}, "Optional modules - Group B": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Particle Physics", "description": "Study the \"Standard Model\" (SM) of particle physics and assess both its advantages and limitations."}, {"title": "General Relativity", "description": "Develop your understanding of general relativity (GR), Einstein's theory of gravity, and understand the new, relativistic world view of four-dimensional Lorentzian spacetime."}, {"title": "Cosmology", "description": "Learn the basics of modern cosmology, and study the foundations of the Hot Big Bang theory."}, {"title": "Hydrodynamics", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts of shocks and gain a thorough understanding of compressible flow and its importance in supersonic motion."}, {"title": "Space Physics", "description": "Unpick the key physical theories that control the properties of different space plasmas and plasma phenomena."}, {"title": "Quantum Information", "description": "Analyse the fundamental principles and applications of quantum information and their realisation."}, {"title": "Laser Technology", "description": "Assess key laser applications and commercially important lasers and build your understanding of nonlinear
